content: 1 Now these are the names of the Sons of Israel, who came into Egypt,—with Jacob did each man and his household come in:—
content_old: 1 Now these are the names of the Sons of Israel, who came into Egypt,—with Jacob did each man and his household come in:—

content: 2 Reuben､ Simeon, Levi､ and Judah;
content_old: 2 Reuben､ Simeon, Levi､ and Judah;

content: 3 Issachar､ Zebulon､ and Benjamin;
content_old: 3 Issachar､ Zebulon､ and Benjamin;

content: 4 Dan and Naphtali､ Gad and Asher.
content_old: 4 Dan and Naphtali､ Gad and Asher.

content: 5 And it came to pass that all the persons who were descended from Jacob were seventy souls,—but Joseph was already in Egypt.
content_old: 5 And it came to pass that all the persons who were descended from Jacob were seventy souls,—but Joseph was already in Egypt.

content: 6 So then Joseph died､ and all his brethren, and all that generation.
content_old: 6 So then Joseph died､ and all his brethren, and all that generation.

content: 7 But the sons of Israel were fruitful､ and swarmed and multiplied and waxed mighty､ with exceeding vigour,—so that the land was filled with them.
content_old: 7 But the sons of Israel were fruitful､ and swarmed and multiplied and waxed mighty､ with exceeding vigour,—so that the land was filled with them.

content: 8 Then arose a new king over Egypt,—who had not known Joseph.
content_old: 8 Then arose a new king over Egypt,—who had not known Joseph.

content: 9 So he said､ unto his people,— Lo! the people of the sons of Israel are too many and mighty for us!
content_old: 9 So he said､ unto his people,— Lo! the people of the sons of Israel are too many and mighty for us!

content: 10 Come on! let us shew ourselves wise with regard to them,—lest they so multiply that it shall come to pass when war befalleth us that they also shall join themselves unto them who hate us, and shall make war upon us､ and then go up out of the land.
content_old: 10 Come on! let us shew ourselves wise with regard to them,—lest they so multiply that it shall come to pass when war befalleth us that they also shall join themselves unto them who hate us, and shall make war upon us､ and then go up out of the land.

content: 11 So they set over them chiefs of tribute, to the end they might humiliate them with their burdens,—and they built store-cities for Pharaoh, even Pithom and Raamses.
content_old: 11 So they set over them chiefs of tribute, to the end they might humiliate them with their burdens,—and they built store-cities for Pharaoh, even Pithom and Raamses.

content: 12 But the more they were humiliating them the more were they multiplying､ and the more were they breaking forth,—so they were filled with alarm､ because of the sons of Israel.
content_old: 12 But the more they were humiliating them the more were they multiplying､ and the more were they breaking forth,—so they were filled with alarm､ because of the sons of Israel.

content: 13 And the Egyptians rigorously made the sons of Israel serve;
content_old: 13 And the Egyptians rigorously made the sons of Israel serve;

content: 14 and embittered their lives with harsh service､ in clay and in bricks, and in all manner of service in the field,—all their service, wherein they rigorously made them serve.
content_old: 14 and embittered their lives with harsh service､ in clay and in bricks, and in all manner of service in the field,—all their service, wherein they rigorously made them serve.

content: 15 Then said the king of Egypt to the Hebrew midwives,—of whom the name of the one was Shiphrah and the name of the other Puah;—
content_old: 15 Then said the king of Egypt to the Hebrew midwives,—of whom the name of the one was Shiphrah and the name of the other Puah;—

content: 16 then he said— When ye act as midwives unto the Hebrew women then shall ye look out for the sex,— If it is a son then shall ye kill it, But if it is a daughter then shall it live.
content_old: 16 then he said— When ye act as midwives unto the Hebrew women then shall ye look out for the sex,— If it is a son then shall ye kill it, But if it is a daughter then shall it live.

content: 17 But the midwives feared God, and did not as the king of Egypt spake unto them,—but suffered the male children to live.
content_old: 17 But the midwives feared God, and did not as the king of Egypt spake unto them,—but suffered the male children to live.

content: 18 Then called the king of Egypt for the midwives, and said to them— Wherefore have ye done this thing,—that ye should let the male children live?
content_old: 18 Then called the king of Egypt for the midwives, and said to them— Wherefore have ye done this thing,—that ye should let the male children live?

content: 19 And the midwives said unto Pharaoh, Because not like the Egyptian women are the Hebrew women,—for they are full of life, ere yet the midwife can come in unto them they have given birth.
content_old: 19 And the midwives said unto Pharaoh, Because not like the Egyptian women are the Hebrew women,—for they are full of life, ere yet the midwife can come in unto them they have given birth.

content: 20 So then God dealt well with the midwives,—and the people multiplied､ and waxed exceeding mighty.
content_old: 20 So then God dealt well with the midwives,—and the people multiplied､ and waxed exceeding mighty.

content: 21 And it came to pass, because the midwives feared God that he made for them households.
content_old: 21 And it came to pass, because the midwives feared God that he made for them households.

content: 1 And there went a man of the house of Levi,—and took a daughter of Levi.
content_old: 1 And there went a man of the house of Levi,—and took a daughter of Levi.

content: 2 And the woman conceived､ and bare a son,—and she saw him, that he was a goodly child, so she hid him three months.
content_old: 2 And the woman conceived､ and bare a son,—and she saw him, that he was a goodly child, so she hid him three months.

content: 3 And when she could no longer hide him she took for him an ark of paper-reed, and covered it over with bitumen､ and with pitch,—and put therein the child, and laid it among the rushes､ upon the bank of the river.
content_old: 3 And when she could no longer hide him she took for him an ark of paper-reed, and covered it over with bitumen､ and with pitch,—and put therein the child, and laid it among the rushes､ upon the bank of the river.

content: 4 Then did his sister station herself at a distance,—to see what would be done to him.
content_old: 4 Then did his sister station herself at a distance,—to see what would be done to him.

content: 5 So then the daughter of Pharaoh came down to bathe by the river, and her maidens were walking by the side of the river,—when she saw the ark in the midst of the rushes, and sent her handmaid､ and fetched it.
content_old: 5 So then the daughter of Pharaoh came down to bathe by the river, and her maidens were walking by the side of the river,—when she saw the ark in the midst of the rushes, and sent her handmaid､ and fetched it.

content: 6 And she opened､ and beheld it—even the child, and lo! a boy weeping,—so she took pity on him, and said, Of the children of the Hebrews is this.
content_old: 6 And she opened､ and beheld it—even the child, and lo! a boy weeping,—so she took pity on him, and said, Of the children of the Hebrews is this.

content: 7 Then said his sister unto Pharaoh’s daughter, Shall I go and call thee a nurse, of the Hebrew women,—that she may nurse for thee､ the child?
content_old: 7 Then said his sister unto Pharaoh’s daughter, Shall I go and call thee a nurse, of the Hebrew women,—that she may nurse for thee､ the child?

content: 8 And Pharaoh’s daughter said to her— Go. So the maid went, and called the mother of the child.
content_old: 8 And Pharaoh’s daughter said to her— Go. So the maid went, and called the mother of the child.

content: 9 And Pharaoh’s daughter said to her— Take this child, and nurse it for me, and I will give thee thy wages. So the woman took the child､ and nursed it.
content_old: 9 And Pharaoh’s daughter said to her— Take this child, and nurse it for me, and I will give thee thy wages. So the woman took the child､ and nursed it.

content: 10 And the child grew､ and she brought him in to Pharaoh’s daughter, and he became her son. And she called his name Moses, and said— For out of the water I drew him.
content_old: 10 And the child grew､ and she brought him in to Pharaoh’s daughter, and he became her son. And she called his name Moses, and said— For out of the water I drew him.

content: 11 And it came to pass in those days when Moses grew up that he went out unto his brethren, and looked on their burdens,—and saw an Egyptian smiting a Hebrew—of his brethren.
content_old: 11 And it came to pass in those days when Moses grew up that he went out unto his brethren, and looked on their burdens,—and saw an Egyptian smiting a Hebrew—of his brethren.

content: 12 So he turned this way and that, and when he saw that there was no, man he smote the Egyptian, and hid him in the sand.
content_old: 12 So he turned this way and that, and when he saw that there was no, man he smote the Egyptian, and hid him in the sand.

content: 13 And he went out on the second day, and lo! two Hebrews striving together,—so he said to him that did the wrong, Wherefore shouldest thou smite thy fellow?
content_old: 13 And he went out on the second day, and lo! two Hebrews striving together,—so he said to him that did the wrong, Wherefore shouldest thou smite thy fellow?

content: 14 And he said��� Who hath set thee for a chief and a judge over us? To slay me art thou thinking, as thou didst slay the Egyptian? Then was Moses afraid､ and said— Surely the thing is known!
content_old: 14 And he said��� Who hath set thee for a chief and a judge over us? To slay me art thou thinking, as thou didst slay the Egyptian? Then was Moses afraid､ and said— Surely the thing is known!

content: 15 So Pharaoh heard this thing, and sought to slay Moses,—and Moses fled from the face of Pharaoh, and dwelt in the land of Midian､ and sat down by the well.
content_old: 15 So Pharaoh heard this thing, and sought to slay Moses,—and Moses fled from the face of Pharaoh, and dwelt in the land of Midian､ and sat down by the well.

content: 16 Now the priest of Midian had seven daughters,—and they came and drew､ and filled the troughs, to water their father’s flock.
content_old: 16 Now the priest of Midian had seven daughters,—and they came and drew､ and filled the troughs, to water their father’s flock.

content: 17 Then came the shepherds､ and drave them away,—so Moses rose up､ and succoured them, and watered their flock.
content_old: 17 Then came the shepherds､ and drave them away,—so Moses rose up､ and succoured them, and watered their flock.

content: 18 Then came they in､ unto Reuel their father,—and he said, Wherefore have ye so early come in､ to-day?
content_old: 18 Then came they in､ unto Reuel their father,—and he said, Wherefore have ye so early come in､ to-day?

content: 19 And they said, An Egyptian delivered us out of the hand of the shepherds,— Moreover also he drew for us, and watered the flock.
content_old: 19 And they said, An Egyptian delivered us out of the hand of the shepherds,— Moreover also he drew for us, and watered the flock.

content: 20 And he said unto his daughters— And where is he? wherefore is it that ye left the man? Call him､ that he may eat bread.
content_old: 20 And he said unto his daughters— And where is he? wherefore is it that ye left the man? Call him､ that he may eat bread.

content: 21 And Moses was well-pleased to dwell with the man,—and he gave Zipporah his daughter､ to Moses.
content_old: 21 And Moses was well-pleased to dwell with the man,—and he gave Zipporah his daughter､ to Moses.

content: 22 And she bare a son, and he called his name､ Gershom,—for he said, A sojourner I am, in a strange land.
content_old: 22 And she bare a son, and he called his name､ Gershom,—for he said, A sojourner I am, in a strange land.

content: 23 And it came to pass during those many days that the king of Egypt died, and the sons of Israel sighed by reason of the servitude､ and lamented,—and their cry for help went up to God､ by reason of the servitude.
content_old: 23 And it came to pass during those many days that the king of Egypt died, and the sons of Israel sighed by reason of the servitude､ and lamented,—and their cry for help went up to God､ by reason of the servitude.

content: 24 And God heard their groaning,—and God remembered his covenant, with Abraham､ with Isaac and with Jacob;
content_old: 24 And God heard their groaning,—and God remembered his covenant, with Abraham､ with Isaac and with Jacob;

content: 1 Now Moses was shepherding the flock of Jethro his father-in-law､ priest of Midian,—so he led forth the flock behind the desert, and came in unto the mountain of God､ to Horeb.
content_old: 1 Now Moses was shepherding the flock of Jethro his father-in-law､ priest of Midian,—so he led forth the flock behind the desert, and came in unto the mountain of God､ to Horeb.

content: 2 Then appeared the messenger of Yahweh unto him､ in a flame of fire､ from the midst of the thorn-bush,—so he looked､ and lo! the thorn-bush､ burning with fire and yet the thorn-bush was not consumed.
content_old: 2 Then appeared the messenger of Yahweh unto him､ in a flame of fire､ from the midst of the thorn-bush,—so he looked､ and lo! the thorn-bush､ burning with fire and yet the thorn-bush was not consumed.

content: 3 And Moses said, Let me turn aside､ pray､ and see this great sight,—why the thorn-bush doth not burn up.
content_old: 3 And Moses said, Let me turn aside､ pray､ and see this great sight,—why the thorn-bush doth not burn up.

content: 4 And Yahweh saw､ that he turned aside to see,—so God called unto him､ out of the midst of the thorn-bush, and said— Moses! Moses! And he said— Behold me!
content_old: 4 And Yahweh saw､ that he turned aside to see,—so God called unto him､ out of the midst of the thorn-bush, and said— Moses! Moses! And he said— Behold me!

content: 5 And he said— Do not draw nigh hither,—put off thy sandals from thy feet, for the place whereon thou art standing is holy ground.
content_old: 5 And he said— Do not draw nigh hither,—put off thy sandals from thy feet, for the place whereon thou art standing is holy ground.

content: 6 And he said— I am the God of thy father, God of Abraham､ God of Isaac､ and God of Jacob. And Moses hid his face, for he was afraid to look upon God.
content_old: 6 And he said— I am the God of thy father, God of Abraham､ God of Isaac､ and God of Jacob. And Moses hid his face, for he was afraid to look upon God.

content: 7 Then said Yahweh, I have seen the humiliation of my people､ who are in Egypt,—and their outcry have I heard､ by reason of their task-masters, for I know their pains;
content_old: 7 Then said Yahweh, I have seen the humiliation of my people､ who are in Egypt,—and their outcry have I heard､ by reason of their task-masters, for I know their pains;

content: 8 therefore have I come down to deliver them from the hand of the Egyptians､ and to take them up out of that land, into a land good and large, into a land flowing with milk and honey,—into the place of the Canaanite､ and the Hittite, and the Amorite､ and the Perizzite, and the Hivite､ and the Jebusite.
content_old: 8 therefore have I come down to deliver them from the hand of the Egyptians､ and to take them up out of that land, into a land good and large, into a land flowing with milk and honey,—into the place of the Canaanite､ and the Hittite, and the Amorite､ and the Perizzite, and the Hivite､ and the Jebusite.

content: 9 Now therefore､ lo! the outcry of the sons of Israel hath come in unto me,—moreover also I have seen the oppression, wherewith the Egyptians are oppressing them.
content_old: 9 Now therefore､ lo! the outcry of the sons of Israel hath come in unto me,—moreover also I have seen the oppression, wherewith the Egyptians are oppressing them.

content: 10 Now therefore､ come thou! that I may send thee unto Pharaoh,—and bring thou forth my people—the sons of Israel—out of Egypt.
content_old: 10 Now therefore､ come thou! that I may send thee unto Pharaoh,—and bring thou forth my people—the sons of Israel—out of Egypt.

content: 11 And Moses said unto God, Who am I, that I should go unto Pharaoh,—and that I should bring forth the sons of Israel､ out of Egypt?
content_old: 11 And Moses said unto God, Who am I, that I should go unto Pharaoh,—and that I should bring forth the sons of Israel､ out of Egypt?

content: 12 And he said— I will be with thee, and this to thee shall be the sign, that I have sent thee,—When thou bringest forth the people out of Egypt ye shall do service unto God, upon this mountain.
content_old: 12 And he said— I will be with thee, and this to thee shall be the sign, that I have sent thee,—When thou bringest forth the people out of Egypt ye shall do service unto God, upon this mountain.

content: 13 And Moses said unto God— Lo! as surely as I go in unto the sons of Israel, and say unto them, The God of your fathers hath sent me unto you So surely will they say unto me— What is his name? What shall I say unto them?
content_old: 13 And Moses said unto God— Lo! as surely as I go in unto the sons of Israel, and say unto them, The God of your fathers hath sent me unto you So surely will they say unto me— What is his name? What shall I say unto them?

content: 14 And God said unto Moses, I Will Become whatsoever I please. And he said— Thus shalt thou say to the sons of Israel, I Will Become hath sent me unto you.
content_old: 14 And God said unto Moses, I Will Become whatsoever I please. And he said— Thus shalt thou say to the sons of Israel, I Will Become hath sent me unto you.

content: 15 And God said yet further unto Moses— Thus shalt thou say unto the sons of Israel, Yahweh､ God of your fathers､ God of Abraham､ God of Isaac､ and God of Jacob hath sent me unto you. This is my name to times age-abiding, And this my memorial to generation after generation.
content_old: 15 And God said yet further unto Moses— Thus shalt thou say unto the sons of Israel, Yahweh､ God of your fathers､ God of Abraham､ God of Isaac､ and God of Jacob hath sent me unto you. This is my name to times age-abiding, And this my memorial to generation after generation.

content: 16 Go—and thou shalt gather together the elders of Israel､ and shalt say unto them— Yahweh､ God of your fathers hath appeared unto me, the God of Abraham､ Isaac､ and Jacob､ saying,— I am concerned for you, and for what is done to you in Egypt;
content_old: 16 Go—and thou shalt gather together the elders of Israel､ and shalt say unto them— Yahweh､ God of your fathers hath appeared unto me, the God of Abraham､ Isaac､ and Jacob､ saying,— I am concerned for you, and for what is done to you in Egypt;

content: 17 therefore do I say— I will bring you up out of the humiliation of Egypt, into the land of the Canaanite and the Hittite, and the Amorite and the Perizzite, and the Hivite､ and the Jebusite,—into a land flowing with milk and honey.
content_old: 17 therefore do I say— I will bring you up out of the humiliation of Egypt, into the land of the Canaanite and the Hittite, and the Amorite and the Perizzite, and the Hivite､ and the Jebusite,—into a land flowing with milk and honey.

content: 18 So will they hearken to thy voice,—and thou shalt go in—thou､ and the elders of Israel unto the king of Egypt､ and ye shall say unto him— Yahweh､ God of the Hebrews hath fallen in with us, Now therefore､ let us go, we pray thee, a journey of three days､ into the desert, that we may sacrifice to Yahweh, our God.
content_old: 18 So will they hearken to thy voice,—and thou shalt go in—thou､ and the elders of Israel unto the king of Egypt､ and ye shall say unto him— Yahweh､ God of the Hebrews hath fallen in with us, Now therefore､ let us go, we pray thee, a journey of three days､ into the desert, that we may sacrifice to Yahweh, our God.

content: 19 But I know, that the king of Egypt will not suffer you to go,—not even by a firm hand.
content_old: 19 But I know, that the king of Egypt will not suffer you to go,—not even by a firm hand.

content: 20 So then I will put forth my hand､ and smite Egypt, with all my wonders, which I will do in the midst thereof,—and after that he will send you forth.
content_old: 20 So then I will put forth my hand､ and smite Egypt, with all my wonders, which I will do in the midst thereof,—and after that he will send you forth.

content: 21 Thus will I give favour to this people､ in the eyes of the Egyptians,—so shall it come to pass that when ye do go ye shall not go empty;
content_old: 21 Thus will I give favour to this people､ in the eyes of the Egyptians,—so shall it come to pass that when ye do go ye shall not go empty;

content: 1 Then responded Moses､ and said, And lo! they will not believe me, neither hearken to my voice,—for they will say, Yahweh hath not appeared unto thee.
content_old: 1 Then responded Moses､ and said, And lo! they will not believe me, neither hearken to my voice,—for they will say, Yahweh hath not appeared unto thee.

content: 2 And Yahweh said unto him— What is this in thy hand? And he said— A staff.
content_old: 2 And Yahweh said unto him— What is this in thy hand? And he said— A staff.

content: 3 Then said he— Cast it to the earth. And he cast it to the earth､ and it became a serpent,—and Moses fled from the face thereof.
content_old: 3 Then said he— Cast it to the earth. And he cast it to the earth､ and it became a serpent,—and Moses fled from the face thereof.

content: 4 And Yahweh said unto Moses, Put forth thy hand, and take it by its tail: So he put forth his hand, and laid hold of it, and it became a staff in his hand:—
content_old: 4 And Yahweh said unto Moses, Put forth thy hand, and take it by its tail: So he put forth his hand, and laid hold of it, and it became a staff in his hand:—

content: 5 that they may believe that Yahweh､ God of their fathers,—God of Abraham､ God of Isaac､ and God of Jacob—hath appeared unto thee.
content_old: 5 that they may believe that Yahweh､ God of their fathers,—God of Abraham､ God of Isaac､ and God of Jacob—hath appeared unto thee.

content: 6 Then said Yahweh unto him､ yet again— Bring､ I pray thee､ thy hand､ into thy bosom. So he brought his hand､ into his bosom,—and then took it out, and lo! his hand was leprous､—like snow,
content_old: 6 Then said Yahweh unto him､ yet again— Bring､ I pray thee､ thy hand､ into thy bosom. So he brought his hand､ into his bosom,—and then took it out, and lo! his hand was leprous､—like snow,

content: 7 And he said— Put back thy hand into thy bosom: So he put back his hand､ into his bosom,—and then took it out of his bosom, and lo! it had come again､ like his own flesh:
content_old: 7 And he said— Put back thy hand into thy bosom: So he put back his hand､ into his bosom,—and then took it out of his bosom, and lo! it had come again､ like his own flesh:

content: 8 thus shall it come to pass､if they will not believe thee, nor hearken to the voice of the first sign then will they believe the voice of the next sign;
content_old: 8 thus shall it come to pass､if they will not believe thee, nor hearken to the voice of the first sign then will they believe the voice of the next sign;

content: 9 and it shall come to pass if they will not believe even these two signs nor hearken to thy voice then shalt thou take of the water of the river, and pour it out on the dry land,—so shall the water which thou hast taken from the river､ become, yea it shall become blood､ on the dry land.
content_old: 9 and it shall come to pass if they will not believe even these two signs nor hearken to thy voice then shalt thou take of the water of the river, and pour it out on the dry land,—so shall the water which thou hast taken from the river､ become, yea it shall become blood､ on the dry land.

content: 10 And Moses said unto Yahweh— Pardon､ O My Lord! not a man of words am I, neither heretofore, nor since thou hast spoken unto thy servant,—for heavy of mouth､ and heavy of tongue I am.
content_old: 10 And Moses said unto Yahweh— Pardon､ O My Lord! not a man of words am I, neither heretofore, nor since thou hast spoken unto thy servant,—for heavy of mouth､ and heavy of tongue I am.

content: 11 Then Yahweh said unto him— Who appointed a mouth for man, or who appointeth him to be dumb､ or deaf, or seeing､ or blind? Is it not I Yahweh?
content_old: 11 Then Yahweh said unto him— Who appointed a mouth for man, or who appointeth him to be dumb､ or deaf, or seeing､ or blind? Is it not I Yahweh?

content: 12 Now therefore､ go,—and I will be with thy mouth, so will I direct thee�� what thou shalt speak.
content_old: 12 Now therefore､ go,—and I will be with thy mouth, so will I direct thee�� what thou shalt speak.

content: 13 And he said— Pardon, O My Lord! send､ I pray thee､ by the hand of him whom thou wilt send—
content_old: 13 And he said— Pardon, O My Lord! send､ I pray thee､ by the hand of him whom thou wilt send—

content: 14 Then was kindled the anger of Yahweh against Moses､ and he said— Is there not Aaron､ thy brother､ the Levite? I know that he can speak. Moreover also lo! he himself is coming forth to meet thee, as surely as he seeth thee so surely will he rejoice in his heart.
content_old: 14 Then was kindled the anger of Yahweh against Moses､ and he said— Is there not Aaron､ thy brother､ the Levite? I know that he can speak. Moreover also lo! he himself is coming forth to meet thee, as surely as he seeth thee so surely will he rejoice in his heart.

content: 15 Then shalt thou speak unto him, and shalt put the words in his mouth,—and I will be with thy mouth､ and with his mouth, so will I direct you what ye shall do.
content_old: 15 Then shalt thou speak unto him, and shalt put the words in his mouth,—and I will be with thy mouth､ and with his mouth, so will I direct you what ye shall do.

content: 16 And he shall speak for thee unto the people,—so shall it come to pass that he shall become thy mouth, and thou shalt become to him as God.
content_old: 16 And he shall speak for thee unto the people,—so shall it come to pass that he shall become thy mouth, and thou shalt become to him as God.

content: 17 And this staff take thou in thy hand,—wherewith thou shalt do the signs.
content_old: 17 And this staff take thou in thy hand,—wherewith thou shalt do the signs.

content: 18 So Moses went and returned unto Jethro his father-in-law､ and said to him— Let me go､ I pray thee､ and return unto my brethren who are in Egypt, that I may see whether they are yet alive. And Jethro said to Moses: Go and prosper.
content_old: 18 So Moses went and returned unto Jethro his father-in-law､ and said to him— Let me go､ I pray thee､ and return unto my brethren who are in Egypt, that I may see whether they are yet alive. And Jethro said to Moses: Go and prosper.

content: 19 Then said Yahweh unto Moses in Midian, Go､ return to Egypt,—for all the men are dead who were seeking thy life.
content_old: 19 Then said Yahweh unto Moses in Midian, Go､ return to Egypt,—for all the men are dead who were seeking thy life.

content: 20 So Moses took his wife and his sons､ and caused them to ride upon the ass, and he returned to the land of Egypt,—and Moses took the staff of God､ in his hand.
content_old: 20 So Moses took his wife and his sons､ and caused them to ride upon the ass, and he returned to the land of Egypt,—and Moses took the staff of God､ in his hand.

content: 21 And Yahweh said unto Moses, When thou goest to return to Egypt see as touching all the wonders which I have put in thy hand that thou do them before Pharaoh—but I will let his heart wax bold, and he will not suffer the people to go.
content_old: 21 And Yahweh said unto Moses, When thou goest to return to Egypt see as touching all the wonders which I have put in thy hand that thou do them before Pharaoh—but I will let his heart wax bold, and he will not suffer the people to go.

content: 22 Then shalt thou say unto Pharaoh,— Thus saith Yahweh— My son—my firstborn is Israel;
content_old: 22 Then shalt thou say unto Pharaoh,— Thus saith Yahweh— My son—my firstborn is Israel;

content: 23 Therefore I say unto thee,— Let my son go､ that he may serve me, But if thou refuse to let him go behold I am going to slay thy son､ thy firstborn.
content_old: 23 Therefore I say unto thee,— Let my son go､ that he may serve me, But if thou refuse to let him go behold I am going to slay thy son､ thy firstborn.

content: 24 And it came to pass on the way､ in the resting-place for the night that Yahweh fell upon him, and sought to kill him.
content_old: 24 And it came to pass on the way､ in the resting-place for the night that Yahweh fell upon him, and sought to kill him.

content: 25 So Zipporah took a sharp stone､ and cut off the foreskin of her son, and cast it down at his feet,—and said— Surely, a bridegroom by rites of blood art thou to me!
content_old: 25 So Zipporah took a sharp stone､ and cut off the foreskin of her son, and cast it down at his feet,—and said— Surely, a bridegroom by rites of blood art thou to me!

content: 26 So he let him go. Then it was that she said, A bridegroom by rites of blood— with regard to the rites of circumcision.
content_old: 26 So he let him go. Then it was that she said, A bridegroom by rites of blood— with regard to the rites of circumcision.

content: 27 And Yahweh said unto Aaron, Go thy way to meet Moses､ towards the desert. So he went his way､ and fell in with him in the mountain of God､ and kissed him.
content_old: 27 And Yahweh said unto Aaron, Go thy way to meet Moses､ towards the desert. So he went his way､ and fell in with him in the mountain of God､ and kissed him.

content: 28 And Moses told Aaron, all the words of Yahweh､ wherewith he had sent him,—and all the signs wherewith he had charged him.
content_old: 28 And Moses told Aaron, all the words of Yahweh､ wherewith he had sent him,—and all the signs wherewith he had charged him.

content: 29 So Moses and Aaron went their way,—and gathered together all the elders of the sons of Israel.
content_old: 29 So Moses and Aaron went their way,—and gathered together all the elders of the sons of Israel.

content: 30 And Aaron spake all the words which Yahweh had spoken unto Moses,—and did the signs､ before the eyes of the people.
content_old: 30 And Aaron spake all the words which Yahweh had spoken unto Moses,—and did the signs､ before the eyes of the people.

content: 1 And afterwards Moses and Aaron went in､ and said unto Pharaoh,— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel, Let my people go, that they may hold a festival to me､ in the desert.
content_old: 1 And afterwards Moses and Aaron went in､ and said unto Pharaoh,— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel, Let my people go, that they may hold a festival to me､ in the desert.

content: 2 Then said Pharaoh, Who is Yahweh､ that I should hearken to his voice, to let Israel go? I know not Yahweh, and certainly､ Israel will I not let go!
content_old: 2 Then said Pharaoh, Who is Yahweh､ that I should hearken to his voice, to let Israel go? I know not Yahweh, and certainly､ Israel will I not let go!

content: 3 And they said, The God of the Hebrews hath met with us,—let us go､ we pray thee､ a journey of three days into the desert､ and sacrifice to Yahweh our God, lest he fall upon us､ with pestilence or with sword.
content_old: 3 And they said, The God of the Hebrews hath met with us,—let us go､ we pray thee､ a journey of three days into the desert､ and sacrifice to Yahweh our God, lest he fall upon us､ with pestilence or with sword.

content: 4 And the king of Egypt said unto them, Wherefore､ O Moses and Aaron､ should ye loose the people､ from their works? Get you to your burdens.
content_old: 4 And the king of Egypt said unto them, Wherefore､ O Moses and Aaron､ should ye loose the people､ from their works? Get you to your burdens.

content: 5 And Pharaoh said, Lo! many—now are the people of the land,—and are ye to make them rest from their burdens?
content_old: 5 And Pharaoh said, Lo! many—now are the people of the land,—and are ye to make them rest from their burdens?

content: 6 So then Pharaoh gave command､ on that day､ unto the taskmasters over the people, and unto their overseers—saying:
content_old: 6 So then Pharaoh gave command､ on that day､ unto the taskmasters over the people, and unto their overseers—saying:

content: 7 Ye shall no more give straw unto the people､ for making the bricks､ as heretofore: Let them go themselves, so shall they gather for themselves straw:
content_old: 7 Ye shall no more give straw unto the people､ for making the bricks､ as heretofore: Let them go themselves, so shall they gather for themselves straw:

content: 8 Nevertheless, the fixed number of bricks､ which they have been making heretofore shall ye lay upon them, ye shall not diminish therefrom,—for idle they are, on this account it is that they are making an outcry､ saying, We must go our way, we must sacrifice to our God.
content_old: 8 Nevertheless, the fixed number of bricks､ which they have been making heretofore shall ye lay upon them, ye shall not diminish therefrom,—for idle they are, on this account it is that they are making an outcry､ saying, We must go our way, we must sacrifice to our God.

content: 9 The service must be made heavy on the men､ that they may labour on it,—and let them not pay regard to words of falsehood.
content_old: 9 The service must be made heavy on the men､ that they may labour on it,—and let them not pay regard to words of falsehood.

content: 10 Then went forth the taskmasters of the people､ and their overseers, and spake unto the people,—saying,— Thus saith Pharaoh, I am not going to give you straw,
content_old: 10 Then went forth the taskmasters of the people､ and their overseers, and spake unto the people,—saying,— Thus saith Pharaoh, I am not going to give you straw,

content: 11 Ye yourselves go fetch you straw､ of any ye can find,—yet hath there not been diminished from your service a single thing.
content_old: 11 Ye yourselves go fetch you straw､ of any ye can find,—yet hath there not been diminished from your service a single thing.

content: 12 So the people dispersed themselves throughout all the land of Egypt,—to gather stubble for straw:
content_old: 12 So the people dispersed themselves throughout all the land of Egypt,—to gather stubble for straw:

content: 13 the taskmasters meanwhile､ being urgent､ saying,— Complete your works, The task of a day in its day, as when the straw was provided.
content_old: 13 the taskmasters meanwhile､ being urgent､ saying,— Complete your works, The task of a day in its day, as when the straw was provided.

content: 14 Then were beaten the overseers of the sons of Israel, whom the taskmasters of Pharaoh had set over them､ saying: Wherefore have ye not completed your task for making bricks, as heretofore so also yesterday and to-day?
content_old: 14 Then were beaten the overseers of the sons of Israel, whom the taskmasters of Pharaoh had set over them､ saying: Wherefore have ye not completed your task for making bricks, as heretofore so also yesterday and to-day?

content: 15 Then came in the overseers of the sons of Israel, and made outcry unto Pharaoh, saying､ Wherefore shouldst thou do thus､ to thy servants?
content_old: 15 Then came in the overseers of the sons of Israel, and made outcry unto Pharaoh, saying､ Wherefore shouldst thou do thus､ to thy servants?

content: 16 No straw is given to thy servants, yet bricks—they keep saying to us—make ye! And lo, thy servants are beaten—thou dost, therefore, wrong thy people.
content_old: 16 No straw is given to thy servants, yet bricks—they keep saying to us—make ye! And lo, thy servants are beaten—thou dost, therefore, wrong thy people.

content: 17 But he said: Idle ye are—idle on this account are ye saying, We must take our journey､ we must sacrifice to Yahweh.
content_old: 17 But he said: Idle ye are—idle on this account are ye saying, We must take our journey､ we must sacrifice to Yahweh.

content: 18 Now therefore､ go labour, but straw shall not be given you,—yet the tale of bricks shall ye render.
content_old: 18 Now therefore､ go labour, but straw shall not be given you,—yet the tale of bricks shall ye render.

content: 19 Then did the overseers of the sons of Israel see themselves to be in an evil case､ when it was said,— Ye shall not diminish from your bricks— the task of a day in its day!
content_old: 19 Then did the overseers of the sons of Israel see themselves to be in an evil case､ when it was said,— Ye shall not diminish from your bricks— the task of a day in its day!

content: 20 So they fell upon Moses and upon Aaron, stationing themselves to meet them,—as they came forth from Pharaoh;
content_old: 20 So they fell upon Moses and upon Aaron, stationing themselves to meet them,—as they came forth from Pharaoh;

content: 21 and they said unto them, Yahweh look upon you､ and judge,—in that ye have made us odious in the eyes of Pharaoh､ and in the eyes of his servants, putting a sword into their hand to slay us.
content_old: 21 and they said unto them, Yahweh look upon you､ and judge,—in that ye have made us odious in the eyes of Pharaoh､ and in the eyes of his servants, putting a sword into their hand to slay us.

content: 22 And Moses returned unto Yahweh､ and said,— O My Lord wherefore hast thou caused harm to this people? Wherefore now didst thou send me?
content_old: 22 And Moses returned unto Yahweh､ and said,— O My Lord wherefore hast thou caused harm to this people? Wherefore now didst thou send me?

content: 1 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Now shalt thou see, what I will do to Pharaoh,—for with a strong hand shall he let them go, and with a strong hand shall he drive them out from his land.
content_old: 1 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Now shalt thou see, what I will do to Pharaoh,—for with a strong hand shall he let them go, and with a strong hand shall he drive them out from his land.

content: 2 And God spake unto Moses,—and said unto him— I am Yahweh:
content_old: 2 And God spake unto Moses,—and said unto him— I am Yahweh:

content: 3 I appeared､ therefore､ unto Abraham､ unto Isaac､ and unto Jacob､ as GOD Almighty,—although by my name Yahweh was I not made known to them;
content_old: 3 I appeared､ therefore､ unto Abraham､ unto Isaac､ and unto Jacob､ as GOD Almighty,—although by my name Yahweh was I not made known to them;

content: 4 Moreover also I established my covenant with them, to give them the land of Canaan,—even the land of their sojournings wherein they sojourned.
content_old: 4 Moreover also I established my covenant with them, to give them the land of Canaan,—even the land of their sojournings wherein they sojourned.

content: 5 Moreover also I heard the groaning of the sons of Israel, whom the Egyptians were holding in servitude,— So then I remembered my covenant.
content_old: 5 Moreover also I heard the groaning of the sons of Israel, whom the Egyptians were holding in servitude,— So then I remembered my covenant.

content: 6 Therefore say thou to the sons of Israel— I am Yahweh, Therefore will I bring you forth from under the burdens of Egypt, And will deliver you out of their service,— And will redeem you with a stretched-out arm, and with great judgments;
content_old: 6 Therefore say thou to the sons of Israel— I am Yahweh, Therefore will I bring you forth from under the burdens of Egypt, And will deliver you out of their service,— And will redeem you with a stretched-out arm, and with great judgments;

content: 7 And will take you to myself､ for a people, And will become your God,— And ye shall know､ that I Yahweh am your God, who brought you forth from under the burdens of Egypt:
content_old: 7 And will take you to myself､ for a people, And will become your God,— And ye shall know､ that I Yahweh am your God, who brought you forth from under the burdens of Egypt:

content: 8 And I will bring you into the land as to which I uplifted my hand to give it to Abraham､ to Isaac､ and to Jacob,—and will give it to you as an inheritance: I am Yahweh.
content_old: 8 And I will bring you into the land as to which I uplifted my hand to give it to Abraham､ to Isaac､ and to Jacob,—and will give it to you as an inheritance: I am Yahweh.

content: 9 And Moses spake thus､ unto the sons of Israel,—but they hearkened not unto Moses, through shortness of spirit､ and through hard service.
content_old: 9 And Moses spake thus､ unto the sons of Israel,—but they hearkened not unto Moses, through shortness of spirit､ and through hard service.

content: 10 And Yahweh spake unto Moses—saying:
content_old: 10 And Yahweh spake unto Moses—saying:

content: 11 Go in､ speak unto Pharaoh king of Egypt,—that he let the sons of Israel go out of his land.
content_old: 11 Go in､ speak unto Pharaoh king of Egypt,—that he let the sons of Israel go out of his land.

content: 12 And Moses spake before Yahweh､ saying,— Lo! the sons of Israel have not hearkened unto me, how then shall Pharaoh hear, I also being of uncircumcised lips.
content_old: 12 And Moses spake before Yahweh､ saying,— Lo! the sons of Israel have not hearkened unto me, how then shall Pharaoh hear, I also being of uncircumcised lips.

content: 13 Thus then did Yahweh speak unto Moses and unto Aaron, yea he gave them a charge unto the sons of Israel, and unto Pharaoh king of Egypt,—for the bringing forth of the sons of Israel out of the land of Egypt.
content_old: 13 Thus then did Yahweh speak unto Moses and unto Aaron, yea he gave them a charge unto the sons of Israel, and unto Pharaoh king of Egypt,—for the bringing forth of the sons of Israel out of the land of Egypt.

content: 14 These are the heads of their ancestral house: The sons of Reuben the first-born of Israel Hanoch and Pallu､ Hezron and Carmi. These are the families of Reuben.
content_old: 14 These are the heads of their ancestral house: The sons of Reuben the first-born of Israel Hanoch and Pallu､ Hezron and Carmi. These are the families of Reuben.

content: 15 And the sons of Simeon Jemuel and Jamin､ and Ohad and Jachin and Zohar, and Shaul､ the son of a Canaanitess. These are the families of Simeon.
content_old: 15 And the sons of Simeon Jemuel and Jamin､ and Ohad and Jachin and Zohar, and Shaul､ the son of a Canaanitess. These are the families of Simeon.

content: 16 And these are the names of the sons of Levi by their generations. Gershon､ and Kohath､ and Merari,— And the years of the life of Levi were a hundred and thirty-seven years.
content_old: 16 And these are the names of the sons of Levi by their generations. Gershon､ and Kohath､ and Merari,— And the years of the life of Levi were a hundred and thirty-seven years.

content: 17 The sons of Gershon Libni and Shimei､ by their families.
content_old: 17 The sons of Gershon Libni and Shimei､ by their families.

content: 18 And the sons of Kohath Amram and Izhar, and Hebron､ and Uzziel. And the years of the life of Kohath were a hundred and thirty-three years.
content_old: 18 And the sons of Kohath Amram and Izhar, and Hebron､ and Uzziel. And the years of the life of Kohath were a hundred and thirty-three years.

content: 19 And the sons of Merari Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites､ by their generations.
content_old: 19 And the sons of Merari Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites､ by their generations.

content: 20 So then, Amram took Jochebed､ his father’s sister､ to himself to wife, and she bare to him—Aaron and Moses. And the years of the life of Amram were a hundred and thirty-seven.
content_old: 20 So then, Amram took Jochebed､ his father’s sister､ to himself to wife, and she bare to him—Aaron and Moses. And the years of the life of Amram were a hundred and thirty-seven.

content: 21 And the sons of Izhar Korah and Nepheg､ and Zichri.
content_old: 21 And the sons of Izhar Korah and Nepheg､ and Zichri.

content: 22 And the sons of Uzziel Mishael and Elzaphan､ and Sithri.
content_old: 22 And the sons of Uzziel Mishael and Elzaphan､ and Sithri.

content: 23 And Aaron took Elisheba､ daughter of Amminadab､ sister of Nahshon､ to himself to wife,—and she bare to him—Nadab､ and Abihu, Eleazar､ and Ithamar.
content_old: 23 And Aaron took Elisheba､ daughter of Amminadab､ sister of Nahshon､ to himself to wife,—and she bare to him—Nadab､ and Abihu, Eleazar､ and Ithamar.

content: 24 And the sons of Korah Assir and Elkanah､ and Abiasaph. These are the families of the Korahites.
content_old: 24 And the sons of Korah Assir and Elkanah､ and Abiasaph. These are the families of the Korahites.

content: 25 And Eleazar､ son of Aaron､ took to himself one of the daughters of Putiel､ to himself to wife, and she bare to him Phinehas. These are the heads of the fathers of the Levites､ by their families.
content_old: 25 And Eleazar､ son of Aaron､ took to himself one of the daughters of Putiel､ to himself to wife, and she bare to him Phinehas. These are the heads of the fathers of the Levites､ by their families.

content: 26 The same Aaron and Moses,—to whom said Yahweh, Bring ye forth the sons of Israel out of the land of Egypt, according to their hosts:
content_old: 26 The same Aaron and Moses,—to whom said Yahweh, Bring ye forth the sons of Israel out of the land of Egypt, according to their hosts:

content: 27 They who were to speak unto Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring forth the sons of Israel out of Egypt: The same Moses and Aaron.
content_old: 27 They who were to speak unto Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring forth the sons of Israel out of Egypt: The same Moses and Aaron.

content: 28 Thus came it to pass, that on a certain day Yahweh spake unto Moses in the land of Egypt.
content_old: 28 Thus came it to pass, that on a certain day Yahweh spake unto Moses in the land of Egypt.

content: 29 So then Yahweh spake unto Moses saying— I am Yahweh: Speak thou unto Pharaoh king of Egypt, all that I am speaking unto thee.
content_old: 29 So then Yahweh spake unto Moses saying— I am Yahweh: Speak thou unto Pharaoh king of Egypt, all that I am speaking unto thee.

content: 1 Then said Yahweh unto Moses— See! I have appointed thee to be God unto Pharaoh,—and Aaron thy brother shall be thy prophet!
content_old: 1 Then said Yahweh unto Moses— See! I have appointed thee to be God unto Pharaoh,—and Aaron thy brother shall be thy prophet!

content: 2 Thou shalt speak all that which I may command thee, and Aaron thy brother shall speak unto Pharaoh, and he shall let the sons of Israel go out of his land.
content_old: 2 Thou shalt speak all that which I may command thee, and Aaron thy brother shall speak unto Pharaoh, and he shall let the sons of Israel go out of his land.

content: 3 But I will suffer Pharaoh to harden his heart,—so will I multiply my signs and my wonders､ in the land of Egypt.
content_old: 3 But I will suffer Pharaoh to harden his heart,—so will I multiply my signs and my wonders､ in the land of Egypt.

content: 4 And Pharaoh will not hearken unto you, so will I lay my hand on Egypt,—and bring forth my hosts—my people､ the sons of Israel､ out of the land of Egypt, with great judgments.
content_old: 4 And Pharaoh will not hearken unto you, so will I lay my hand on Egypt,—and bring forth my hosts—my people､ the sons of Israel､ out of the land of Egypt, with great judgments.

content: 5 And the Egyptians shall know that I am Yahweh, when I have stretched forth my hand over Egypt,—and brought forth the sons of Israel out of their midst.
content_old: 5 And the Egyptians shall know that I am Yahweh, when I have stretched forth my hand over Egypt,—and brought forth the sons of Israel out of their midst.

content: 6 And Moses and Aaron did so,—as Yahweh commanded them so did they.
content_old: 6 And Moses and Aaron did so,—as Yahweh commanded them so did they.

content: 7 Now Moses was eighty years old, and Aaron eighty-three years old,—when they spake unto Pharaoh.
content_old: 7 Now Moses was eighty years old, and Aaron eighty-three years old,—when they spake unto Pharaoh.

content: 8 And Yahweh spake unto Moses and unto Aaron､ saying:
content_old: 8 And Yahweh spake unto Moses and unto Aaron､ saying:

content: 9 When Pharaoh shall speak unto you saying, Shew for yourselves a wonder then shalt thou say unto Aaron, Take thy staff､ and cast it down before Pharaoh､ let it become a sea-serpent.
content_old: 9 When Pharaoh shall speak unto you saying, Shew for yourselves a wonder then shalt thou say unto Aaron, Take thy staff､ and cast it down before Pharaoh､ let it become a sea-serpent.

content: 10 So Moses and Aaron went in unto Pharaoh, and did so､ as Yahweh had commanded,—and Aaron cast down his staff before Pharaoh and before his servants､ and it became a sea-serpent.
content_old: 10 So Moses and Aaron went in unto Pharaoh, and did so､ as Yahweh had commanded,—and Aaron cast down his staff before Pharaoh and before his servants､ and it became a sea-serpent.

content: 11 Then called Pharaoh also for the wise men and for the magicians,—and they too the sacred scribes of Egypt, with their secret arts did in like manner;
content_old: 11 Then called Pharaoh also for the wise men and for the magicians,—and they too the sacred scribes of Egypt, with their secret arts did in like manner;

content: 12 yea they cast down each man his staff, and they became sea-serpents,—but Aaron’s staff swallowed up their staves.
content_old: 12 yea they cast down each man his staff, and they became sea-serpents,—but Aaron’s staff swallowed up their staves.

content: 13 Then waxed bold the heart of Pharaoh, and he hearkened not unto them,—as spake Yahweh.
content_old: 13 Then waxed bold the heart of Pharaoh, and he hearkened not unto them,—as spake Yahweh.

content: 14 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Dull is the heart of Pharaoh,—he hath refused to let the people go.
content_old: 14 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Dull is the heart of Pharaoh,—he hath refused to let the people go.

content: 15 Get thee unto Pharaoh in the morning—lo! he is coming out to the waters, therefore shalt thou station thyself to meet him､ on the bank of the river,—and the staff which was turned into a serpent shalt thou take in thy hand.
content_old: 15 Get thee unto Pharaoh in the morning—lo! he is coming out to the waters, therefore shalt thou station thyself to meet him､ on the bank of the river,—and the staff which was turned into a serpent shalt thou take in thy hand.

content: 16 Then shalt thou say unto him— Yahweh､ God of the Hebrews hath sent me unto thee､ saying,— Let my people go, that they may serve me in the desert,— And lo! thou hast not hearkened､ hitherto.
content_old: 16 Then shalt thou say unto him— Yahweh､ God of the Hebrews hath sent me unto thee､ saying,— Let my people go, that they may serve me in the desert,— And lo! thou hast not hearkened､ hitherto.

content: 17 Thus saith Yahweh, Hereby shalt thou know that I am Yahweh,— Lo! I am smiting with the staff that is in my hand upon the waters that are in the river､ and they shall be turned to blood;
content_old: 17 Thus saith Yahweh, Hereby shalt thou know that I am Yahweh,— Lo! I am smiting with the staff that is in my hand upon the waters that are in the river､ and they shall be turned to blood;

content: 18 and the fish that is in the river shall die､ and the river shall be loathsome,—and the Egyptians shall disdain to drink water out of the river.
content_old: 18 and the fish that is in the river shall die､ and the river shall be loathsome,—and the Egyptians shall disdain to drink water out of the river.

content: 19 And Yahweh said unto Moses,— Say unto Aaron— Take thy staff, and stretch forth thy hand over the waters of Egypt､ over their streams､ over their rivers､ and over their pools､ and over all their collections of water—that they may become blood,—so shall there be blood､ in all the land of Egypt, both in vessels of wood､ and in vessels of stone.
content_old: 19 And Yahweh said unto Moses,— Say unto Aaron— Take thy staff, and stretch forth thy hand over the waters of Egypt､ over their streams､ over their rivers､ and over their pools､ and over all their collections of water—that they may become blood,—so shall there be blood､ in all the land of Egypt, both in vessels of wood､ and in vessels of stone.

content: 20 And Moses and Aaron did so､ as Yahweh commanded, and he lifted high the staff､ and smote the waters which were in the river, before the eyes of Pharaoh, and before the eyes of his servants,—and all the waters which were in the river were turned to blood;
content_old: 20 And Moses and Aaron did so､ as Yahweh commanded, and he lifted high the staff､ and smote the waters which were in the river, before the eyes of Pharaoh, and before the eyes of his servants,—and all the waters which were in the river were turned to blood;

content: 21 and the fish that was in the river died､ and the river became loathsome, so that the Egyptians could not drink water out of the river,—thus came it to pass that blood was in all the land of Egypt.
content_old: 21 and the fish that was in the river died､ and the river became loathsome, so that the Egyptians could not drink water out of the river,—thus came it to pass that blood was in all the land of Egypt.

content: 22 And the sacred scribes of Egypt did in like manner､ with their secret arts,—so the heart of Pharaoh waxed bold､ and he hearkened not unto them, as spake Yahweh.
content_old: 22 And the sacred scribes of Egypt did in like manner､ with their secret arts,—so the heart of Pharaoh waxed bold､ and he hearkened not unto them, as spake Yahweh.

content: 23 Then Pharaoh turned away and entered into his house—neither applied he his heart even to this.
content_old: 23 Then Pharaoh turned away and entered into his house—neither applied he his heart even to this.

content: 24 And all the Egyptians digged round about the river､ for water to drink,—for they could not drink of the water of the river.
content_old: 24 And all the Egyptians digged round about the river､ for water to drink,—for they could not drink of the water of the river.

content: 1 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Go in unto Pharaoh,—then shalt thou say unto him— Thus saith Yahweh,— Let my people go､ that they may serve me.
content_old: 1 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Go in unto Pharaoh,—then shalt thou say unto him— Thus saith Yahweh,— Let my people go､ that they may serve me.

content: 2 But if thou art refusing to let them go lo! I am plaguing all thy boundaries with frogs;
content_old: 2 But if thou art refusing to let them go lo! I am plaguing all thy boundaries with frogs;

content: 3 so shall the river swarm with frogs, and they shall come up､ and enter into thy house, and into thy bedchamber､ and upon thy couch,—and into the house of thy servants､ and among thy people, and into thine ovens､ and into thy kneading-troughs:
content_old: 3 so shall the river swarm with frogs, and they shall come up､ and enter into thy house, and into thy bedchamber､ and upon thy couch,—and into the house of thy servants､ and among thy people, and into thine ovens､ and into thy kneading-troughs:

content: 4 both against thee､ and against thy people､ and against all thy servants shall come up the frogs.
content_old: 4 both against thee､ and against thy people､ and against all thy servants shall come up the frogs.

content: 5 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Say unto Aaron— Stretch forth thy hand､ with thy staff, over the streams､ over the rivers､ and over the pools,—and bring up the frogs､ over the land of Egypt.
content_old: 5 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Say unto Aaron— Stretch forth thy hand､ with thy staff, over the streams､ over the rivers､ and over the pools,—and bring up the frogs､ over the land of Egypt.

content: 6 So Aaron stretched forth his hand, over the waters of Egypt,—and the frog came up, and covered the land of Egypt.
content_old: 6 So Aaron stretched forth his hand, over the waters of Egypt,—and the frog came up, and covered the land of Egypt.

content: 7 And the sacred scribes did in like manner､ with their secret arts,—and brought up frogs､ over the land of Egypt.
content_old: 7 And the sacred scribes did in like manner､ with their secret arts,—and brought up frogs､ over the land of Egypt.

content: 8 Then called Pharaoh for Moses and for Aaron､ and said— Make entreaty unto Yahweh, that he take away the frogs from me､ and from my people,—and I must let the people go､ that they may sacrifice to Yahweh.
content_old: 8 Then called Pharaoh for Moses and for Aaron､ and said— Make entreaty unto Yahweh, that he take away the frogs from me､ and from my people,—and I must let the people go､ that they may sacrifice to Yahweh.

content: 9 And Moses said to Pharaoh— Explain thyself unto me: For what time shall I make entreaty for thee､ and for thy servants､ and for thy people, to cause the frogs to be cut off, from thee､ and from thy houses,—only in the river shall they remain?
content_old: 9 And Moses said to Pharaoh— Explain thyself unto me: For what time shall I make entreaty for thee､ and for thy servants､ and for thy people, to cause the frogs to be cut off, from thee､ and from thy houses,—only in the river shall they remain?

content: 10 And he said— For to-morrow. And he said— According to thy word! that thou mayest know､ that there is none like Yahweh､ our God:
content_old: 10 And he said— For to-morrow. And he said— According to thy word! that thou mayest know､ that there is none like Yahweh､ our God:

content: 11 so the frogs shall depart—from thee､ and from thy houses､ and from thy servants､ and from thy people,—only in the river shall they remain.
content_old: 11 so the frogs shall depart—from thee､ and from thy houses､ and from thy servants､ and from thy people,—only in the river shall they remain.

content: 12 Then went forth Moses and Aaron from Pharaoh,—and Moses made outcry unto Yahweh, over the matter of the frogs､ which he had appointed for Pharaoh.
content_old: 12 Then went forth Moses and Aaron from Pharaoh,—and Moses made outcry unto Yahweh, over the matter of the frogs､ which he had appointed for Pharaoh.

content: 13 And Yahweh did according to the word of Moses,—and the frogs died, out of the houses､ and out of the yards､ and out of the fields;
content_old: 13 And Yahweh did according to the word of Moses,—and the frogs died, out of the houses､ and out of the yards､ and out of the fields;

content: 14 and they piled them up､ heaps—heaps,—and the land became loathsome.
content_old: 14 and they piled them up､ heaps—heaps,—and the land became loathsome.

content: 15 But when Pharaoh saw that there had come a respite then made he his heart dull､ and hearkened not unto them,—as spake Yahweh.
content_old: 15 But when Pharaoh saw that there had come a respite then made he his heart dull､ and hearkened not unto them,—as spake Yahweh.

content: 16 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Say unto Aaron— Stretch forth thy staff, and smite the dust of the land,—so shall it become gnats in all the land of Egypt.
content_old: 16 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Say unto Aaron— Stretch forth thy staff, and smite the dust of the land,—so shall it become gnats in all the land of Egypt.

content: 17 And they did so､ and Aaron stretched forth his hand with his staff､ and smote the dust of the land, and there came to be gnats, among men､ and among beasts,—all the dust of the land became gnats in all the land of Egypt.
content_old: 17 And they did so､ and Aaron stretched forth his hand with his staff､ and smote the dust of the land, and there came to be gnats, among men､ and among beasts,—all the dust of the land became gnats in all the land of Egypt.

content: 18 And the sacred scribes did in like manner､ with their secret arts､ to bring forth the gnats, but they could not. So there came to be gnats, among men and among beasts.
content_old: 18 And the sacred scribes did in like manner､ with their secret arts､ to bring forth the gnats, but they could not. So there came to be gnats, among men and among beasts.

content: 19 Then said the sacred scribes unto Pharaoh, The finger of God it is! But the heart of Pharaoh waxed bold､ and he hearkened not unto them, as spake Yahweh.
content_old: 19 Then said the sacred scribes unto Pharaoh, The finger of God it is! But the heart of Pharaoh waxed bold､ and he hearkened not unto them, as spake Yahweh.

content: 20 Then said Yahweh unto Moses— Rise thou early in the morning､ and station thyself before Pharaoh, lo! he is coming forth to the waters,—then shalt thou say unto him— Thus saith Yahweh: Let my people go､ that they may serve me.
content_old: 20 Then said Yahweh unto Moses— Rise thou early in the morning､ and station thyself before Pharaoh, lo! he is coming forth to the waters,—then shalt thou say unto him— Thus saith Yahweh: Let my people go､ that they may serve me.

content: 21 But if thou art not letting my people go behold me! sending forth—against thee､ and against thy servants､ and against thy people､ and against thy houses､ the gad-fly,—and the houses of the Egyptians shall be full of the gad-fly, moreover also the ground whereon they are:
content_old: 21 But if thou art not letting my people go behold me! sending forth—against thee､ and against thy servants､ and against thy people､ and against thy houses､ the gad-fly,—and the houses of the Egyptians shall be full of the gad-fly, moreover also the ground whereon they are:

content: 22 then will I make to differ､ on that day､ the land of Goshen､ wherein my people do dwell, so that there shall not be､ there a gad-fly! in order that thou mayest know, that I､ Yahweh am in the midst of the land;
content_old: 22 then will I make to differ､ on that day､ the land of Goshen､ wherein my people do dwell, so that there shall not be､ there a gad-fly! in order that thou mayest know, that I､ Yahweh am in the midst of the land;

content: 23 so will I put a separation betwixt my people and thy people. By to-morrow shall come to pass this sign.
content_old: 23 so will I put a separation betwixt my people and thy people. By to-morrow shall come to pass this sign.

content: 24 And Yahweh did so, and brought a grievous gad-fly unto the house of Pharaoh､ and the houses of his servants､ and in all the land of Egypt, and the land was laid waste､ by reason of the gad-fly.
content_old: 24 And Yahweh did so, and brought a grievous gad-fly unto the house of Pharaoh､ and the houses of his servants､ and in all the land of Egypt, and the land was laid waste､ by reason of the gad-fly.

content: 25 Then did Pharaoh cry out—unto Moses､ and to Aaron,—and said— Go your way､ sacrifice to your God in the land.
content_old: 25 Then did Pharaoh cry out—unto Moses､ and to Aaron,—and said— Go your way､ sacrifice to your God in the land.

content: 26 And Moses said: Not meet is it､ to do thus, for an abomination to the Egyptians we should sacrifice to Yahweh our God. Lo! could we sacrifice that which is an abomination to the Egyptians before their eyes､ and they not stone us?
content_old: 26 And Moses said: Not meet is it､ to do thus, for an abomination to the Egyptians we should sacrifice to Yahweh our God. Lo! could we sacrifice that which is an abomination to the Egyptians before their eyes､ and they not stone us?

content: 27 A journey of three days must we go､ in the desert,—then will we sacrifice to Yahweh our God, as Yahweh hath said unto us.
content_old: 27 A journey of three days must we go､ in the desert,—then will we sacrifice to Yahweh our God, as Yahweh hath said unto us.

content: 28 Then said Pharaoh: I will let you go—so shall ye sacrifice to Yahweh your God､ in the desert, only ye shall not go a very long journey,—make ye entreaty for me.
content_old: 28 Then said Pharaoh: I will let you go—so shall ye sacrifice to Yahweh your God､ in the desert, only ye shall not go a very long journey,—make ye entreaty for me.

content: 29 And Moses said: Lo! I am going out from thee､ and will make entreaty unto Yahweh, so will be take away the gad-fly—from Pharaoh､ from his servants, and from his people､ tomorrow,—only let not Pharaoh again deceive, in not letting the people go, to sacrifice to Yahweh.
content_old: 29 And Moses said: Lo! I am going out from thee､ and will make entreaty unto Yahweh, so will be take away the gad-fly—from Pharaoh､ from his servants, and from his people､ tomorrow,—only let not Pharaoh again deceive, in not letting the people go, to sacrifice to Yahweh.

content: 30 So Moses went out from Pharaoh,—and made entreaty unto Yahweh.
content_old: 30 So Moses went out from Pharaoh,—and made entreaty unto Yahweh.

content: 31 And Yahweh did according to the word of Moses, and took away the gad-fly, from Pharaoh､ from his servants､ and from his people,—there remained not one.
content_old: 31 And Yahweh did according to the word of Moses, and took away the gad-fly, from Pharaoh､ from his servants､ and from his people,—there remained not one.

content: 1 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Go in unto Pharaoh,—then shalt thou say unto him— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of the Hebrews, Let my people go､ that they may serve me.
content_old: 1 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Go in unto Pharaoh,—then shalt thou say unto him— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of the Hebrews, Let my people go､ that they may serve me.

content: 2 But if refusing thou art to let them go,—and still art holding them fast
content_old: 2 But if refusing thou art to let them go,—and still art holding them fast

content: 3 lo! the hand of Yahweh is coming on thy cattle､ which are in the field, on the horses､ on the asses､ one the camels, on the herds､ and on the flocks,—a very grievous pestilence;
content_old: 3 lo! the hand of Yahweh is coming on thy cattle､ which are in the field, on the horses､ on the asses､ one the camels, on the herds､ and on the flocks,—a very grievous pestilence;

content: 4 and Yahweh will make a difference between the cattle of Israel､ and the cattle of the Egyptians,—so that there shall not die from among all that pertaineth to the sons of Israel a thing!
content_old: 4 and Yahweh will make a difference between the cattle of Israel､ and the cattle of the Egyptians,—so that there shall not die from among all that pertaineth to the sons of Israel a thing!

content: 5 And Yahweh appointed a set time—saying,— To-morrow will Yahweh do this thing､ in the land.
content_old: 5 And Yahweh appointed a set time—saying,— To-morrow will Yahweh do this thing､ in the land.

content: 6 So Yahweh did this thing､ on the morrow, and all the cattle of the Egyptians died,—but of the cattle of the sons of Israel died not one.
content_old: 6 So Yahweh did this thing､ on the morrow, and all the cattle of the Egyptians died,—but of the cattle of the sons of Israel died not one.

content: 7 And Pharaoh sent, and lo! there had not died of the cattle of Israel､ so much as one. But Pharaoh’s heart became dull, and he did not let the people go.
content_old: 7 And Pharaoh sent, and lo! there had not died of the cattle of Israel､ so much as one. But Pharaoh’s heart became dull, and he did not let the people go.

content: 8 Then said Yahweh､ unto Moses and unto Aaron, Take you､ your hands full of the ashes of an oven,—and Moses shall scatter them towards the heavens､ before the eyes of Pharaoh:
content_old: 8 Then said Yahweh､ unto Moses and unto Aaron, Take you､ your hands full of the ashes of an oven,—and Moses shall scatter them towards the heavens､ before the eyes of Pharaoh:

content: 9 then shall they become fine dust, over all the land of Egypt,—and shall become on man and on beast､ a burning sore､ breaking out in pustules､ in all the land of Egypt.
content_old: 9 then shall they become fine dust, over all the land of Egypt,—and shall become on man and on beast､ a burning sore､ breaking out in pustules､ in all the land of Egypt.

content: 10 So they took the ashes of an oven､ and stood before Pharaoh, and Moses scattered them towards the heavens,—and it came to pass that there was a burning sore､ in pustules breaking out, among men, and among beasts;
content_old: 10 So they took the ashes of an oven､ and stood before Pharaoh, and Moses scattered them towards the heavens,—and it came to pass that there was a burning sore､ in pustules breaking out, among men, and among beasts;

content: 11 and the sacred scribes could not stand before Moses､ because of the burning sore,—for the burning sore had come on the sacred scribes､ and on all the Egyptians.
content_old: 11 and the sacred scribes could not stand before Moses､ because of the burning sore,—for the burning sore had come on the sacred scribes､ and on all the Egyptians.

content: 12 But Yahweh let the heart of Pharaoh wax bold, and he hearkened not unto them,—as spake Yahweh unto Moses.
content_old: 12 But Yahweh let the heart of Pharaoh wax bold, and he hearkened not unto them,—as spake Yahweh unto Moses.

content: 13 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Rise thou early in the morning､ and station thyself before Pharaoh,—then shalt thou say unto him— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of the Hebrews, Let my people go､ that they may serve me;
content_old: 13 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Rise thou early in the morning､ and station thyself before Pharaoh,—then shalt thou say unto him— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of the Hebrews, Let my people go､ that they may serve me;

content: 14 for this time am I sending all my plagues unto thy heart, and amongst thy servants､ and amongst thy people,—to the intent thou mayest get to know, that there is none like me､ in all the earth.
content_old: 14 for this time am I sending all my plagues unto thy heart, and amongst thy servants､ and amongst thy people,—to the intent thou mayest get to know, that there is none like me､ in all the earth.

content: 15 For now might I have put forth my hand, and smitten thee and thy people､ with pestilence,—and thou shouldst have secretly disappeared from the earth;
content_old: 15 For now might I have put forth my hand, and smitten thee and thy people､ with pestilence,—and thou shouldst have secretly disappeared from the earth;

content: 16 but in very deed for this purpose have I let thee remain, for the purpose of showing thee my might,—and that my name may be celebrated in all the earth.
content_old: 16 but in very deed for this purpose have I let thee remain, for the purpose of showing thee my might,—and that my name may be celebrated in all the earth.

content: 17 Even yet art thou exalting thyself over my people,—in not letting them go?
content_old: 17 Even yet art thou exalting thyself over my people,—in not letting them go?

content: 18 Behold me! raining down about this time to-morrow an exceeding heavy hail,—such as hath not been in Egypt, from the day it was founded､even unto the present time.
content_old: 18 Behold me! raining down about this time to-morrow an exceeding heavy hail,—such as hath not been in Egypt, from the day it was founded､even unto the present time.

content: 19 Now therefore､ send—bring into safety thy cattle, and all that thou hast in the field,—as touching all men and beasts which shall be found in the field､ and shall not be withdrawn into shelter the hail shall come down upon them､ and they shall die.
content_old: 19 Now therefore､ send—bring into safety thy cattle, and all that thou hast in the field,—as touching all men and beasts which shall be found in the field､ and shall not be withdrawn into shelter the hail shall come down upon them､ and they shall die.

content: 20 He that feared the word of Yahweh, among the servants of Pharaoh made his servants and his cattle flee､ under shelter;
content_old: 20 He that feared the word of Yahweh, among the servants of Pharaoh made his servants and his cattle flee､ under shelter;

content: 21 but whoso applied not his heart unto the word of Yahweh left his servants and his cattle､ in the field.
content_old: 21 but whoso applied not his heart unto the word of Yahweh left his servants and his cattle､ in the field.

content: 22 Then said Yahweh unto Moses— Stretch forth thy hand over the heavens, that there may be hail､ in all the land of Egypt,—on man and on beast､ and on every herb of the field､ in the land of Egypt.
content_old: 22 Then said Yahweh unto Moses— Stretch forth thy hand over the heavens, that there may be hail､ in all the land of Egypt,—on man and on beast､ and on every herb of the field､ in the land of Egypt.

content: 23 So Moses stretched forth his staff over the heavens, and Yahweh gave forth thunderings and hail, and there came fire､ towards the earth,—and Yahweh rained down hail､ on the land of Egypt.
content_old: 23 So Moses stretched forth his staff over the heavens, and Yahweh gave forth thunderings and hail, and there came fire､ towards the earth,—and Yahweh rained down hail､ on the land of Egypt.

content: 24 So there came to be hail, and fire catching hold of itself､ in the midst of the hail,—exceeding heavy, such as had not been in all the land of Egypt, from the very time it became a nation.
content_old: 24 So there came to be hail, and fire catching hold of itself､ in the midst of the hail,—exceeding heavy, such as had not been in all the land of Egypt, from the very time it became a nation.

content: 25 And the hail smote､ in all the land of Egypt､ all that was in the field, both man and beast,—and every herb of the field did the hail smite, and every tree of the field did it shiver.
content_old: 25 And the hail smote､ in all the land of Egypt､ all that was in the field, both man and beast,—and every herb of the field did the hail smite, and every tree of the field did it shiver.

content: 26 Only in the land of Goshen, where were the sons of Israel was there no hail.
content_old: 26 Only in the land of Goshen, where were the sons of Israel was there no hail.

content: 27 Then sent Pharaoh､ and called for Moses and for Aaron, and said unto them— I have sinned this time,—Yahweh is the righteous one, and I and my people are the wrong-doers.
content_old: 27 Then sent Pharaoh､ and called for Moses and for Aaron, and said unto them— I have sinned this time,—Yahweh is the righteous one, and I and my people are the wrong-doers.

content: 28 Make ye request unto Yahweh, and it shall be enough､ without there being any more thunderings of God､ and hail,—and I must let you go, and not again shall ye delay.
content_old: 28 Make ye request unto Yahweh, and it shall be enough､ without there being any more thunderings of God､ and hail,—and I must let you go, and not again shall ye delay.

content: 29 And Moses said unto him, As soon as I am gone out of the city will I spread out my hands unto Yahweh,—the thunderings shall cease､ and the hail shall come no more,—that thou mayest know, that to Yahweh belongeth the earth.
content_old: 29 And Moses said unto him, As soon as I am gone out of the city will I spread out my hands unto Yahweh,—the thunderings shall cease､ and the hail shall come no more,—that thou mayest know, that to Yahweh belongeth the earth.

content: 30 But as touching thee and thy servants I know､ that not yet will ye stand in awe of Yahweh Elohim.
content_old: 30 But as touching thee and thy servants I know､ that not yet will ye stand in awe of Yahweh Elohim.

content: 31 Now the flax and the barley were smitten,—for the barley was in the ear, and the flax was in flower;
content_old: 31 Now the flax and the barley were smitten,—for the barley was in the ear, and the flax was in flower;

content: 32 but the wheat and the spelt were not smitten,—for they were not ripe.
content_old: 32 but the wheat and the spelt were not smitten,—for they were not ripe.

content: 33 So Moses went away from Pharaoh､ out of the city, and spread out his hands unto Yahweh,—then did the thunderings and the hail cease, and rain was not poured out on the earth.
content_old: 33 So Moses went away from Pharaoh､ out of the city, and spread out his hands unto Yahweh,—then did the thunderings and the hail cease, and rain was not poured out on the earth.

content: 34 And when Pharaoh saw that the rain and the hail and the thunderings had ceased he again sinned,—and made his heart dull, he､ and his servants.
content_old: 34 And when Pharaoh saw that the rain and the hail and the thunderings had ceased he again sinned,—and made his heart dull, he､ and his servants.

content: 1 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Go in unto Pharaoh,—for I have suffered his heart to be dull､ and the heart of his servants, that I may show these my signs､ in their midst;
content_old: 1 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Go in unto Pharaoh,—for I have suffered his heart to be dull､ and the heart of his servants, that I may show these my signs､ in their midst;

content: 2 and that thou mayest recount in the ears of thy son､ and thy son’s son､ what I did in derision of the Egyptians, and my signs､ which I displayed among them,—so shall ye know that I am Yahweh.
content_old: 2 and that thou mayest recount in the ears of thy son､ and thy son’s son､ what I did in derision of the Egyptians, and my signs､ which I displayed among them,—so shall ye know that I am Yahweh.

content: 3 And Moses and Aaron went in unto Pharaoh, and said unto him— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of the Hebrews, How long hast thou refused to humble thyself before me? Let my people go､ that they may serve me.
content_old: 3 And Moses and Aaron went in unto Pharaoh, and said unto him— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of the Hebrews, How long hast thou refused to humble thyself before me? Let my people go､ that they may serve me.

content: 4 But if refusing thou art to let my people go behold me bringing in､ to-morrow､ a locust､ within thy bounds;
content_old: 4 But if refusing thou art to let my people go behold me bringing in､ to-morrow､ a locust､ within thy bounds;

content: 5 and it shall cover the eye of the land, so that one shall not be able to see the land,—and it shall eat the residue that hath escaped､ that is left you from the hail, and shall eat up all the trees that sprout for you､ out of the field;
content_old: 5 and it shall cover the eye of the land, so that one shall not be able to see the land,—and it shall eat the residue that hath escaped､ that is left you from the hail, and shall eat up all the trees that sprout for you､ out of the field;

content: 6 and they shall fill thy houses､ and the houses of all thy servants､ and the houses of all the Egyptians, such as thy fathers and thy fathers’ fathers have never seen, from the day they came to be on the ground, until this day. And he turned away､ and came out from the presence of Pharaoh.
content_old: 6 and they shall fill thy houses､ and the houses of all thy servants､ and the houses of all the Egyptians, such as thy fathers and thy fathers’ fathers have never seen, from the day they came to be on the ground, until this day. And he turned away､ and came out from the presence of Pharaoh.

content: 7 Then said the servants of Pharaoh unto him, How long shall this man become to us a snare? Let the men go, that they may serve Yahweh their God. Not yet knowest thou, that Egypt is ruined?
content_old: 7 Then said the servants of Pharaoh unto him, How long shall this man become to us a snare? Let the men go, that they may serve Yahweh their God. Not yet knowest thou, that Egypt is ruined?

content: 8 So Moses and Aaron were brought back unto Pharaoh, and he said unto them— Go, serve Yahweh your God,—who are they that are going?
content_old: 8 So Moses and Aaron were brought back unto Pharaoh, and he said unto them— Go, serve Yahweh your God,—who are they that are going?

content: 9 And Moses said, With our young and with our old will we go,—with our sons and with our daughters､ with our flocks and with our herds will we go,—for the festival of Yahweh is ours.
