content_old: 9 And Moses said, With our young and with our old will we go,—with our sons and with our daughters､ with our flocks and with our herds will we go,—for the festival of Yahweh is ours.

content: 10 Then he said unto them: Let Yahweh so be with you, when I let go you and your little ones! Look out､ for harm is straight before your faces.
content_old: 10 Then he said unto them: Let Yahweh so be with you, when I let go you and your little ones! Look out､ for harm is straight before your faces.

content: 11 Not so! Go､ I pray you､ ye grown men､ and serve Yahweh, for that is what ye were seeking. And they were driven out from the presence of Pharaoh.
content_old: 11 Not so! Go､ I pray you､ ye grown men､ and serve Yahweh, for that is what ye were seeking. And they were driven out from the presence of Pharaoh.

content: 12 Then said Yahweh unto Moses— Stretch forth thy hand over the land of Egypt､ for the locust, that it may come up over the land of Egypt,—and may eat up every herb of the land, all that the hail hath left.
content_old: 12 Then said Yahweh unto Moses— Stretch forth thy hand over the land of Egypt､ for the locust, that it may come up over the land of Egypt,—and may eat up every herb of the land, all that the hail hath left.

content: 13 And Moses stretched forth his staff over the land of Egypt, and Yahweh caused an east wind to drive through the land, all that day､ and all the night,—when the morning had come the east wind had brought the locust.
content_old: 13 And Moses stretched forth his staff over the land of Egypt, and Yahweh caused an east wind to drive through the land, all that day､ and all the night,—when the morning had come the east wind had brought the locust.

content: 14 And the locust came up over all the land of Egypt, and settled in all the bounds of Egypt,—very grievous, before it had not been such a locust as that , neither after it should be one like it.
content_old: 14 And the locust came up over all the land of Egypt, and settled in all the bounds of Egypt,—very grievous, before it had not been such a locust as that , neither after it should be one like it.

content: 15 So it covered the eye of all the land､ and the land was darkened, and it did eat every herb of the land､ and all the fruit of the trees, which the hail had left remaining,—so that there was not left remaining any green sprout in the trees��� or in the herb of the field､ in all the land of Egypt.
content_old: 15 So it covered the eye of all the land､ and the land was darkened, and it did eat every herb of the land､ and all the fruit of the trees, which the hail had left remaining,—so that there was not left remaining any green sprout in the trees��� or in the herb of the field､ in all the land of Egypt.

content: 16 Then hastened Pharaoh, to call for Moses and for Aaron,—and said— I have sinned against Yahweh your God､ and against you.
content_old: 16 Then hastened Pharaoh, to call for Moses and for Aaron,—and said— I have sinned against Yahweh your God､ and against you.

content: 17 Now therefore､ forgive､ I pray you､ my sin—only this time, and make entreaty to Yahweh your God,—that he may take away from me at least､ this death .
content_old: 17 Now therefore､ forgive､ I pray you､ my sin—only this time, and make entreaty to Yahweh your God,—that he may take away from me at least､ this death .

content: 18 So he came out from Pharaoh,—and made entreaty unto Yahweh;
content_old: 18 So he came out from Pharaoh,—and made entreaty unto Yahweh;

content: 19 and Yahweh turned back a west wind､ strong exceedingly, and carried away the locust､ and cast it into the Red Sea,—there was not left a single locust in all the bounds of Egypt.
content_old: 19 and Yahweh turned back a west wind､ strong exceedingly, and carried away the locust､ and cast it into the Red Sea,—there was not left a single locust in all the bounds of Egypt.

content: 20 But Yahweh suffered the heart of Pharaoh to wax bold,—and he did not let the sons of Israel go.
content_old: 20 But Yahweh suffered the heart of Pharaoh to wax bold,—and he did not let the sons of Israel go.

content: 21 Then said Yahweh unto Moses: Stretch forth thy hand over the heavens, that there may be darkness､ over the land of Egypt,—and that one may feel the darkness.
content_old: 21 Then said Yahweh unto Moses: Stretch forth thy hand over the heavens, that there may be darkness､ over the land of Egypt,—and that one may feel the darkness.

content: 22 So Moses stretched forth his hand､ over the heavens,—and there was thick darkness in all the land of Egypt､ for three days;
content_old: 22 So Moses stretched forth his hand､ over the heavens,—and there was thick darkness in all the land of Egypt､ for three days;

content: 23 they saw not one another､ neither rose any man from his couch､ for three days,—but all the sons of Israel had light in their dwellings.
content_old: 23 they saw not one another､ neither rose any man from his couch､ for three days,—but all the sons of Israel had light in their dwellings.

content: 24 Then Pharaoh called out unto Moses､ and said— Go､ serve Yahweh, only your flocks and your herds shall be left,—even your little ones shall go with you.
content_old: 24 Then Pharaoh called out unto Moses､ and said— Go､ serve Yahweh, only your flocks and your herds shall be left,—even your little ones shall go with you.

content: 25 And Moses said, Even thou thyself shalt give into our hands､ sacrifices and ascending-offerings,—so shall we present offerings to Yahweh our God.
content_old: 25 And Moses said, Even thou thyself shalt give into our hands､ sacrifices and ascending-offerings,—so shall we present offerings to Yahweh our God.

content: 26 Moreover also our own cattle shall go with us—there shall not be left behind a hoof, for thereof must we take, to serve Yahweh our God,—even we ourselves cannot know wherewith we must serve Yahweh, until we have come in thither.
content_old: 26 Moreover also our own cattle shall go with us—there shall not be left behind a hoof, for thereof must we take, to serve Yahweh our God,—even we ourselves cannot know wherewith we must serve Yahweh, until we have come in thither.

content: 27 And Yahweh let the heart of Pharaoh wax bold,—and he was not willing to let them go.
content_old: 27 And Yahweh let the heart of Pharaoh wax bold,—and he was not willing to let them go.

content: 28 So Pharaoh said to him— Get thee from me,—take heed to thyself—do not any more see my face, for in the day thou dost see my face thou shalt die.
content_old: 28 So Pharaoh said to him— Get thee from me,—take heed to thyself—do not any more see my face, for in the day thou dost see my face thou shalt die.

content: 1 Then said Yahweh unto Moses— Yet one plague will I bring in upon Pharaoh､ and upon Egypt, after that he will let you go from hence,—when he doth let you go he will altogether drive you out from hence.
content_old: 1 Then said Yahweh unto Moses— Yet one plague will I bring in upon Pharaoh､ and upon Egypt, after that he will let you go from hence,—when he doth let you go he will altogether drive you out from hence.

content: 2 Speak､ I pray you､ in the ears of the people,—and let them ask—every man of his neighbour､ and every woman of her neighbour, articles of silver and articles of gold.
content_old: 2 Speak､ I pray you､ in the ears of the people,—and let them ask—every man of his neighbour､ and every woman of her neighbour, articles of silver and articles of gold.

content: 3 And Yahweh gave the people favour､ in the eyes of the Egyptians,—even the man Moses himself was exceeding great in the land of Egypt,—in the eyes of Pharaoh’s servants､ and in the eyes of the people.
content_old: 3 And Yahweh gave the people favour､ in the eyes of the Egyptians,—even the man Moses himself was exceeding great in the land of Egypt,—in the eyes of Pharaoh’s servants､ and in the eyes of the people.

content: 4 And Moses said, Thus saith Yahweh,— About midnight am I going forth in the midst of Egypt;
content_old: 4 And Moses said, Thus saith Yahweh,— About midnight am I going forth in the midst of Egypt;

content: 5 then shall every firstborn in the land of Egypt die, from the firstborn of Pharaoh who is sitting on his throne, unto the firstborn of the handmaid who is behind the two millstones,—and every firstborn of beasts;
content_old: 5 then shall every firstborn in the land of Egypt die, from the firstborn of Pharaoh who is sitting on his throne, unto the firstborn of the handmaid who is behind the two millstones,—and every firstborn of beasts;

content: 6 then shall there be a great outcry､ in all the land of Egypt,—such as never was and such as shall not be again.
content_old: 6 then shall there be a great outcry､ in all the land of Egypt,—such as never was and such as shall not be again.

content: 7 But against none of the sons of Israel shall a dog sharpen his tongue, neither against man nor beast,—that ye may know that Yahweh maketh a difference between Egypt and Israel.
content_old: 7 But against none of the sons of Israel shall a dog sharpen his tongue, neither against man nor beast,—that ye may know that Yahweh maketh a difference between Egypt and Israel.

content: 8 So shall all these thy servants come down unto me､ and bow themselves down to me､ saying— Go forth､ thou､ and all the people who are in thy footsteps, and after that will I go forth. And he went forth from Pharaoh､ in a heat of anger.
content_old: 8 So shall all these thy servants come down unto me､ and bow themselves down to me､ saying— Go forth､ thou､ and all the people who are in thy footsteps, and after that will I go forth. And he went forth from Pharaoh､ in a heat of anger.

content: 9 And Yahweh had said unto Moses, Pharaoh will not hearken unto you,—that my wonders may be multiplied in the land of Egypt.
content_old: 9 And Yahweh had said unto Moses, Pharaoh will not hearken unto you,—that my wonders may be multiplied in the land of Egypt.

content: 1 Then spake Yahweh､ unto Moses and unto Aaron, in the land of Egypt､ saying—
content_old: 1 Then spake Yahweh､ unto Moses and unto Aaron, in the land of Egypt､ saying—

content: 2 This month is to you a beginning of months,—the first it is to you of the months of the year.
content_old: 2 This month is to you a beginning of months,—the first it is to you of the months of the year.

content: 3 Speak ye unto all the assembly of Israel､ saying, On the tenth of this month then let them take to them､ each man a lamb for his ancestral household､ a lamb for a household.
content_old: 3 Speak ye unto all the assembly of Israel､ saying, On the tenth of this month then let them take to them､ each man a lamb for his ancestral household､ a lamb for a household.

content: 4 But if the household be too small for a Iamb then shall he and his neighbour that is near unto his house take one､ according to the number of souls,—each man according to his eating shall ye number for the lamb.
content_old: 4 But if the household be too small for a Iamb then shall he and his neighbour that is near unto his house take one､ according to the number of souls,—each man according to his eating shall ye number for the lamb.

content: 5 A lamb without defect､ a male a year old shall yours be,—from the sheep､ or from the goats shall ye take it.
content_old: 5 A lamb without defect､ a male a year old shall yours be,—from the sheep､ or from the goats shall ye take it.

content: 6 So shall it be yours､ to keep, until the fourteenth day of this month,—then shall all the convocation of the assembly of Israel slay it､ between the two evenings.
content_old: 6 So shall it be yours､ to keep, until the fourteenth day of this month,—then shall all the convocation of the assembly of Israel slay it､ between the two evenings.

content: 7 And they shall take of the blood, and put upon the two door-posts､ and upon the upper-beam,—upon the houses wherein they are to eat it.
content_old: 7 And they shall take of the blood, and put upon the two door-posts､ and upon the upper-beam,—upon the houses wherein they are to eat it.

content: 8 Then shall they eat the flesh､ in the same night,—roast with fire､ and with unleavened cakes, with bitter herbs shall they eat it.
content_old: 8 Then shall they eat the flesh､ in the same night,—roast with fire､ and with unleavened cakes, with bitter herbs shall they eat it.

content: 9 Do not eat of it underdone, nor cooked by boiling in water,—but roast with fire, its head with its legs, and with its inward parts.
content_old: 9 Do not eat of it underdone, nor cooked by boiling in water,—but roast with fire, its head with its legs, and with its inward parts.

content: 10 And ye shall let nothing thereof remain until morning,—but that which is left remaining until morning in the fire shall ye consume.
content_old: 10 And ye shall let nothing thereof remain until morning,—but that which is left remaining until morning in the fire shall ye consume.

content: 11 And thus shall ye eat it,—your Ioins girded, your sandals on your feet, and your staff in your hand,—so shall ye eat it in haste, it is Yahweh’s passing over
content_old: 11 And thus shall ye eat it,—your Ioins girded, your sandals on your feet, and your staff in your hand,—so shall ye eat it in haste, it is Yahweh’s passing over

content: 12 I will pass along､ therefore､ throughout the land of Egypt､ this night, and will smite every firstborn in the land of Egypt, from man even to beast,—and against all the gods of Egypt will I execute judgments— I､ Yahweh.
content_old: 12 I will pass along､ therefore､ throughout the land of Egypt､ this night, and will smite every firstborn in the land of Egypt, from man even to beast,—and against all the gods of Egypt will I execute judgments— I､ Yahweh.

content: 13 Then shall the blood serve you for a sign､ on the houses wherein ye are, then will I behold the blood, and will pass over you,—and there shall be among you no plague to destroy, when I smite the land of Egypt.
content_old: 13 Then shall the blood serve you for a sign､ on the houses wherein ye are, then will I behold the blood, and will pass over you,—and there shall be among you no plague to destroy, when I smite the land of Egypt.

content: 14 So shall this day serve you for a memorial, and ye shall celebrate it､ as a festival to Yahweh,—to your generations—as an age-abiding statute shall ye celebrate it.
content_old: 14 So shall this day serve you for a memorial, and ye shall celebrate it､ as a festival to Yahweh,—to your generations—as an age-abiding statute shall ye celebrate it.

content: 15 Seven days unleavened cakes shall ye eat, surely､ on the first day shall ye put away leaven､ out of your houses,—for whosoever eateth what is leavened then shall that soul be cut off out of Israel, from the first day､ unto the seventh day.
content_old: 15 Seven days unleavened cakes shall ye eat, surely､ on the first day shall ye put away leaven､ out of your houses,—for whosoever eateth what is leavened then shall that soul be cut off out of Israel, from the first day､ unto the seventh day.

content: 16 Both on the first day a holy convocation, and on the seventh day—a holy convocation shall there be to you,—no work shall be done therein, save only what must be eaten by every soul that alone shall be done by you.
content_old: 16 Both on the first day a holy convocation, and on the seventh day—a holy convocation shall there be to you,—no work shall be done therein, save only what must be eaten by every soul that alone shall be done by you.

content: 17 So then ye shall observe the unleavened cakes, because on this self-same day brought I forth your hosts out of the land of Egypt,—so then ye shall observe this day to your generations､ as a statute age-abiding.
content_old: 17 So then ye shall observe the unleavened cakes, because on this self-same day brought I forth your hosts out of the land of Egypt,—so then ye shall observe this day to your generations､ as a statute age-abiding.

content: 18 In the first month､ on the fourteenth day of the month､ in the evening shall ye eat unleavened cakes,—until the one-and-twentieth day of the month､ in the evening.
content_old: 18 In the first month､ on the fourteenth day of the month､ in the evening shall ye eat unleavened cakes,—until the one-and-twentieth day of the month､ in the evening.

content: 19 For seven days leaven shall not be found in your houses,—for whosoever eateth what is leavened then shall that soul be cut off out of the assembly of Israel, whether sojourner､ or native of the land.
content_old: 19 For seven days leaven shall not be found in your houses,—for whosoever eateth what is leavened then shall that soul be cut off out of the assembly of Israel, whether sojourner､ or native of the land.

content: 20 Nothing leavened shall ye eat,—in all your dwellings shall ye eat unleavened cakes.
content_old: 20 Nothing leavened shall ye eat,—in all your dwellings shall ye eat unleavened cakes.

content: 21 So then Moses called for all the elders of Israel, and said unto them,— Proceed and take for yourselves one of the flock､ according to your families､ and slay the passover.
content_old: 21 So then Moses called for all the elders of Israel, and said unto them,— Proceed and take for yourselves one of the flock､ according to your families､ and slay the passover.

content: 22 Then shall ye take a bunch of hyssop､ and dip it in the blood which is in the basin, and strike the upper beam､ and the two door-posts, with the blood which is in the basin,—and ye shall not go forth､ any man out of the entrance of his house､ until morning.
content_old: 22 Then shall ye take a bunch of hyssop､ and dip it in the blood which is in the basin, and strike the upper beam､ and the two door-posts, with the blood which is in the basin,—and ye shall not go forth､ any man out of the entrance of his house､ until morning.

content: 23 And Yahweh will pass along to plague the Egyptians, and when he beholdeth the blood upon the upper beam､ and upon the two door-posts then will Yahweh pass over the entrance, and not suffer the destroyer to enter into your houses､ to inflict on you the plague.
content_old: 23 And Yahweh will pass along to plague the Egyptians, and when he beholdeth the blood upon the upper beam､ and upon the two door-posts then will Yahweh pass over the entrance, and not suffer the destroyer to enter into your houses､ to inflict on you the plague.

content: 24 And ye shall observe this thing,—for a statute to thee and to thy sons､ unto times age-abiding.
content_old: 24 And ye shall observe this thing,—for a statute to thee and to thy sons､ unto times age-abiding.

content: 25 And so it shall come to pass when ye shall enter into the land which Yahweh will give you､ as he hath spoken,—and ye shall observe this service;
content_old: 25 And so it shall come to pass when ye shall enter into the land which Yahweh will give you､ as he hath spoken,—and ye shall observe this service;

content: 26 and it shall come to pass､ that your sons shall say unto you,—What is this your service?
content_old: 26 and it shall come to pass､ that your sons shall say unto you,—What is this your service?

content: 27 Then shall ye say— A passover sacrifice it is to Yahweh､ who passed-over the houses of the sons of Israel､ in Egypt, when he plagued the Egyptians､ but our houses he delivered. Then did the people bend their heads and bow themselves down.
content_old: 27 Then shall ye say— A passover sacrifice it is to Yahweh､ who passed-over the houses of the sons of Israel､ in Egypt, when he plagued the Egyptians､ but our houses he delivered. Then did the people bend their heads and bow themselves down.

content: 28 And the sons of Israel went their way and did,—as Yahweh had commanded Moses and Aaron so did they.
content_old: 28 And the sons of Israel went their way and did,—as Yahweh had commanded Moses and Aaron so did they.

content: 29 And it came to pass at midnight that Yahweh smote every firstborn in the land of Egypt, from the firstborn of Pharaoh who sat upon his throne, unto the firstborn of the captive who was in the pit of his prison,—and every firstborn of beasts.
content_old: 29 And it came to pass at midnight that Yahweh smote every firstborn in the land of Egypt, from the firstborn of Pharaoh who sat upon his throne, unto the firstborn of the captive who was in the pit of his prison,—and every firstborn of beasts.

content: 30 Then rose up Pharaoh by night､ he､ and all his servants､ and all the Egyptians, and there arose a great outcry throughout Egypt,—for there was not a house, where there was not one dead.
content_old: 30 Then rose up Pharaoh by night､ he､ and all his servants､ and all the Egyptians, and there arose a great outcry throughout Egypt,—for there was not a house, where there was not one dead.

content: 31 So he called for Moses and for Aaron by night､ and said— Rise ye､ go forth out of the midst of my people, both ye､ and the sons of Israel,—and go､ serve Yahweh､ according to your word;
content_old: 31 So he called for Moses and for Aaron by night､ and said— Rise ye､ go forth out of the midst of my people, both ye､ and the sons of Israel,—and go､ serve Yahweh､ according to your word;

content: 32 also your flocks and your herds take ye､ as ye spake､ and go your way,—so shall ye bless､ even me.
content_old: 32 also your flocks and your herds take ye､ as ye spake､ and go your way,—so shall ye bless､ even me.

content: 33 And the Egyptians became urgent with the people, to send them in haste out of the land,—for they said— We all are dying.
content_old: 33 And the Egyptians became urgent with the people, to send them in haste out of the land,—for they said— We all are dying.

content: 34 So the people took up their dough､ ere yet it was leavened,—with their kneading-bowls､ bound up in their mantles､ on their shoulders.
content_old: 34 So the people took up their dough､ ere yet it was leavened,—with their kneading-bowls､ bound up in their mantles､ on their shoulders.

content: 35 And the sons of Israel did according to the word of Moses,—and asked of the Egyptians, articles of silver and articles of gold and mantles.
content_old: 35 And the sons of Israel did according to the word of Moses,—and asked of the Egyptians, articles of silver and articles of gold and mantles.

content: 36 And Yahweh gave the people favour in the eyes of the Egyptians､ and they gave them gladly,—so they spoiled the Egyptians.
content_old: 36 And Yahweh gave the people favour in the eyes of the Egyptians､ and they gave them gladly,—so they spoiled the Egyptians.

content: 37 Then did the sons of Israel break up from Rameses､ towards Succoth,—about six hundred thousand foot､ of men grown､ besides little ones.
content_old: 37 Then did the sons of Israel break up from Rameses､ towards Succoth,—about six hundred thousand foot､ of men grown､ besides little ones.

content: 38 Moreover also a mixed multitude came up with them,—flocks also､ and herds, exceeding much cattle.
content_old: 38 Moreover also a mixed multitude came up with them,—flocks also､ and herds, exceeding much cattle.

content: 39 Then baked they the dough which they had brought out of Egypt—into round unleavened cakes､ for it had not been leavened,—for they had been driven out of Egypt､ and could not tarry, and indeed no provisions had they made ready for themselves.
content_old: 39 Then baked they the dough which they had brought out of Egypt—into round unleavened cakes､ for it had not been leavened,—for they had been driven out of Egypt､ and could not tarry, and indeed no provisions had they made ready for themselves.

content: 40 Now the time during which the sons of Israel dwelt in Egypt was four hundred and thirty years.
content_old: 40 Now the time during which the sons of Israel dwelt in Egypt was four hundred and thirty years.

content: 41 And it came to pass at the end of four hundred and thirty years yea it came to pass on this self-same day that all the hosts of Yahweh had come forth out of the land of Egypt.
content_old: 41 And it came to pass at the end of four hundred and thirty years yea it came to pass on this self-same day that all the hosts of Yahweh had come forth out of the land of Egypt.

content: 42 A night of solemn observances it is unto Yahweh, for bringing them forth out of the land of Egypt,—this same night pertaineth to Yahweh, for solemn observances､ by all the sons of Israel､ to their generations.
content_old: 42 A night of solemn observances it is unto Yahweh, for bringing them forth out of the land of Egypt,—this same night pertaineth to Yahweh, for solemn observances､ by all the sons of Israel､ to their generations.

content: 43 And Yahweh said unto Moses and Aaron: This is the statute of the passover,—No stranger shall eat thereof;
content_old: 43 And Yahweh said unto Moses and Aaron: This is the statute of the passover,—No stranger shall eat thereof;

content: 44 but every man’s servant bought with silver,—when thou hast circumcised him then shall he eat thereof:
content_old: 44 but every man’s servant bought with silver,—when thou hast circumcised him then shall he eat thereof:

content: 45 An alien or a hireling shall not eat thereof.
content_old: 45 An alien or a hireling shall not eat thereof.

content: 46 In one house shall it be eaten, thou shalt not take forth､ out of the house､ any of the flesh､outside; and a bone thereof shalt thou not break.
content_old: 46 In one house shall it be eaten, thou shalt not take forth､ out of the house､ any of the flesh､outside; and a bone thereof shalt thou not break.

content: 47 All the assembly of Israel shall keep it.
content_old: 47 All the assembly of Israel shall keep it.

content: 48 And when there may sojourn with thee a sojourner who may wish to keep a passover to Yahweh there must be circumcised to him every male､ and then may he draw near to keep it, so shall he be as a native of the land,—but no uncircumcised male shall eat thereof.
content_old: 48 And when there may sojourn with thee a sojourner who may wish to keep a passover to Yahweh there must be circumcised to him every male､ and then may he draw near to keep it, so shall he be as a native of the land,—but no uncircumcised male shall eat thereof.

content: 49 One law shall there be for the native,—and for the sojourner that sojourneth in your midst.
content_old: 49 One law shall there be for the native,—and for the sojourner that sojourneth in your midst.

content: 50 Thus did all the sons of Israel,—as Yahweh had commanded Moses and Aaron so did they.
content_old: 50 Thus did all the sons of Israel,—as Yahweh had commanded Moses and Aaron so did they.

content: 1 And Yahweh spake unto Moses､ saying:
content_old: 1 And Yahweh spake unto Moses､ saying:

content: 2 Hallow to me every firstborn､ that which any female first beareth､ among the sons of Israel, among men and among beasts,—mine it is.
content_old: 2 Hallow to me every firstborn､ that which any female first beareth､ among the sons of Israel, among men and among beasts,—mine it is.

content: 3 And Moses said unto the people— Ye are to remember this day､ on which ye came forth out of Egypt､ out of the house of slaves, that with strength of hand did Yahweh bring you forth from hence,—there shall not､ therefore､ be eaten anything leavened.
content_old: 3 And Moses said unto the people— Ye are to remember this day､ on which ye came forth out of Egypt､ out of the house of slaves, that with strength of hand did Yahweh bring you forth from hence,—there shall not､ therefore､ be eaten anything leavened.

content: 4 To-day are ye coming forth,—in the month Abib.
content_old: 4 To-day are ye coming forth,—in the month Abib.

content: 5 And it shall be, when Yahweh shall bring thee into the land of the Canaanite and the Hittite and the Amorite､ and the Hivite and the Jebusite､ which he sware to thy fathers to give thee, a land flowing with milk and honey then shalt thou serve with this service､ in this month.
content_old: 5 And it shall be, when Yahweh shall bring thee into the land of the Canaanite and the Hittite and the Amorite､ and the Hivite and the Jebusite､ which he sware to thy fathers to give thee, a land flowing with milk and honey then shalt thou serve with this service､ in this month.

content: 6 Seven days shalt thou eat unleavened cakes,—and on the seventh day shall be a festival to Yahweh.
content_old: 6 Seven days shalt thou eat unleavened cakes,—and on the seventh day shall be a festival to Yahweh.

content: 7 Unleavened cakes shall be eaten for the seven days,—neither shall there be seen with thee anything leavened､ nor shall there be seen with thee leaven､ within any of thy bounds.
content_old: 7 Unleavened cakes shall be eaten for the seven days,—neither shall there be seen with thee anything leavened､ nor shall there be seen with thee leaven､ within any of thy bounds.

content: 8 And thou shalt tell thy son, on that day､ saying,— This is because of that which Yahweh did for me, when he brought me forth out of Egypt.
content_old: 8 And thou shalt tell thy son, on that day､ saying,— This is because of that which Yahweh did for me, when he brought me forth out of Egypt.

content: 9 And it shall be to thee for a sign upon thy hand､ and for a memorial between thine eyes, in order that the law of Yahweh may be in thy mouth,—for with a strong hand did Yahweh bring thee forth out of Egypt.
content_old: 9 And it shall be to thee for a sign upon thy hand､ and for a memorial between thine eyes, in order that the law of Yahweh may be in thy mouth,—for with a strong hand did Yahweh bring thee forth out of Egypt.

content: 10 So shalt thou observe this statute､ in its appointed time,—from year to year.
content_old: 10 So shalt thou observe this statute､ in its appointed time,—from year to year.

content: 11 And it shall be when Yahweh shall bring thee into the land of the Canaanite, as he sware to thee and to thy fathers,—and shalt give it thee
content_old: 11 And it shall be when Yahweh shall bring thee into the land of the Canaanite, as he sware to thee and to thy fathers,—and shalt give it thee

content: 12 that thou shalt set apart whatsoever is born first､ to Yahweh; and of all firstlings of beasts which thou shalt have the males shall pertain to Yahweh.
content_old: 12 that thou shalt set apart whatsoever is born first､ to Yahweh; and of all firstlings of beasts which thou shalt have the males shall pertain to Yahweh.

content: 13 But every firstling of an ass shalt thou redeem with a lamb or if thou wilt not redeem it then thou shalt break its neck,—but every firstborn of men among thy sons shalt thou redeem.
content_old: 13 But every firstling of an ass shalt thou redeem with a lamb or if thou wilt not redeem it then thou shalt break its neck,—but every firstborn of men among thy sons shalt thou redeem.

content: 14 And it shall be when thy son shall ask thee､ in time to come､ saying､ What is this? Then shalt thou say unto him: With strength of hand did Yahweh bring us forth out of Egypt､ out of the house of slaves.
content_old: 14 And it shall be when thy son shall ask thee､ in time to come､ saying､ What is this? Then shalt thou say unto him: With strength of hand did Yahweh bring us forth out of Egypt､ out of the house of slaves.

content: 15 And it came to pass when Pharaoh had shown himself too hardened to let us go then did Yahweh slay every firstborn in the land of Egypt, from the firstborn of men､ even unto the firstborn of beasts. For this cause am I sacrificing to Yahweh whatsoever is born first､ of the males, and every firstborn of my sons must I redeem.
content_old: 15 And it came to pass when Pharaoh had shown himself too hardened to let us go then did Yahweh slay every firstborn in the land of Egypt, from the firstborn of men､ even unto the firstborn of beasts. For this cause am I sacrificing to Yahweh whatsoever is born first､ of the males, and every firstborn of my sons must I redeem.

content: 16 And it shall be for a sign upon thy hand, and for frontlets between thine eyes,—that with strength of hand did Yahweh bring us forth out of Egypt.
content_old: 16 And it shall be for a sign upon thy hand, and for frontlets between thine eyes,—that with strength of hand did Yahweh bring us forth out of Egypt.

content: 17 And it came to pass when Pharaoh had let the people go that God did not lead by the land-way of the Philistines, although it was near,—for God said— Lest the people be dismayed when they see war､ and turn back to Egypt.
content_old: 17 And it came to pass when Pharaoh had let the people go that God did not lead by the land-way of the Philistines, although it was near,—for God said— Lest the people be dismayed when they see war､ and turn back to Egypt.

content: 18 So God took the people round the desert-way of the Red Sea,—and the sons of Israel went up armed out of the land of Egypt.
content_old: 18 So God took the people round the desert-way of the Red Sea,—and the sons of Israel went up armed out of the land of Egypt.

content: 19 And Moses took the bones of Joseph､ with him,—for he had taken an oath of the sons of Israel､ saying, God will surely visit you, so then ye shall carry up my bones from hence､ with you.
content_old: 19 And Moses took the bones of Joseph､ with him,—for he had taken an oath of the sons of Israel､ saying, God will surely visit you, so then ye shall carry up my bones from hence､ with you.

content: 20 And they brake up from Succoth,—and encamped in Etham, at the edge of the desert.
content_old: 20 And they brake up from Succoth,—and encamped in Etham, at the edge of the desert.

content: 21 Now Yahweh was going before them—by day in a pillar of cloud to lead them the way, and by night in a pillar of fire to give them light,—that they might journey day and night:
content_old: 21 Now Yahweh was going before them—by day in a pillar of cloud to lead them the way, and by night in a pillar of fire to give them light,—that they might journey day and night:

content: 1 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:
content_old: 1 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:

content: 2 Speak unto the sons of Israel, that they turn back and encamp before Pi-hahiroth, between Migdol and the sea,—before Baal-zephon, over against it shall ye encamp､ by the sea.
content_old: 2 Speak unto the sons of Israel, that they turn back and encamp before Pi-hahiroth, between Migdol and the sea,—before Baal-zephon, over against it shall ye encamp､ by the sea.

content: 3 Then will Pharaoh say､ of the sons of Israel, Entangled they are in the land,—the desert hath closed in upon them.
content_old: 3 Then will Pharaoh say､ of the sons of Israel, Entangled they are in the land,—the desert hath closed in upon them.

content: 4 So will I let the heart of Pharaoh wax bold､ and he will pursue them, that I may get me honour over Pharaoh､ and over all his forces, and the Egyptians shall know､ that I am Yahweh. And they did so.
content_old: 4 So will I let the heart of Pharaoh wax bold､ and he will pursue them, that I may get me honour over Pharaoh､ and over all his forces, and the Egyptians shall know､ that I am Yahweh. And they did so.

content: 5 And it was told the king of Egypt, that the people had fled,—and the heart of Pharaoh and his servants was turned against the people, and they said— What is this we have done, that we have let Israel go from serving us?
content_old: 5 And it was told the king of Egypt, that the people had fled,—and the heart of Pharaoh and his servants was turned against the people, and they said— What is this we have done, that we have let Israel go from serving us?

content: 6 So he yoked his chariot,—and his people took he with him.
content_old: 6 So he yoked his chariot,—and his people took he with him.

content: 7 And he took six hundred chosen chariots, and all the chariots of Egypt,—with warriors��� in every one.
content_old: 7 And he took six hundred chosen chariots, and all the chariots of Egypt,—with warriors��� in every one.

content: 8 And Yahweh let the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt wax bold, and he pursued the sons of Israel,—when the sons of Israel were going out with a high hand.
content_old: 8 And Yahweh let the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt wax bold, and he pursued the sons of Israel,—when the sons of Israel were going out with a high hand.

content: 9 So the Egyptians pursued them､ and overtook them､ encamping by the sea—all the horses and chariots of Pharaoh, and his horsemen､ and his forces,—by Pi-hahiroth, before Baal-zephon.
content_old: 9 So the Egyptians pursued them､ and overtook them､ encamping by the sea—all the horses and chariots of Pharaoh, and his horsemen､ and his forces,—by Pi-hahiroth, before Baal-zephon.

content: 10 Now when Pharaoh had drawn near the sons of Israel lifted up their eyes､ and lo! the Egyptians moving along after them､ and they feared greatly, and the sons of Israel made outcry unto Yahweh.
content_old: 10 Now when Pharaoh had drawn near the sons of Israel lifted up their eyes､ and lo! the Egyptians moving along after them､ and they feared greatly, and the sons of Israel made outcry unto Yahweh.

content: 11 Then said they unto Moses, Was it because there were no graves in Egypt, that thou didst fetch us､ to die in the desert? What is this thou hast done to us, bringing us forth out of Egypt?
content_old: 11 Then said they unto Moses, Was it because there were no graves in Egypt, that thou didst fetch us､ to die in the desert? What is this thou hast done to us, bringing us forth out of Egypt?

content: 12 Is not this the word which we spake unto thee in Egypt､ saying, Let us alone､ that we may serve the Egyptians,—for it is better for us to serve the Egyptians, than to die in the desert?
content_old: 12 Is not this the word which we spake unto thee in Egypt､ saying, Let us alone､ that we may serve the Egyptians,—for it is better for us to serve the Egyptians, than to die in the desert?

content: 13 And Moses said unto the people— Do not fear, stand still､ and see the salvation of Yahweh, which he will work for you to-day,—for as for the Egyptians whom ye have seen to-day ye shall not again see them any more､ to times age-abiding.
content_old: 13 And Moses said unto the people— Do not fear, stand still､ and see the salvation of Yahweh, which he will work for you to-day,—for as for the Egyptians whom ye have seen to-day ye shall not again see them any more､ to times age-abiding.

content: 14 Yahweh will fight for you,—and ye shall forbear.
content_old: 14 Yahweh will fight for you,—and ye shall forbear.

content: 15 And Yahweh said unto Moses, What outcry wouldst thou make unto me? Speak unto the sons of Israel, that they go forward;
content_old: 15 And Yahweh said unto Moses, What outcry wouldst thou make unto me? Speak unto the sons of Israel, that they go forward;

content: 16 and thou lift high thy staff､ and stretch forth thy hand over the sea､ and cleave it asunder,—that the sons of Israel may enter into the midst of the sea､ on dry ground;
content_old: 16 and thou lift high thy staff､ and stretch forth thy hand over the sea､ and cleave it asunder,—that the sons of Israel may enter into the midst of the sea､ on dry ground;

content: 17 and I behold me､ letting the heart of the Egyptians wax bold, that they may enter after them,—that I may get me honour over Pharaoh､ and over his forces, over his chariots､ and over his horsemen.
content_old: 17 and I behold me､ letting the heart of the Egyptians wax bold, that they may enter after them,—that I may get me honour over Pharaoh､ and over his forces, over his chariots､ and over his horsemen.

content: 18 And the Egyptians shall know､ that I am Yahweh,—when I have gotten me honour over Pharaoh, over his chariots､ and over his horsemen.
content_old: 18 And the Egyptians shall know､ that I am Yahweh,—when I have gotten me honour over Pharaoh, over his chariots､ and over his horsemen.

content: 19 And the messenger of God who was going on before the camp of Israel､ removed, and came on behind them,—and the pillar of cloud removed from before them, and stood behind them;
content_old: 19 And the messenger of God who was going on before the camp of Israel､ removed, and came on behind them,—and the pillar of cloud removed from before them, and stood behind them;

content: 20 so it came in between the camp of the Egyptians､ and the camp of Israel, so it became a cloud and darkness, and yet lighted up the night,—so that the one came not near unto the other､ all the night.
content_old: 20 so it came in between the camp of the Egyptians､ and the camp of Israel, so it became a cloud and darkness, and yet lighted up the night,—so that the one came not near unto the other､ all the night.

content: 21 And Moses stretched forth his hand over the sea, and Yahweh carried away the sea by a mighty east wind､ all the night, and turned the sea into dry land,—and the waters were cloven asunder.
content_old: 21 And Moses stretched forth his hand over the sea, and Yahweh carried away the sea by a mighty east wind､ all the night, and turned the sea into dry land,—and the waters were cloven asunder.

content: 22 Then went the sons of Israel into the midst of the sea､ on the dry ground,—and the waters to them were a wall, on their right hand､ and on their left.
content_old: 22 Then went the sons of Israel into the midst of the sea､ on the dry ground,—and the waters to them were a wall, on their right hand､ and on their left.

content: 23 And the Egyptians pursued, and entered after them—all the horses of Pharaoh､ his chariots and his horsemen,—into the midst of the sea.
content_old: 23 And the Egyptians pursued, and entered after them—all the horses of Pharaoh､ his chariots and his horsemen,—into the midst of the sea.

content: 24 And it came to pass in the morning watch that Yahweh looked down into the camp of the Egyptians, through the pillar of fire and cloud, and confused the camp of the Egyptians;
content_old: 24 And it came to pass in the morning watch that Yahweh looked down into the camp of the Egyptians, through the pillar of fire and cloud, and confused the camp of the Egyptians;

content: 25 and he took off the wheels of their chariots, and made them drive heavily,—so that the Egyptians said— We must flee from the face of Israel, for Yahweh is fighting for them､ against the Egyptians.
content_old: 25 and he took off the wheels of their chariots, and made them drive heavily,—so that the Egyptians said— We must flee from the face of Israel, for Yahweh is fighting for them､ against the Egyptians.

content: 26 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Stretch forth thy hand over the sea,—that the waters may return upon the Egyptians, upon their chariots, and upon their horsemen.
content_old: 26 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Stretch forth thy hand over the sea,—that the waters may return upon the Egyptians, upon their chariots, and upon their horsemen.

content: 27 So Moses stretched forth his hand over the sea､ and the sea returned､ towards morning､ to its steady flow, when the Egyptians were fleeing to meet it,—thus Yahweh shook off the Egyptians､ into the midst of the sea;
content_old: 27 So Moses stretched forth his hand over the sea､ and the sea returned､ towards morning､ to its steady flow, when the Egyptians were fleeing to meet it,—thus Yahweh shook off the Egyptians､ into the midst of the sea;

content: 28 thus the waters returned､ and covered the chariots､ and the horsemen, even all the forces of Pharaoh､ that were entering after them into the sea,—there was not left remaining among them so much as one.
content_old: 28 thus the waters returned､ and covered the chariots､ and the horsemen, even all the forces of Pharaoh､ that were entering after them into the sea,—there was not left remaining among them so much as one.

content: 29 But the sons of Israel had gone their way on dry ground in the midst of the sea,—and the waters had been to them a wall, on their right hand and on their left.
content_old: 29 But the sons of Israel had gone their way on dry ground in the midst of the sea,—and the waters had been to them a wall, on their right hand and on their left.

content: 30 Thus did Yahweh on that day､ save Israel､ out of the hand of the Egyptians,—and Israel saw the Egyptians, dead on the shore of the sea.
content_old: 30 Thus did Yahweh on that day､ save Israel､ out of the hand of the Egyptians,—and Israel saw the Egyptians, dead on the shore of the sea.

content: 1 Then sang Moses､ and the sons of Israel､ this song unto Yahweh, and they spake､ saying,— I will sing to Yahweh, for he is exalted､ exalted,— The horse and his rider hath he cast into the sea.
content_old: 1 Then sang Moses､ and the sons of Israel､ this song unto Yahweh, and they spake､ saying,— I will sing to Yahweh, for he is exalted､ exalted,— The horse and his rider hath he cast into the sea.

content: 2 My might and melody is Yah, And he became mine､ by salvation,— This is my GOD､ and I will glorify him, The God of my father､ and I will set him on high.
content_old: 2 My might and melody is Yah, And he became mine､ by salvation,— This is my GOD､ and I will glorify him, The God of my father､ and I will set him on high.

content: 3 Yahweh is a warlike one,— Yahweh is his name.
content_old: 3 Yahweh is a warlike one,— Yahweh is his name.

content: 4 The chariots of Pharaoh and his train hath he cast into the sea,— Yea the choice of his warriors were sunk in the Sedgy Sea.
content_old: 4 The chariots of Pharaoh and his train hath he cast into the sea,— Yea the choice of his warriors were sunk in the Sedgy Sea.

content: 5 Roaring deeps covered them,— They went down､ in the raging depths､ like a stone.
content_old: 5 Roaring deeps covered them,— They went down､ in the raging depths､ like a stone.

content: 6 Thy right hand､ O Yahweh､ is splendid in power,— Thy right hand､ O Yahweh､ dasheth in pieces a foe;
content_old: 6 Thy right hand､ O Yahweh､ is splendid in power,— Thy right hand､ O Yahweh､ dasheth in pieces a foe;

content: 7 And in the greatness of thine exaltation dost thou tear down thine opposers,— Thou dost send forth thy wrath, it consumeth them､ as straw;
content_old: 7 And in the greatness of thine exaltation dost thou tear down thine opposers,— Thou dost send forth thy wrath, it consumeth them､ as straw;

content: 8 And with the blast of thy nostrils heaped up are the waters, Upreared like a mound are the flowing waves,— Roaring deeps are congealed､ in the heart of the sea.
content_old: 8 And with the blast of thy nostrils heaped up are the waters, Upreared like a mound are the flowing waves,— Roaring deeps are congealed､ in the heart of the sea.

content: 9 Said the foe— I will pursue—overtake､ divide spoil,— Take her fill of them—shall my soul, I will bare my sword, root them out—shall my hand.
content_old: 9 Said the foe— I will pursue—overtake､ divide spoil,— Take her fill of them—shall my soul, I will bare my sword, root them out—shall my hand.

content: 10 Thou didst blow with thy wind､ they were covered by the sea,— They rolled like lead, into the waters so wide.
content_old: 10 Thou didst blow with thy wind､ they were covered by the sea,— They rolled like lead, into the waters so wide.

content: 11 Who is like unto thee､ among the mighty､ O Yahweh? Who is like unto thee､ Majestic in holiness,— To be revered in praises､ Doing a marvellous thing?
content_old: 11 Who is like unto thee､ among the mighty､ O Yahweh? Who is like unto thee､ Majestic in holiness,— To be revered in praises､ Doing a marvellous thing?

content: 12 Thou didst stretch forth thy right hand, earth swallowed them up.
content_old: 12 Thou didst stretch forth thy right hand, earth swallowed them up.

content: 13 Thou hast led forth in thy lovingkindness､ the people which thou hast redeemed,— Thou hast guided them in thy might､ into the home of thy holiness.
content_old: 13 Thou hast led forth in thy lovingkindness､ the people which thou hast redeemed,— Thou hast guided them in thy might､ into the home of thy holiness.

content: 14 Peoples have heard､ they tremble,— A pang hath seized the dwellers of Philistia:
content_old: 14 Peoples have heard､ they tremble,— A pang hath seized the dwellers of Philistia:

content: 15 Then were amazed the chiefs of Edom, The mighty ones of Moab, there seizeth them､ a trembling,— Melted away､ have all the dwellers of Canaan:
content_old: 15 Then were amazed the chiefs of Edom, The mighty ones of Moab, there seizeth them､ a trembling,— Melted away､ have all the dwellers of Canaan:

content: 16 There falleth upon them a terror and dread､With the greatness of thine arm are they struck dumb as a stone,— Till thy people pass over､ O Yahweh, Till the people pass over､ which thou hast made thine own:—
content_old: 16 There falleth upon them a terror and dread､With the greatness of thine arm are they struck dumb as a stone,— Till thy people pass over､ O Yahweh, Till the people pass over､ which thou hast made thine own:—

content: 17 Thou bringest them in and plantest them､ In the mountain of thine inheritance, Thy dwelling place to abide in､ which thou hast made, O Yahweh,— A hallowed place､ O My Lord､ which thy hands have established.
content_old: 17 Thou bringest them in and plantest them､ In the mountain of thine inheritance, Thy dwelling place to abide in､ which thou hast made, O Yahweh,— A hallowed place､ O My Lord､ which thy hands have established.

content: 18 Yahweh shall reign､ unto times age-abiding and beyond.
content_old: 18 Yahweh shall reign､ unto times age-abiding and beyond.

content: 19 For the horses of Pharaoh､ with his chariots and his horsemen､ entered into the sea, Then did Yahweh bring back upon them the waters of the sea,— But the sons of Israel had gone their way on the dry ground､ through the midst of the sea.
content_old: 19 For the horses of Pharaoh､ with his chariots and his horsemen､ entered into the sea, Then did Yahweh bring back upon them the waters of the sea,— But the sons of Israel had gone their way on the dry ground､ through the midst of the sea.

content: 20 Then took Miriam the prophetess､ sister of Aaron､ the timbrel in her hand,—and all the women came forth after her with timbrels､ and dances.
content_old: 20 Then took Miriam the prophetess､ sister of Aaron､ the timbrel in her hand,—and all the women came forth after her with timbrels､ and dances.

content: 21 And Miriam responded to the men, Sing to Yahweh､ for he is exalted—exalted, The horse and his rider hath he cast into the sea.
content_old: 21 And Miriam responded to the men, Sing to Yahweh､ for he is exalted—exalted, The horse and his rider hath he cast into the sea.

content: 22 And Moses caused Israel to break up from the Red Sea, and they went out into the desert of Shur,—and journeyed three days in the desert､ and found no water;
content_old: 22 And Moses caused Israel to break up from the Red Sea, and they went out into the desert of Shur,—and journeyed three days in the desert､ and found no water;

content: 23 and､ when they came in towards Marah､ they could not drink the waters of Marah, for they were bitter,—for this cause was the name thereof called Marah.
content_old: 23 and､ when they came in towards Marah､ they could not drink the waters of Marah, for they were bitter,—for this cause was the name thereof called Marah.

content: 24 So the people murmured against Moses—saying､ What are we to drink?
content_old: 24 So the people murmured against Moses—saying､ What are we to drink?

content: 25 And he made outcry unto Yahweh､ and Yahweh pointed out a tree, and he cast it into the waters､ and the waters became sweet,— There he appointed him a statute and regulation､ And there he put him to the proof.
content_old: 25 And he made outcry unto Yahweh､ and Yahweh pointed out a tree, and he cast it into the waters､ and the waters became sweet,— There he appointed him a statute and regulation､ And there he put him to the proof.

content: 26 And he said: If thou wilt indeed hearken to the voice of Yahweh thy God､ And the thing that is right in his eyes thou wilt do. And so give ear to his commandments､ And keep all his statutes None of the sicknesses which I laid on the Egyptians will I lay upon thee, For I am Yahweh､ thy physician.
content_old: 26 And he said: If thou wilt indeed hearken to the voice of Yahweh thy God､ And the thing that is right in his eyes thou wilt do. And so give ear to his commandments､ And keep all his statutes None of the sicknesses which I laid on the Egyptians will I lay upon thee, For I am Yahweh､ thy physician.

content: 1 Then moved they on from Elim, and all the assembly of the sons of Israel entered into the desert of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month, by their coming forth out of the land of Egypt.
content_old: 1 Then moved they on from Elim, and all the assembly of the sons of Israel entered into the desert of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month, by their coming forth out of the land of Egypt.

content: 2 Then did all the assembly of the sons of Israel murmur against Moses and against Aaron､ in the desert;
content_old: 2 Then did all the assembly of the sons of Israel murmur against Moses and against Aaron､ in the desert;

content: 3 and the sons of Israel said unto them— Oh that we had died by the hand of Yahweh､ in the land of Egypt, when we remained by the pot of flesh, when we did eat bread to the full,—for ye have brought us forth into this desert, to cause all this multitude to die by famine.
content_old: 3 and the sons of Israel said unto them— Oh that we had died by the hand of Yahweh､ in the land of Egypt, when we remained by the pot of flesh, when we did eat bread to the full,—for ye have brought us forth into this desert, to cause all this multitude to die by famine.

content: 4 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Behold me! raining down for you bread out of heaven,—and the people shall go out and gather､the portion for a day on its day, that I may prove them､ whether they will walk in my law､ or not.
content_old: 4 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Behold me! raining down for you bread out of heaven,—and the people shall go out and gather､the portion for a day on its day, that I may prove them､ whether they will walk in my law､ or not.

content: 5 And it shall come to pass on the sixth day that they shall settle what they shall bring in,—and it shall be twice as much as they gather day by day.
content_old: 5 And it shall come to pass on the sixth day that they shall settle what they shall bring in,—and it shall be twice as much as they gather day by day.

content: 6 So Moses and Aaron said unto all the sons of Israel,— At eventide then shall ye know that it was Yahweh who brought you forth､ out of the land of Egypt;
content_old: 6 So Moses and Aaron said unto all the sons of Israel,— At eventide then shall ye know that it was Yahweh who brought you forth､ out of the land of Egypt;

content: 7 and in the morning then shall ye see the glory of Yahweh､ in that he hath heard your murmurings against Yahweh,—what then are we that ye should murmur against us?
content_old: 7 and in the morning then shall ye see the glory of Yahweh､ in that he hath heard your murmurings against Yahweh,—what then are we that ye should murmur against us?

content: 8 And Moses said— In that Yahweh giveth you in the evening flesh to eat､ and bread in the morning､ to the full, in that Yahweh heareth your murmurings､ wherewith ye are murmuring against him what then are we? Not against us do ye murmur､ but against Yahweh.
content_old: 8 And Moses said— In that Yahweh giveth you in the evening flesh to eat､ and bread in the morning､ to the full, in that Yahweh heareth your murmurings､ wherewith ye are murmuring against him what then are we? Not against us do ye murmur､ but against Yahweh.

content: 9 And Moses said unto Aaron, Say unto all the assembly of the sons of Israel, Draw near､ before Yahweh,—for he hath heard your murmurings.
content_old: 9 And Moses said unto Aaron, Say unto all the assembly of the sons of Israel, Draw near､ before Yahweh,—for he hath heard your murmurings.

content: 10 And it came to pass､when Aaron spake unto all the assembly of the sons of Israel then turned they towards the desert,—and lo! the glory of Yahweh had appeared in the cloud.
content_old: 10 And it came to pass､when Aaron spake unto all the assembly of the sons of Israel then turned they towards the desert,—and lo! the glory of Yahweh had appeared in the cloud.

content: 11 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses—saying,
content_old: 11 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses—saying,

content: 12 I have heard the murmurings of the sons of Israel,—speak unto them､ saying— Between the two evenings shall ye eat flesh, and in the morning shall ye be filled with bread,—so shall ye know that I Yahweh am your God.
content_old: 12 I have heard the murmurings of the sons of Israel,—speak unto them､ saying— Between the two evenings shall ye eat flesh, and in the morning shall ye be filled with bread,—so shall ye know that I Yahweh am your God.

content: 13 And it came to pass in the evening that there came up quail, and covered the camp,—and in the morning was the outpouring of dew, round about the camp;
content_old: 13 And it came to pass in the evening that there came up quail, and covered the camp,—and in the morning was the outpouring of dew, round about the camp;

content: 14 and when the outpouring of dew went up then lo! on the face of the desert a thin flake, thin as hoar-frost､ on the earth.
content_old: 14 and when the outpouring of dew went up then lo! on the face of the desert a thin flake, thin as hoar-frost､ on the earth.

content: 15 And when the sons of Israel saw it､ they said one to another— What is that? For they knew not what “that” was. Then said Moses unto them, “That” is the bread which Yahweh hath given you to eat.
content_old: 15 And when the sons of Israel saw it､ they said one to another— What is that? For they knew not what “that” was. Then said Moses unto them, “That” is the bread which Yahweh hath given you to eat.

content: 16 This is the thing which Yahweh hath commanded, Gather ye thereof, each man､ what he needeth for eating,—an omer a head､ by the number of your souls, each man—for them who are in his tent shall ye take.
content_old: 16 This is the thing which Yahweh hath commanded, Gather ye thereof, each man､ what he needeth for eating,—an omer a head､ by the number of your souls, each man—for them who are in his tent shall ye take.

content: 17 And the sons of Israel did so,—and gathered, some more､ and some less;
content_old: 17 And the sons of Israel did so,—and gathered, some more､ and some less;

content: 18 and when they measured it with the omer he who had gathered more had nothing over, and he who had gathered less had no lack: each man､ what he needed for eating did they gather.
content_old: 18 and when they measured it with the omer he who had gathered more had nothing over, and he who had gathered less had no lack: each man､ what he needed for eating did they gather.

content: 19 And Moses said unto them,— Let no man leave thereof､ until morning.
content_old: 19 And Moses said unto them,— Let no man leave thereof､ until morning.

content: 20 But they hearkened not unto Moses､ but certain men left thereof until morning, and it swarmed with worms､ and became loathsome,—and Moses was wroth with them.
content_old: 20 But they hearkened not unto Moses､ but certain men left thereof until morning, and it swarmed with worms､ and became loathsome,—and Moses was wroth with them.

content: 21 Thus then they gathered it､ morning by morning, each man what he needed for eating,—and as soon as the sun waxed hot so soon it melted.
content_old: 21 Thus then they gathered it､ morning by morning, each man what he needed for eating,—and as soon as the sun waxed hot so soon it melted.

content: 22 And it came to pass on the sixth day that they gathered food twice as much, two omers for each one,—so all the princes of the assembly came in, and told Moses.
content_old: 22 And it came to pass on the sixth day that they gathered food twice as much, two omers for each one,—so all the princes of the assembly came in, and told Moses.

content: 23 And he said unto them— That is what Yahweh spake. The observance of a holy sabbath to Yahweh is to-morrow,—what ye would bake bake､ and what ye would boil boil, and all that is left over put by you､ to keep until the morning.
content_old: 23 And he said unto them— That is what Yahweh spake. The observance of a holy sabbath to Yahweh is to-morrow,—what ye would bake bake､ and what ye would boil boil, and all that is left over put by you､ to keep until the morning.

content: 24 So they put it by until the morning, as Moses had commanded,—and it gave no unpleasant odour, neither was there a worm therein.
content_old: 24 So they put it by until the morning, as Moses had commanded,—and it gave no unpleasant odour, neither was there a worm therein.

content: 25 Then said Moses— Eat ye it to-day, for a sabbath is to-day､ unto Yahweh,—to-day ye shall not find it in the field.
content_old: 25 Then said Moses— Eat ye it to-day, for a sabbath is to-day､ unto Yahweh,—to-day ye shall not find it in the field.

content: 26 Six days shall ye gather it,—but on the seventh day､ a sabbath it shall not be therein.
content_old: 26 Six days shall ye gather it,—but on the seventh day､ a sabbath it shall not be therein.

content: 27 And it came to pass on the seventh day that there went forth some of the people to gather,—but they found not.
content_old: 27 And it came to pass on the seventh day that there went forth some of the people to gather,—but they found not.

content: 28 Then said Yahweh unto Moses,— How long have ye refused to keep my commandments and my laws?
content_old: 28 Then said Yahweh unto Moses,— How long have ye refused to keep my commandments and my laws?

content: 29 See because Yahweh hath given you the sabbath for this cause is he giving you on the sixth day food for two days,—abide ye every man in his place､ let no man go forth from his dwelling､ on the seventh day.
content_old: 29 See because Yahweh hath given you the sabbath for this cause is he giving you on the sixth day food for two days,—abide ye every man in his place､ let no man go forth from his dwelling､ on the seventh day.

content: 30 So the people rested on the seventh day.
content_old: 30 So the people rested on the seventh day.

content: 31 And the house of Israel called the name thereof Manna,—and the same was like coriander seed､ white, and the taste thereof like flat-cake with honey.
content_old: 31 And the house of Israel called the name thereof Manna,—and the same was like coriander seed､ white, and the taste thereof like flat-cake with honey.

content: 32 And Moses said— This is the thing which Yahweh hath commanded, Fill an omer therefrom､ as a thing to be preserved､ to your generations,—that they may see the bread wherewith I fed you､ in the desert, when I brought you forth､ out of the land of Egypt.
content_old: 32 And Moses said— This is the thing which Yahweh hath commanded, Fill an omer therefrom､ as a thing to be preserved､ to your generations,—that they may see the bread wherewith I fed you､ in the desert, when I brought you forth､ out of the land of Egypt.

content: 33 So Moses said unto Aaron— Take a single basket, and put therein an omer-full of manna,—and set it down before Yahweh, as a thing to be preserved､ to your generations.
content_old: 33 So Moses said unto Aaron— Take a single basket, and put therein an omer-full of manna,—and set it down before Yahweh, as a thing to be preserved､ to your generations.

content: 34 As Yahweh gave command unto Moses so did Aaron set it down before the testimony､ as a thing to be preserved.
content_old: 34 As Yahweh gave command unto Moses so did Aaron set it down before the testimony､ as a thing to be preserved.

content: 35 And the sons of Israel did eat the manna forty years, until they entered into the land wherein they were to dwell,—the manna they did eat until they entered into the bounds of the land of Canaan.
content_old: 35 And the sons of Israel did eat the manna forty years, until they entered into the land wherein they were to dwell,—the manna they did eat until they entered into the bounds of the land of Canaan.

content: 1 And all the assembly of the sons of Israel set forward out of the desert of Sin､ by their removings､ at the bidding of Yahweh,—and encamped in Rephidim, and there was no water for the people to drink.
content_old: 1 And all the assembly of the sons of Israel set forward out of the desert of Sin､ by their removings､ at the bidding of Yahweh,—and encamped in Rephidim, and there was no water for the people to drink.

content: 2 And the people found fault with Moses, and said— Give us water､ that we may drink. And Moses said to them, Why should ye find fault with me? Why should ye put Yahweh to the proof?
content_old: 2 And the people found fault with Moses, and said— Give us water､ that we may drink. And Moses said to them, Why should ye find fault with me? Why should ye put Yahweh to the proof?

content: 3 So the people thirsted､ there､ for water, and the people murmured against Moses,—and said— Wherefore is it that thou hast brought us up out of Egypt, to kill me and my sons､ and my cattle､ with thirst?
content_old: 3 So the people thirsted､ there､ for water, and the people murmured against Moses,—and said— Wherefore is it that thou hast brought us up out of Egypt, to kill me and my sons､ and my cattle､ with thirst?

content: 4 And Moses made outcry unto Yahweh､ saying, What am I to do､ with this people? Yet a little and they will stone me.
content_old: 4 And Moses made outcry unto Yahweh､ saying, What am I to do､ with this people? Yet a little and they will stone me.

content: 5 Then said Yahweh unto Moses— Pass over before the people, and take､ with thee､ some of the elders of Israel,—thy staff also､ wherewith thou didst smite the river take thou in thy hand､ so shalt thou go thy way.
content_old: 5 Then said Yahweh unto Moses— Pass over before the people, and take､ with thee､ some of the elders of Israel,—thy staff also､ wherewith thou didst smite the river take thou in thy hand､ so shalt thou go thy way.

content: 6 Behold me! standing before thee､ there､ upon the rock in Horeb, then shalt thou smite the rock､ and there shall come forth therefrom water､ and the people shall drink. And Moses did so､ in the sight of the elders of Israel.
content_old: 6 Behold me! standing before thee､ there､ upon the rock in Horeb, then shalt thou smite the rock､ and there shall come forth therefrom water､ and the people shall drink. And Moses did so､ in the sight of the elders of Israel.

content: 7 So he called the name of the place, Massah､ and Meribah,—because of the fault-finding of the sons of Israel, and because of their putting Yahweh to the proof､ saying, Is Yahweh in our midst､ or is he not?
content_old: 7 So he called the name of the place, Massah､ and Meribah,—because of the fault-finding of the sons of Israel, and because of their putting Yahweh to the proof､ saying, Is Yahweh in our midst､ or is he not?

content: 8 Then came in Amalek,—and fought with Israel､ in Rephidim.
content_old: 8 Then came in Amalek,—and fought with Israel､ in Rephidim.

content: 9 And Moses said unto Joshua— Choose for us men, and go forth､ fight with Amalek,—to-morrow am I stationing myself upon the top of the hill, with the staff of God in my hand.
content_old: 9 And Moses said unto Joshua— Choose for us men, and go forth､ fight with Amalek,—to-morrow am I stationing myself upon the top of the hill, with the staff of God in my hand.

content: 10 So Joshua did､ as Moses had said to him, to fight with Amalek,—and Moses､ Aaron and Hur went up to the top of the hill.
content_old: 10 So Joshua did､ as Moses had said to him, to fight with Amalek,—and Moses､ Aaron and Hur went up to the top of the hill.

content: 11 And it shall be when Moses shall lift on high his hands then shall Israel prevail, but when he shall let down his hands then shall Amalek prevail.
content_old: 11 And it shall be when Moses shall lift on high his hands then shall Israel prevail, but when he shall let down his hands then shall Amalek prevail.

content: 12 But the hands of Moses were weary, so they took a stone､ and put under him､ and he sat thereupon,—and Aaron and Hur upheld his hands—on this side one､ and on that side one, and so his hands became steady､ until the going in of the sun.
content_old: 12 But the hands of Moses were weary, so they took a stone､ and put under him､ and he sat thereupon,—and Aaron and Hur upheld his hands—on this side one､ and on that side one, and so his hands became steady､ until the going in of the sun.

content: 13 So Joshua overthrew Amalek and his people､ with the edge of the sword.
content_old: 13 So Joshua overthrew Amalek and his people､ with the edge of the sword.

content: 14 Then said Yahweh unto Moses— Write this as a remembrancer in a book, and rehearse it in the ears of Joshua,—that I will wipe out the remembrance of Amalek, from under the heavens.
content_old: 14 Then said Yahweh unto Moses— Write this as a remembrancer in a book, and rehearse it in the ears of Joshua,—that I will wipe out the remembrance of Amalek, from under the heavens.

content: 15 And Moses built an altar,—and called the name thereof､ Yahweh-nissi.
content_old: 15 And Moses built an altar,—and called the name thereof､ Yahweh-nissi.

content: 1 And Jethro, priest of Midian, father-in-law of Moses, heard all that God had done for Moses､ and for Israel his people,—in that Yahweh had brought forth Israel out of Egypt.
content_old: 1 And Jethro, priest of Midian, father-in-law of Moses, heard all that God had done for Moses､ and for Israel his people,—in that Yahweh had brought forth Israel out of Egypt.

content: 2 So Jethro､ Moses’ father-in-law､ took Zipporah, Moses’ wife,—after she had been sent home;
content_old: 2 So Jethro､ Moses’ father-in-law､ took Zipporah, Moses’ wife,—after she had been sent home;

content: 3 and her two sons,—of whom the name of the one was Gershom, for, said he, A sojourner am I in a strange land,
content_old: 3 and her two sons,—of whom the name of the one was Gershom, for, said he, A sojourner am I in a strange land,

content: 4 and the name of the other Eliezer, for The God of my father was my help, and delivered me from the sword of Pharaoh.
content_old: 4 and the name of the other Eliezer, for The God of my father was my help, and delivered me from the sword of Pharaoh.

content: 5 And Jethro､ Moses’ father-in-law､ came in､ with his two sons and his wife､ unto Moses,—into the desert where he was encamping､ the mountain of God;
content_old: 5 And Jethro､ Moses’ father-in-law､ came in､ with his two sons and his wife､ unto Moses,—into the desert where he was encamping､ the mountain of God;

content: 6 and said unto Moses, I､ thy father-in-law､ Jethro､ am coming in unto thee,—and thy wife､ and her two sons､ with her.
content_old: 6 and said unto Moses, I､ thy father-in-law､ Jethro､ am coming in unto thee,—and thy wife､ and her two sons､ with her.

content: 7 So Moses went forth to meet his father-in-law, and bowed himself down to him､ and kissed him, and they asked each other of their welfare,—and came into the tent.
content_old: 7 So Moses went forth to meet his father-in-law, and bowed himself down to him､ and kissed him, and they asked each other of their welfare,—and came into the tent.

content: 8 Then Moses recounted to his father-in-law, all that Yahweh had done to Pharaoh､ and to the Egyptians, for Israel’s sake,—all the hardship which had befallen them by the way, and how Yahweh had delivered them.
content_old: 8 Then Moses recounted to his father-in-law, all that Yahweh had done to Pharaoh､ and to the Egyptians, for Israel’s sake,—all the hardship which had befallen them by the way, and how Yahweh had delivered them.

content: 9 Then did Jethro rejoice, for all the good which Yahweh had done to Israel,—whom he had delivered out of the hand of the Egyptians.
content_old: 9 Then did Jethro rejoice, for all the good which Yahweh had done to Israel,—whom he had delivered out of the hand of the Egyptians.

content: 10 And Jethro said— Blessed be Yahweh, who hath delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians､ and out of the hand of Pharaoh,— Who hath delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians:
content_old: 10 And Jethro said— Blessed be Yahweh, who hath delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians､ and out of the hand of Pharaoh,— Who hath delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians:

content: 11 Now I know､ that greater is Yahweh than all the gods,— Even in the thing wherein they were arrogant over them.
content_old: 11 Now I know､ that greater is Yahweh than all the gods,— Even in the thing wherein they were arrogant over them.

content: 12 Then took Jethro､ father-in-law of Moses､ an ascending-offering and sacrifices to God,—and Aaron and all the elders of Israel came in､ to eat bread with the father-in-law of Moses before God.
content_old: 12 Then took Jethro､ father-in-law of Moses､ an ascending-offering and sacrifices to God,—and Aaron and all the elders of Israel came in､ to eat bread with the father-in-law of Moses before God.

content: 13 Now it came to pass on the morrow that Moses sat､ to judge the people,—and the people stood by Moses, from the morning､ until the evening.
content_old: 13 Now it came to pass on the morrow that Moses sat､ to judge the people,—and the people stood by Moses, from the morning､ until the evening.

content: 14 And when Moses’ father-in-law saw all that he was doing for the people he said— What is this thing which thou art doing for the people? Wherefore art thou sitting alone, with all the people stationed by thee､ from morning until evening?
content_old: 14 And when Moses’ father-in-law saw all that he was doing for the people he said— What is this thing which thou art doing for the people? Wherefore art thou sitting alone, with all the people stationed by thee､ from morning until evening?

content: 15 And Moses said to his father-in-law,— Because the people come in unto me､ to seek God:
content_old: 15 And Moses said to his father-in-law,— Because the people come in unto me､ to seek God:

content: 16 When they have a matter they come in unto me, then do I judge between a man and his neighbour,—and make known the statutes of God､ and his laws.
content_old: 16 When they have a matter they come in unto me, then do I judge between a man and his neighbour,—and make known the statutes of God､ and his laws.

content: 17 Then said Moses’ father-in-law unto him,— Not good is the thing that thou art doing.
content_old: 17 Then said Moses’ father-in-law unto him,— Not good is the thing that thou art doing.

content: 18 Thou wilt get quite worn out both thou､ and this people that is with thee,—for the thing is too heavy for thee, thou canst not do it､alone.
content_old: 18 Thou wilt get quite worn out both thou､ and this people that is with thee,—for the thing is too heavy for thee, thou canst not do it､alone.

content: 19 Now hearken thou to my voice—let me counsel thee, and may God be with thee: Be thou for the people in front of God, so shalt thou bring the matters unto God;
content_old: 19 Now hearken thou to my voice—let me counsel thee, and may God be with thee: Be thou for the people in front of God, so shalt thou bring the matters unto God;

content: 20 and shalt cause to shine upon them, the statutes and the laws,—and make known to them the way wherein they should go, and the work they should do.
content_old: 20 and shalt cause to shine upon them, the statutes and the laws,—and make known to them the way wherein they should go, and the work they should do.

content: 21 Thou thyself therefore､ shalt look out, from among all the people—men of ability､ reverers of God､ men of fidelity､ haters of extortion,—and place them over them as rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens.
content_old: 21 Thou thyself therefore､ shalt look out, from among all the people—men of ability､ reverers of God､ men of fidelity､ haters of extortion,—and place them over them as rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens.

content: 22 So shall they judge the people at any time, and it shall be､all the great matters shall they bring in unto thee, but all the small matters shall they themselves judge,—so, lighten thou the burden for thyself, and let them bear it with thee.
content_old: 22 So shall they judge the people at any time, and it shall be､all the great matters shall they bring in unto thee, but all the small matters shall they themselves judge,—so, lighten thou the burden for thyself, and let them bear it with thee.

content: 23 If this thing thou wilt do, and God shall command thee then shalt thou be able to endure,—yea moreover all this people shall go in unto their dwellings contented.
content_old: 23 If this thing thou wilt do, and God shall command thee then shalt thou be able to endure,—yea moreover all this people shall go in unto their dwellings contented.

content: 24 So Moses hearkened to the voice of his father-in-law, and did all that he had said;
content_old: 24 So Moses hearkened to the voice of his father-in-law, and did all that he had said;

content: 25 and Moses chose men of ability out of all Israel, and set them to be heads over the people,—rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens.
content_old: 25 and Moses chose men of ability out of all Israel, and set them to be heads over the people,—rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens.

content: 26 And they shall judge the people､ at any time,—the hard matters shall they bring in unto Moses, but all the small matters shall they themselves judge.
content_old: 26 And they shall judge the people､ at any time,—the hard matters shall they bring in unto Moses, but all the small matters shall they themselves judge.

content: 1 In the third month, by the coming forth of the sons of Israel out of the land of Egypt on this day came they into the desert of Sinai:
content_old: 1 In the third month, by the coming forth of the sons of Israel out of the land of Egypt on this day came they into the desert of Sinai:

content: 2 then was it that they brake up out of Rephidim､ and came into the desert of Sinai, and encamped in the desert,—yea Israel encamped there､ before the mountain.
content_old: 2 then was it that they brake up out of Rephidim､ and came into the desert of Sinai, and encamped in the desert,—yea Israel encamped there､ before the mountain.

content: 3 And when Moses had gone up unto God then called Yahweh unto him､ out of the mountain､ saying, Thus shalt thou say to the house of Jacob, And tell the sons of Israel:
content_old: 3 And when Moses had gone up unto God then called Yahweh unto him､ out of the mountain､ saying, Thus shalt thou say to the house of Jacob, And tell the sons of Israel:

content: 4 Ye have seen､ what､ I did unto the Egyptians,— And how I bare you upon wings of eagles, And brought you in､ unto myself:—
content_old: 4 Ye have seen､ what､ I did unto the Egyptians,— And how I bare you upon wings of eagles, And brought you in､ unto myself:—

content: 5 Now､ therefore if ye will indeed hearken to my voice, And keep my covenant Then shall ye be mine､ as a treasure beyond all the peoples, For mine is all the earth;
content_old: 5 Now､ therefore if ye will indeed hearken to my voice, And keep my covenant Then shall ye be mine､ as a treasure beyond all the peoples, For mine is all the earth;
