content: 6 But ye shall be mine, As a kingdom of priests､ And a holy nation. These are the words, which thou shalt speak unto the､ sons of Israel.
content_old: 6 But ye shall be mine, As a kingdom of priests､ And a holy nation. These are the words, which thou shalt speak unto the､ sons of Israel.

content: 7 Then came Moses, and called for the elders of the people,—and put before them all these words､ which Yahweh had commanded him.
content_old: 7 Then came Moses, and called for the elders of the people,—and put before them all these words､ which Yahweh had commanded him.

content: 8 And all the people responded together､ and said, All that Yahweh hath spoken will we do. And Moses took back the words of the people､ unto Yahweh.
content_old: 8 And all the people responded together､ and said, All that Yahweh hath spoken will we do. And Moses took back the words of the people､ unto Yahweh.

content: 9 Then said Yahweh unto Moses: Lo! I am coming unto thee in the veiling of cloud, in order that the people may hear when I speak with thee, moreover also that in thee they may trust to times age-abiding. Then told Moses the words of the people､ unto Yahweh.
content_old: 9 Then said Yahweh unto Moses: Lo! I am coming unto thee in the veiling of cloud, in order that the people may hear when I speak with thee, moreover also that in thee they may trust to times age-abiding. Then told Moses the words of the people､ unto Yahweh.

content: 10 And Yahweh said unto Moses— Go unto the people, and thou shalt hallow them to-day､ and to-morrow,—and they shall wash their clothes;
content_old: 10 And Yahweh said unto Moses— Go unto the people, and thou shalt hallow them to-day､ and to-morrow,—and they shall wash their clothes;

content: 11 and shall be ready､ by the third day,—for on the third day will Yahweh come down in the sight of all the people､ upon Mount Sinai.
content_old: 11 and shall be ready､ by the third day,—for on the third day will Yahweh come down in the sight of all the people､ upon Mount Sinai.

content: 12 So then thou shalt set bounds for the people round about､ saying, Take heed to yourselves—that ye go not up into the mountain, nor touch the boundary thereof,—whosoever toucheth the mountain shall surely die.
content_old: 12 So then thou shalt set bounds for the people round about､ saying, Take heed to yourselves—that ye go not up into the mountain, nor touch the boundary thereof,—whosoever toucheth the mountain shall surely die.

content: 13 No hand shall touch it､ but he shall be surely stoned or be surely shot, whether beast or man he shall not live,— When the ram’s horn soundeth they themselves shall come up within the mount.
content_old: 13 No hand shall touch it､ but he shall be surely stoned or be surely shot, whether beast or man he shall not live,— When the ram’s horn soundeth they themselves shall come up within the mount.

content: 14 Then Moses went down out of the mount､ unto the people,—and hallowed the people, and they washed their clothes.
content_old: 14 Then Moses went down out of the mount､ unto the people,—and hallowed the people, and they washed their clothes.

content: 15 And he said unto the people, Be ready､ by the third day,—do not approach a woman.
content_old: 15 And he said unto the people, Be ready､ by the third day,—do not approach a woman.

content: 16 And it came to pass on the third day､ when the morning had come that there were thunderings and lightnings､ and a heavy cloud upon the mount, and the sound of a horn､ loud exceedingly,—and all the people who were in the camp trembled.
content_old: 16 And it came to pass on the third day､ when the morning had come that there were thunderings and lightnings､ and a heavy cloud upon the mount, and the sound of a horn､ loud exceedingly,—and all the people who were in the camp trembled.

content: 17 And Moses brought forth the people, to meet God､ out of the camp,—and they stationed themselves in the lower part of the mount.
content_old: 17 And Moses brought forth the people, to meet God､ out of the camp,—and they stationed themselves in the lower part of the mount.

content: 18 And Mount Sinai smoked all over, because Yahweh had come down thereon､in fire,—and the smoke thereof went up as the smoke of a furnace, and all the mountain trembled exceedingly.
content_old: 18 And Mount Sinai smoked all over, because Yahweh had come down thereon､in fire,—and the smoke thereof went up as the smoke of a furnace, and all the mountain trembled exceedingly.

content: 19 And as oft as the sound of the horn went on and became exceeding loud Moses spake and God responded to him with a voice.
content_old: 19 And as oft as the sound of the horn went on and became exceeding loud Moses spake and God responded to him with a voice.

content: 20 Thus came Yahweh down upon Mount Sinai､ unto the top of the mount,—and Yahweh called Moses unto the top of the mount､ and Moses went up.
content_old: 20 Thus came Yahweh down upon Mount Sinai､ unto the top of the mount,—and Yahweh called Moses unto the top of the mount､ and Moses went up.

content: 21 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Go down､ adjure the people,—lest they press through unto Yahweh､ to see, and so there fall from among them a multitude.
content_old: 21 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Go down､ adjure the people,—lest they press through unto Yahweh､ to see, and so there fall from among them a multitude.

content: 22 Yea even the priests who do approach unto Yahweh must hallow themselves,—lest Yahweh break in upon them.
content_old: 22 Yea even the priests who do approach unto Yahweh must hallow themselves,—lest Yahweh break in upon them.

content: 23 And Moses said unto Yahweh, The people cannot come up into Mount Sinai,—for thou thyself hast adjured us､ saying: Set bounds to the mountain and hallow it.
content_old: 23 And Moses said unto Yahweh, The people cannot come up into Mount Sinai,—for thou thyself hast adjured us､ saying: Set bounds to the mountain and hallow it.

content: 24 And Yahweh said unto him— Away､ down! then shalt thou come up､thou and Aaron with thee,—but as for the priests and the people let it not be that they press through to come up unto Yahweh､ lest he break in upon them.
content_old: 24 And Yahweh said unto him— Away､ down! then shalt thou come up､thou and Aaron with thee,—but as for the priests and the people let it not be that they press through to come up unto Yahweh､ lest he break in upon them.

content: 1 And God spake all these words､ saying:—
content_old: 1 And God spake all these words､ saying:—

content: 2 I am Yahweh thy God,—who have brought thee forth out of the land of Egypt､ out of the house of servants:—
content_old: 2 I am Yahweh thy God,—who have brought thee forth out of the land of Egypt､ out of the house of servants:—

content: 3 Thou shalt not have other gods､ besides me.
content_old: 3 Thou shalt not have other gods､ besides me.

content: 4 Thou shalt not make to thee an image､ or any form, that is in the heavens above,—or that is in the earth beneath,—or that is in the waters､ beneath the earth:
content_old: 4 Thou shalt not make to thee an image､ or any form, that is in the heavens above,—or that is in the earth beneath,—or that is in the waters､ beneath the earth:

content: 5 thou shalt not bow thyself down to them､ nor be led to serve them—For I､ Yahweh､ thy God am a jealous GOD, visiting the iniquity of fathers､ upon sons, unto three generations and unto four､ of them that hate me;
content_old: 5 thou shalt not bow thyself down to them､ nor be led to serve them—For I､ Yahweh､ thy God am a jealous GOD, visiting the iniquity of fathers､ upon sons, unto three generations and unto four､ of them that hate me;

content: 6 but shewing lovingkindness unto thousands of generations,—of them who love me､ and keep my commandments.
content_old: 6 but shewing lovingkindness unto thousands of generations,—of them who love me､ and keep my commandments.

content: 7 Thou shalt not utter the name of Yahweh thy God､ for falsehood, for Yahweh will not let him go unpunished who uttereth his name､ for falsehood.
content_old: 7 Thou shalt not utter the name of Yahweh thy God､ for falsehood, for Yahweh will not let him go unpunished who uttereth his name､ for falsehood.

content: 8 Remember the sabbath day､ to hallow it:
content_old: 8 Remember the sabbath day､ to hallow it:

content: 9 Six days shalt thou labour, and do all thy work;
content_old: 9 Six days shalt thou labour, and do all thy work;

content: 10 but the seventh day is a sabbath, unto Yahweh thy God,—thou shalt do no work thou､ nor thy son､ nor thy daughter､ nor thy servant､ nor thy handmaid､ nor thy beast, nor thy sojourner who is within thy gates.
content_old: 10 but the seventh day is a sabbath, unto Yahweh thy God,—thou shalt do no work thou､ nor thy son､ nor thy daughter､ nor thy servant､ nor thy handmaid､ nor thy beast, nor thy sojourner who is within thy gates.

content: 11 For in six days did Yahweh make the heavens and the earth､ and the sea—and all that in them is, and rested on the seventh day,—for this cause Yahweh blessed the sabbath day and hallowed it.
content_old: 11 For in six days did Yahweh make the heavens and the earth､ and the sea—and all that in them is, and rested on the seventh day,—for this cause Yahweh blessed the sabbath day and hallowed it.

content: 12 Honour thy father､ and thy mother,—that thy days may be prolonged upon the soil, which Yahweh thy God is about to give unto thee.
content_old: 12 Honour thy father､ and thy mother,—that thy days may be prolonged upon the soil, which Yahweh thy God is about to give unto thee.

content: 13 Thou shalt not commit murder.
content_old: 13 Thou shalt not commit murder.

content: 14 Thou shalt not commit adultery.
content_old: 14 Thou shalt not commit adultery.

content: 15 Thou shalt not steal.
content_old: 15 Thou shalt not steal.

content: 16 Thou shalt not testify against thy neighbour､ with a witness of falsehood.
content_old: 16 Thou shalt not testify against thy neighbour､ with a witness of falsehood.

content: 17 Thou shalt not covet､ thy neighbour’s house,—thou shalt not covet､ thy neighbour’s wife､ nor his servant､ nor his handmaid､ nor his ox､ nor his ass､ nor anything which belongeth unto thy neighbour.
content_old: 17 Thou shalt not covet､ thy neighbour’s house,—thou shalt not covet､ thy neighbour’s wife､ nor his servant､ nor his handmaid､ nor his ox､ nor his ass､ nor anything which belongeth unto thy neighbour.

content: 18 And all the people were witnessing the voices and the torches､ and the sound of the horn､ and the mountain､ smoking,—so then the people were struck with awe and shrank back, and stood afar off.
content_old: 18 And all the people were witnessing the voices and the torches､ and the sound of the horn､ and the mountain､ smoking,—so then the people were struck with awe and shrank back, and stood afar off.

content: 19 And they said unto Moses, Speak thou with us､ and we will hear,—but let not God speak with us､ lest we die.
content_old: 19 And they said unto Moses, Speak thou with us､ and we will hear,—but let not God speak with us､ lest we die.

content: 20 And Moses said unto the people— Do not fear, for to the end he may prove you hath God come,—and to the end the reverence of him may be upon your faces､ that ye sin not.
content_old: 20 And Moses said unto the people— Do not fear, for to the end he may prove you hath God come,—and to the end the reverence of him may be upon your faces､ that ye sin not.

content: 21 So then the people stood afar off,—and Moses approached unto the thick gloom, where God was.
content_old: 21 So then the people stood afar off,—and Moses approached unto the thick gloom, where God was.

content: 22 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Thus shalt thou say､ unto the sons of Israel,— Ye yourselves have seen that out of the heavens have I spoken with you.
content_old: 22 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Thus shalt thou say､ unto the sons of Israel,— Ye yourselves have seen that out of the heavens have I spoken with you.

content: 23 Ye shall not make aught beside me,—neither gods of silver､ nor gods of gold shall ye make to yourselves.
content_old: 23 Ye shall not make aught beside me,—neither gods of silver､ nor gods of gold shall ye make to yourselves.

content: 24 An altar of earth shalt thou make to me, then shalt thou offer thereupon thine ascending-sacrifices､ and thy peace-offerings, thy sheep, and thine oxen. In every place where I may mention my name will I come in unto thee､ and will bless thee.
content_old: 24 An altar of earth shalt thou make to me, then shalt thou offer thereupon thine ascending-sacrifices､ and thy peace-offerings, thy sheep, and thine oxen. In every place where I may mention my name will I come in unto thee､ and will bless thee.

content: 25 But if an altar of stones thou wilt make to me thou shalt not build them hewn,—for as soon as thou hast lifted thy sharp tool thereupon thou hast profaned it;
content_old: 25 But if an altar of stones thou wilt make to me thou shalt not build them hewn,—for as soon as thou hast lifted thy sharp tool thereupon thou hast profaned it;

content: 1 Now these are the regulations which thou shalt put before them.
content_old: 1 Now these are the regulations which thou shalt put before them.

content: 2 When thou shalt acquire a servant who is a Hebrew six years shall he serve,—but in the seventh shall he go out freely—for nought.
content_old: 2 When thou shalt acquire a servant who is a Hebrew six years shall he serve,—but in the seventh shall he go out freely—for nought.

content: 3 If by himself he came in by himse shall he go out,—if he was married then shall his wife go out with him.
content_old: 3 If by himself he came in by himse shall he go out,—if he was married then shall his wife go out with him.

content: 4 If ||his lord|| gave him a wife, and she have borne him sons or daughters the wife and her children shall be her lord’s, and he shall go out by himself.
content_old: 4 If ||his lord|| gave him a wife, and she have borne him sons or daughters the wife and her children shall be her lord’s, and he shall go out by himself.

content: 5 But if the servant shall plainly say, I love my lord, and my wife､ and my sons,—I will not go out free
content_old: 5 But if the servant shall plainly say, I love my lord, and my wife､ and my sons,—I will not go out free

content: 6 then shall his lord bring him near unto God, and shall bring him near unto the door, or unto the door-post,—and his lord shall pierce his ear with an awl, so shall he serve him all his life.
content_old: 6 then shall his lord bring him near unto God, and shall bring him near unto the door, or unto the door-post,—and his lord shall pierce his ear with an awl, so shall he serve him all his life.

content: 7 And when a man shall sell his daughter to be a handmaid she shall not go out according to the out-going of the men-servants.
content_old: 7 And when a man shall sell his daughter to be a handmaid she shall not go out according to the out-going of the men-servants.

content: 8 If she is uncomely in the eyes of her lord, who hath not assigned her in marriage then shall he suffer her to be redeemed: to a strange people shall he not have power to sell her､ in that he hath dealt treacherously with her.
content_old: 8 If she is uncomely in the eyes of her lord, who hath not assigned her in marriage then shall he suffer her to be redeemed: to a strange people shall he not have power to sell her､ in that he hath dealt treacherously with her.

content: 9 And if to his son he assign her according to the custom for daughters shall he do for her.
content_old: 9 And if to his son he assign her according to the custom for daughters shall he do for her.

content: 10 If he take to himself another her food､ her clothing､ and her marriage-right shall he not withdraw.
content_old: 10 If he take to himself another her food､ her clothing､ and her marriage-right shall he not withdraw.

content: 11 But if these three he will not do for her then shall she go out for nought, without silver.
content_old: 11 But if these three he will not do for her then shall she go out for nought, without silver.

content: 12 He that smiteth a man, so that he die shall surely be put to death.
content_old: 12 He that smiteth a man, so that he die shall surely be put to death.

content: 13 But he who hath not lain in wait, but God hath occasioned him to come to his hand then will I appoint for thee a place, whither he may flee.
content_old: 13 But he who hath not lain in wait, but God hath occasioned him to come to his hand then will I appoint for thee a place, whither he may flee.

content: 14 But when a man shall act presumptuously against his neighbour､ to slay him with guile ､from mine altar shalt thou take him to die.
content_old: 14 But when a man shall act presumptuously against his neighbour､ to slay him with guile ､from mine altar shalt thou take him to die.

content: 15 And he that smiteth his father or his mother shall surely be put to death.
content_old: 15 And he that smiteth his father or his mother shall surely be put to death.

content: 16 And he that stealeth a man of the sons of Israel and selleth him､ or he be found in his hand shall surely be put to death.
content_old: 16 And he that stealeth a man of the sons of Israel and selleth him､ or he be found in his hand shall surely be put to death.

content: 17 And he who revileth his father or his mother shall surely be put to death.
content_old: 17 And he who revileth his father or his mother shall surely be put to death.

content: 18 And when men strive together, and one shall smite the other､ with a stone or with his fist,—and he die not､ but shall fall to his bed;—
content_old: 18 And when men strive together, and one shall smite the other､ with a stone or with his fist,—and he die not､ but shall fall to his bed;—

content: 19 if he rise､ and shall walk abroad on his staff then shall he that smote him be acquitted,—only for his loss of time he shall pay, and shall surely heal him.
content_old: 19 if he rise､ and shall walk abroad on his staff then shall he that smote him be acquitted,—only for his loss of time he shall pay, and shall surely heal him.

content: 20 And when a man shall smite his servant or his handmaid with a rod, and he die､ under his hand he shall surely be avenged;
content_old: 20 And when a man shall smite his servant or his handmaid with a rod, and he die､ under his hand he shall surely be avenged;

content: 21 nevertheless if for a day or for two days he continue he shall not be avenged, for his silver he is.
content_old: 21 nevertheless if for a day or for two days he continue he shall not be avenged, for his silver he is.

content: 22 And when men strive together､ and push against a woman with child､ and she miscarry, but there is no other mischief he shall surely be fined､ according as the woman’s husband shall lay upon him, but he shall give it through judges.
content_old: 22 And when men strive together､ and push against a woman with child､ and she miscarry, but there is no other mischief he shall surely be fined､ according as the woman’s husband shall lay upon him, but he shall give it through judges.

content: 23 But if mischief follow then shalt thou give life for life;
content_old: 23 But if mischief follow then shalt thou give life for life;

content: 24 eye for eye, tooth for tooth,—hand for hand, foot for foot,
content_old: 24 eye for eye, tooth for tooth,—hand for hand, foot for foot,

content: 25 brand for brand, wound for wound,—stripe for stripe.
content_old: 25 brand for brand, wound for wound,—stripe for stripe.

content: 26 And when a man smiteth the eye of his servant､ or the eye of his handmaid､ and destroyeth it he shall send him forth free for his eye;
content_old: 26 And when a man smiteth the eye of his servant､ or the eye of his handmaid､ and destroyeth it he shall send him forth free for his eye;

content: 27 or if the tooth of his servant､ or the tooth of his handmaid he knock out he shall send him forth free for his tooth.
content_old: 27 or if the tooth of his servant､ or the tooth of his handmaid he knock out he shall send him forth free for his tooth.

content: 28 And when an ox goreth a man or a woman､ and death ensueth the ox shall surely be stoned and his flesh shall not be eaten, and the owner of the ox shall be quit.
content_old: 28 And when an ox goreth a man or a woman､ and death ensueth the ox shall surely be stoned and his flesh shall not be eaten, and the owner of the ox shall be quit.

content: 29 But if the ox was wont to gore before that time and it hath been attested to his owner､ and he hath not proceeded to put him under guard, and he causeth the death of man or woman the ox shall be stoned, and his owner also shall be put to death.
content_old: 29 But if the ox was wont to gore before that time and it hath been attested to his owner､ and he hath not proceeded to put him under guard, and he causeth the death of man or woman the ox shall be stoned, and his owner also shall be put to death.

content: 30 If a sin-covering be laid on him then shall he give a ransom for his life, according to whatsoever may be laid on him:
content_old: 30 If a sin-covering be laid on him then shall he give a ransom for his life, according to whatsoever may be laid on him:

content: 31 if a son he gore､ or a daughter he gore according to this regulation shall it be done to him;
content_old: 31 if a son he gore､ or a daughter he gore according to this regulation shall it be done to him;

content: 32 if a servant the ox gore､ or a handmaid thirty shekels of silver shall he give to his lord, and the ox shall be stoned.
content_old: 32 if a servant the ox gore､ or a handmaid thirty shekels of silver shall he give to his lord, and the ox shall be stoned.

content: 33 And when a man openeth a pit, or when a man diggeth a pit､ and doth not cover it,—and there falleth thereinto an ox or an ass
content_old: 33 And when a man openeth a pit, or when a man diggeth a pit､ and doth not cover it,—and there falleth thereinto an ox or an ass

content: 34 the owner of the pit shall make it good, silver shall he pay back to the owner thereof,—and the dead beast shall be his.
content_old: 34 the owner of the pit shall make it good, silver shall he pay back to the owner thereof,—and the dead beast shall be his.

content: 35 And when the ox of one man thrusteth the ox of his neighbour､ so that it dieth then shall they sell the live ox､ and divide the silver thereof, and the dead ox also shall they divide.
content_old: 35 And when the ox of one man thrusteth the ox of his neighbour､ so that it dieth then shall they sell the live ox､ and divide the silver thereof, and the dead ox also shall they divide.

content: 1 When a man stealeth an ox or a sheep, and slayeth it､ or selleth it with five of the herd shall he make good—for the ox, or with four of the flock for the sheep.
content_old: 1 When a man stealeth an ox or a sheep, and slayeth it､ or selleth it with five of the herd shall he make good—for the ox, or with four of the flock for the sheep.

content: 2 If in the place of breaking in the thief be found and he is smitten so that he dieth there is due for him no shedding of blood:
content_old: 2 If in the place of breaking in the thief be found and he is smitten so that he dieth there is due for him no shedding of blood:

content: 3 should the sun have arisen upon him there would be shedding of blood due for him,—he is surely to make restitution, if he hath nothing then is he to be sold､ for his theft.
content_old: 3 should the sun have arisen upon him there would be shedding of blood due for him,—he is surely to make restitution, if he hath nothing then is he to be sold､ for his theft.

content: 4 If the thing stolen is found in his hand—whether ox､ or ass､ or sheep､ alive with two shall he make restitution.
content_old: 4 If the thing stolen is found in his hand—whether ox､ or ass､ or sheep､ alive with two shall he make restitution.

content: 5 When a man causeth a field or a vineyard to be depastured, or hath sent in his own cattle and stripped the field of another he shall surely make restitution out of his own field､ according to the yield thereof; or if all the field he depasture with the best of his own field､ or with the best of his own vineyard shall he make restitution.
content_old: 5 When a man causeth a field or a vineyard to be depastured, or hath sent in his own cattle and stripped the field of another he shall surely make restitution out of his own field､ according to the yield thereof; or if all the field he depasture with the best of his own field､ or with the best of his own vineyard shall he make restitution.

content: 6 When a fire breaketh out､ and hath come upon thorns､ and so there is consumed a stack of sheaves､ or the standing corn､ or the field he that kindled the fire shall surely make restitution.
content_old: 6 When a fire breaketh out､ and hath come upon thorns､ and so there is consumed a stack of sheaves､ or the standing corn､ or the field he that kindled the fire shall surely make restitution.

content: 7 When a man giveth unto his neighbour silver or jewelry､ to keep, and it is stolen out of the house of the man:
content_old: 7 When a man giveth unto his neighbour silver or jewelry､ to keep, and it is stolen out of the house of the man:

content: 8 if the thief be found he shall give in restitution double: if the thief be not found then shall the owner of the house be brought near unto God to swear that he hath not laid his hand on the property of his neighbour.
content_old: 8 if the thief be found he shall give in restitution double: if the thief be not found then shall the owner of the house be brought near unto God to swear that he hath not laid his hand on the property of his neighbour.

content: 9 For any affair of trespass—for an ox､ for an ass､ for a sheep､ for a mantle､ for anything lost､ as to which one could say—This is it unto God shall come the affair of them both,—he whom God shall condemn shall make restitution of double､ to his neighbour.
content_old: 9 For any affair of trespass—for an ox､ for an ass､ for a sheep､ for a mantle､ for anything lost､ as to which one could say—This is it unto God shall come the affair of them both,—he whom God shall condemn shall make restitution of double､ to his neighbour.

content: 10 When a man delivereth unto his neighbour､ an ass､ or an ox､ or a sheep, or any beast to keep,—and it dieth､ or is fractured､ or is driven away､ no one beholding
content_old: 10 When a man delivereth unto his neighbour､ an ass､ or an ox､ or a sheep, or any beast to keep,—and it dieth､ or is fractured､ or is driven away､ no one beholding

content: 11 the oath of Yahweh shall come between them both, That he hath not laid his hand on the property of his neighbour,—then shall the owner thereof accept it､ and he shall not make restitution.
content_old: 11 the oath of Yahweh shall come between them both, That he hath not laid his hand on the property of his neighbour,—then shall the owner thereof accept it､ and he shall not make restitution.

content: 12 But if it be verily stolen from him he shall make restitution to the owner thereof.
content_old: 12 But if it be verily stolen from him he shall make restitution to the owner thereof.

content: 13 If it be verily torn in pieces he shall bring it in as a witness,—for that which was torn he shall not make restitution.
content_old: 13 If it be verily torn in pieces he shall bring it in as a witness,—for that which was torn he shall not make restitution.

content: 14 And when a man asketh aught of his neighbour､ and it is fractured or dieth, its owner not being with it he shall surely make restitution.
content_old: 14 And when a man asketh aught of his neighbour､ and it is fractured or dieth, its owner not being with it he shall surely make restitution.

content: 15 lf its owner was with it he shall not make restitution,—if it is hired it cometh into its hire.
content_old: 15 lf its owner was with it he shall not make restitution,—if it is hired it cometh into its hire.

content: 16 And when a man enticeth a virgin who is not betrothed､ and lieth with her he shall surely pay a purchase-price that she may be his wife.
content_old: 16 And when a man enticeth a virgin who is not betrothed､ and lieth with her he shall surely pay a purchase-price that she may be his wife.

content: 17 If her father utterly refuse to give her to him silver shall he weigh out, according to the purchase-price of virgins.
content_old: 17 If her father utterly refuse to give her to him silver shall he weigh out, according to the purchase-price of virgins.

content: 18 A sorceress shalt thou not suffer to live.
content_old: 18 A sorceress shalt thou not suffer to live.

content: 19 Whosoever lieth with a beast shall surely be put to death.
content_old: 19 Whosoever lieth with a beast shall surely be put to death.

content: 20 He that sacrificeth to the gods shall be devoted to destruction,—except he sacrificeth to Yahweh alone.
content_old: 20 He that sacrificeth to the gods shall be devoted to destruction,—except he sacrificeth to Yahweh alone.

content: 21 And a sojourner shalt thou not tread down､ neither shalt thou drive him away,—for sojourners ye became in the land of Egypt.
content_old: 21 And a sojourner shalt thou not tread down､ neither shalt thou drive him away,—for sojourners ye became in the land of Egypt.

content: 22 Neither widow nor fatherless shalt thou humiliate:
content_old: 22 Neither widow nor fatherless shalt thou humiliate:

content: 23 if thou do humiliate him when he in anywise crieth out unto me I will surely hear his outcry:
content_old: 23 if thou do humiliate him when he in anywise crieth out unto me I will surely hear his outcry:

content: 24 so shall kindle mine anger, and I will slay you with the sword,—and your wives shall become widows, and your sons fatherless.
content_old: 24 so shall kindle mine anger, and I will slay you with the sword,—and your wives shall become widows, and your sons fatherless.

content: 25 If silver thou wilt lend unto my people—unto the humbled one by thee thou shalt not be to him like one that lendeth on interest,—thou shalt not lay upon him interest.
content_old: 25 If silver thou wilt lend unto my people—unto the humbled one by thee thou shalt not be to him like one that lendeth on interest,—thou shalt not lay upon him interest.

content: 26 If thou do take in pledge the mantle of thy neighbour by the going in of the sun shalt thou restore it to him;
content_old: 26 If thou do take in pledge the mantle of thy neighbour by the going in of the sun shalt thou restore it to him;

content: 27 for that is his only covering, that is his mantle､ for his skin,—wherein shall he sleep? and it shall come to pass､ when he maketh outcry unto me then will I hear､ because gracious I am.
content_old: 27 for that is his only covering, that is his mantle､ for his skin,—wherein shall he sleep? and it shall come to pass､ when he maketh outcry unto me then will I hear､ because gracious I am.

content: 28 God shalt thou not revile,—and a prince among thy people shalt thou not curse.
content_old: 28 God shalt thou not revile,—and a prince among thy people shalt thou not curse.

content: 29 Thy fulness and thine outflow shalt thou not delay,—the firstborn of thy sons shalt thou give to me.
content_old: 29 Thy fulness and thine outflow shalt thou not delay,—the firstborn of thy sons shalt thou give to me.

content: 30 Thus shalt thou do with thine ox､ with thy sheep,—seven days shall it be with its dam, on the eighth day shalt thou give it to me.
content_old: 30 Thus shalt thou do with thine ox､ with thy sheep,—seven days shall it be with its dam, on the eighth day shalt thou give it to me.

content: 1 Thou shalt not utter a false report. Do not lay thy hand with a lawless man, to become a witness helping forward violence and wrong.
content_old: 1 Thou shalt not utter a false report. Do not lay thy hand with a lawless man, to become a witness helping forward violence and wrong.

content: 2 Thou shalt not follow multitudes to commit wickedness,—neither shalt thou answer in a quarrel､ so as to turn away after multitudes､ to mislead.
content_old: 2 Thou shalt not follow multitudes to commit wickedness,—neither shalt thou answer in a quarrel､ so as to turn away after multitudes､ to mislead.

content: 3 Even a poor man shalt thou not prefer in his quarrel.
content_old: 3 Even a poor man shalt thou not prefer in his quarrel.

content: 4 When thou meetest the ox of thine enemy､ or his ass､ going astray thou shalt surely bring it back to him.
content_old: 4 When thou meetest the ox of thine enemy､ or his ass､ going astray thou shalt surely bring it back to him.

content: 5 When thou seest the ass of him that hateth thee､ sinking down under his burden, and mightest have foreborne to unload him thou shalt surely help him to unload
content_old: 5 When thou seest the ass of him that hateth thee､ sinking down under his burden, and mightest have foreborne to unload him thou shalt surely help him to unload

content: 6 Thou shalt not pervert the vindication of thy needy one､ in his quarrel.
content_old: 6 Thou shalt not pervert the vindication of thy needy one､ in his quarrel.

content: 7 From a matter of falsehood thou shalt keep far away,—and the innocent one and the righteous do not thou slay, for I will not justify a lawless man.
content_old: 7 From a matter of falsehood thou shalt keep far away,—and the innocent one and the righteous do not thou slay, for I will not justify a lawless man.

content: 8 And a bribe shalt thou not take,—for the bribe blindeth the clear-sighted, and perverteth the words of the righteous.
content_old: 8 And a bribe shalt thou not take,—for the bribe blindeth the clear-sighted, and perverteth the words of the righteous.

content: 9 And a sojourner shalt thou not drive away,—seeing that ye yourselves know the､ soul of a sojourner; for sojourners became ye in the land of Egypt.
content_old: 9 And a sojourner shalt thou not drive away,—seeing that ye yourselves know the､ soul of a sojourner; for sojourners became ye in the land of Egypt.

content: 10 And six years shalt thou sow thy land,—and shalt gather the yield thereof;
content_old: 10 And six years shalt thou sow thy land,—and shalt gather the yield thereof;

content: 11 but the seventh year shalt thou let it rest and be still､ so shall the needy of thy people eat, and what they leave shall the wild-beast of the field eat,—in like manner shalt thou deal with thy vineyard､ with thine oliveyard.
content_old: 11 but the seventh year shalt thou let it rest and be still､ so shall the needy of thy people eat, and what they leave shall the wild-beast of the field eat,—in like manner shalt thou deal with thy vineyard､ with thine oliveyard.

content: 12 Six days shalt thou do thy work, but on the seventh day shalt thou keep sabbath,—that thine ox may rest､ and thine ass, and that the son of thy handmaid､ and the sojourner､ may be refreshed.
content_old: 12 Six days shalt thou do thy work, but on the seventh day shalt thou keep sabbath,—that thine ox may rest､ and thine ass, and that the son of thy handmaid､ and the sojourner､ may be refreshed.

content: 13 And in all that I have said unto thee shalt thou take heed to thyself,—and the name of other gods shalt thou not mention, it shall not be heard upon thy mouth.
content_old: 13 And in all that I have said unto thee shalt thou take heed to thyself,—and the name of other gods shalt thou not mention, it shall not be heard upon thy mouth.

content: 14 Three times shalt thou keep festival to me､ in the year.
content_old: 14 Three times shalt thou keep festival to me､ in the year.

content: 15 The festival of unleavened cakes shalt thou keep,��seven days shalt thou eat unleavened cakes､ as I commanded thee､ at the appointed time of the month Abib; for therein camest thou forth out of Egypt,—and they shall not see my face empty-handed.
content_old: 15 The festival of unleavened cakes shalt thou keep,��seven days shalt thou eat unleavened cakes､ as I commanded thee､ at the appointed time of the month Abib; for therein camest thou forth out of Egypt,—and they shall not see my face empty-handed.

content: 16 And the festival of harvest､ with the firstfruits of thy labours, which thou shalt sow in the field. And the festival of ingathering—at the outgoing of the year, when thou hast gathered in thy labours､ out of the field.
content_old: 16 And the festival of harvest､ with the firstfruits of thy labours, which thou shalt sow in the field. And the festival of ingathering—at the outgoing of the year, when thou hast gathered in thy labours､ out of the field.

content: 17 Three times in the year shall all thy males see the face of the Lord Yahweh.
content_old: 17 Three times in the year shall all thy males see the face of the Lord Yahweh.

content: 18 Thou shalt not offer with anything leavened the blood of my sacrifice,—neither shall the fat of my festival-sacrifice remain until morning.
content_old: 18 Thou shalt not offer with anything leavened the blood of my sacrifice,—neither shall the fat of my festival-sacrifice remain until morning.

content: 19 The beginning of the firstfruits of thy ground shalt thou bring into the house of Yahweh thy God. Thou shalt not boil a kid､ in the milk of its dam.
content_old: 19 The beginning of the firstfruits of thy ground shalt thou bring into the house of Yahweh thy God. Thou shalt not boil a kid､ in the milk of its dam.

content: 20 Lo! I am sending a messenger before thee, to guard thee in the way,—and to bring thee into the place which I have prepared.
content_old: 20 Lo! I am sending a messenger before thee, to guard thee in the way,—and to bring thee into the place which I have prepared.

content: 21 Take thou heed of his presence､ and hearken to his voice—do not vex him,—for he will not pardon your transgression, for my name is within him.
content_old: 21 Take thou heed of his presence､ and hearken to his voice—do not vex him,—for he will not pardon your transgression, for my name is within him.

content: 22 But if thou wilt indeed hearken to his voice, and so wilt do all that I may speak then will I be an enemy to thine enemies, and an adversary to thine adversaries;
content_old: 22 But if thou wilt indeed hearken to his voice, and so wilt do all that I may speak then will I be an enemy to thine enemies, and an adversary to thine adversaries;

content: 23 for my messenger shall go before thee, and bring thee in—unto the Amorite､ and the Hittite, and the Perizzite､ and the Canaanite, the Hivite､ and the Jebusite,—so will I destroy them.
content_old: 23 for my messenger shall go before thee, and bring thee in—unto the Amorite､ and the Hittite, and the Perizzite､ and the Canaanite, the Hivite､ and the Jebusite,—so will I destroy them.

content: 24 Thou shalt not bow thyself down to their gods､ neither shalt thou be led to serve them, neither shalt thou do according to their works,—but thou shalt verily overthrow them, and completely break in pieces their pillars.
content_old: 24 Thou shalt not bow thyself down to their gods､ neither shalt thou be led to serve them, neither shalt thou do according to their works,—but thou shalt verily overthrow them, and completely break in pieces their pillars.

content: 25 So shall ye serve Yahweh your God, and he will bless thy bread､ and thy water,—and I will take away sickness out of thy midst.
content_old: 25 So shall ye serve Yahweh your God, and he will bless thy bread､ and thy water,—and I will take away sickness out of thy midst.

content: 26 There shall be nothing casting its young or barren､ in thy land,—the number of thy days will I make full.
content_old: 26 There shall be nothing casting its young or barren､ in thy land,—the number of thy days will I make full.

content: 27 My terror will I send before thee, and will confound all the people�� amongst whom thou shalt come,—and will deliver up all thine enemies unto thee as they flee.
content_old: 27 My terror will I send before thee, and will confound all the people�� amongst whom thou shalt come,—and will deliver up all thine enemies unto thee as they flee.

content: 28 And I will send the hornet､ before thee,—and it shall drive out the Hivite､ the Canaanite､ and the Hittite､ from before thee.
content_old: 28 And I will send the hornet､ before thee,—and it shall drive out the Hivite､ the Canaanite､ and the Hittite､ from before thee.

content: 29 I will not drive them out from before thee､ in one year,—lest the land should become a desolation, so would the wild-beast of the field multiply over thee.
content_old: 29 I will not drive them out from before thee､ in one year,—lest the land should become a desolation, so would the wild-beast of the field multiply over thee.

content: 30 Little by little will I drive them out from before thee,—until thou become fruitful, then shalt thou take possession of the land.
content_old: 30 Little by little will I drive them out from before thee,—until thou become fruitful, then shalt thou take possession of the land.

content: 31 So will I set thy bounds from the Red Sea､ even unto the sea of the Philistines, and from the desert unto the River (Euphrates),—for I will deliver into your hand the inhabitants of the land, so shalt thou drive them out from before thee.
content_old: 31 So will I set thy bounds from the Red Sea､ even unto the sea of the Philistines, and from the desert unto the River (Euphrates),—for I will deliver into your hand the inhabitants of the land, so shalt thou drive them out from before thee.

content: 32 Thou shalt not make､ with them or with their gods a covenant:
content_old: 32 Thou shalt not make､ with them or with their gods a covenant:

content: 1 And unto Moses he said— Come up unto Yahweh—thou､ and Aaron､ Nadab､ and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel,—so shall ye bow yourselves down､ from afar.
content_old: 1 And unto Moses he said— Come up unto Yahweh—thou､ and Aaron､ Nadab､ and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel,—so shall ye bow yourselves down､ from afar.

content: 2 And Moses alone shall draw near unto Yahweh, but they shall not draw near,—and the people shall not come up with him.
content_old: 2 And Moses alone shall draw near unto Yahweh, but they shall not draw near,—and the people shall not come up with him.

content: 3 So Moses came､ and recounted to the people all the words of Yahweh, and all the regulation,—and all the people responded with one voice､ and said, All the words which Yahweh hath spoken will we do.
content_old: 3 So Moses came､ and recounted to the people all the words of Yahweh, and all the regulation,—and all the people responded with one voice､ and said, All the words which Yahweh hath spoken will we do.

content: 4 Then wrote Moses all the words of Yahweh, and rose up early in the morning､ and builded an altar､ under the mountain,—and twelve pillars, for the twelve tribes of Israel;
content_old: 4 Then wrote Moses all the words of Yahweh, and rose up early in the morning､ and builded an altar､ under the mountain,—and twelve pillars, for the twelve tribes of Israel;

content: 5 and he sent young men of the sons of Israel, and they caused to go up､ ascending-sacrifices,—and slew peace-offerings to Yahweh､ of oxen.
content_old: 5 and he sent young men of the sons of Israel, and they caused to go up､ ascending-sacrifices,—and slew peace-offerings to Yahweh､ of oxen.

content: 6 Then took Moses､ half of the blood, and put it in basins, and half of the blood dashed he over the altar;
content_old: 6 Then took Moses､ half of the blood, and put it in basins, and half of the blood dashed he over the altar;

content: 7 then took he the book of the covenant, and read in the ears of the people. And they said, All that Yahweh hath spoken will we do､ and will hearken.
content_old: 7 then took he the book of the covenant, and read in the ears of the people. And they said, All that Yahweh hath spoken will we do､ and will hearken.

content: 8 Then Moses took the blood, and dashed over the people,—and said, Lo! the blood of the covenant which Yahweh hath solemnised with you, over all these words.
content_old: 8 Then Moses took the blood, and dashed over the people,—and said, Lo! the blood of the covenant which Yahweh hath solemnised with you, over all these words.

content: 9 Then went up Moses and Aaron, Nadab and Abihu､ and seventy of the elders of Israel;
content_old: 9 Then went up Moses and Aaron, Nadab and Abihu､ and seventy of the elders of Israel;

content: 10 and they saw the God of Israel,—and under his feet like a pavement of sapphire, and like the very heavens､ for brightness; and
content_old: 10 and they saw the God of Israel,—and under his feet like a pavement of sapphire, and like the very heavens､ for brightness; and

content: 11 against the nobles of the sons of Israel put he not forth his hand,—so then they had vision of God, and did eat and drink.
content_old: 11 against the nobles of the sons of Israel put he not forth his hand,—so then they had vision of God, and did eat and drink.

content: 12 Then said Yahweh unto Moses— Come thou up unto me､ in the mountain､ and remain thou there,—for I must give thee tables of stone､ and the law､ and the commandment, which I have written､ to direct them.
content_old: 12 Then said Yahweh unto Moses— Come thou up unto me､ in the mountain､ and remain thou there,—for I must give thee tables of stone､ and the law､ and the commandment, which I have written､ to direct them.

content: 13 And Moses rose up, and Joshua his attendant, and Moses went up into the mountain of God;
content_old: 13 And Moses rose up, and Joshua his attendant, and Moses went up into the mountain of God;

content: 14 but unto the elders he said— Tarry for us here, until we return unto you. And lo! Aaron and Hur are with you, he that hath a cause let him draw near unto them.
content_old: 14 but unto the elders he said— Tarry for us here, until we return unto you. And lo! Aaron and Hur are with you, he that hath a cause let him draw near unto them.

content: 15 So then Moses went up into the mountain,—and the cloud covered the mountain.
content_old: 15 So then Moses went up into the mountain,—and the cloud covered the mountain.

content: 16 And the glory of Yahweh rested upon Mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it six days,—then called he unto Moses､ on the seventh day､ out of the midst of the cloud.
content_old: 16 And the glory of Yahweh rested upon Mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it six days,—then called he unto Moses､ on the seventh day､ out of the midst of the cloud.

content: 17 And the appearance of the glory of Yahweh was like a consuming fire､ on the top of the mountain,—in the sight of the sons of Israel.
content_old: 17 And the appearance of the glory of Yahweh was like a consuming fire､ on the top of the mountain,—in the sight of the sons of Israel.

content: 1 And Yahweh spake unto Moses､ saying:
content_old: 1 And Yahweh spake unto Moses､ saying:

content: 2 Speak unto the sons of Israel, that they take for me､ a heave-offering,—of every man whose heart urgeth him shall ye take my heave-offering.
content_old: 2 Speak unto the sons of Israel, that they take for me､ a heave-offering,—of every man whose heart urgeth him shall ye take my heave-offering.

content: 3 And this is the heave-offering which ye shall take of them,—gold and silver､ and bronze;
content_old: 3 And this is the heave-offering which ye shall take of them,—gold and silver､ and bronze;

content: 4 and blue､ and purple､ and crimson､ and fine linen､ and goat’s hair;
content_old: 4 and blue､ and purple､ and crimson､ and fine linen､ and goat’s hair;

content: 5 and rams’ skins dyed red､ and badgers’ skins､ and acacia wood;
content_old: 5 and rams’ skins dyed red､ and badgers’ skins､ and acacia wood;

content: 6 oil for giving light,—perfumes for the anointing oil, and for fragrant incense;
content_old: 6 oil for giving light,—perfumes for the anointing oil, and for fragrant incense;

content: 7 onyx stones､ and setting stones,—for the ephod and for the breastpiece:
content_old: 7 onyx stones､ and setting stones,—for the ephod and for the breastpiece:

content: 8 So shall they make for me a sanctuary,—and I will make my habitation in their midst:
content_old: 8 So shall they make for me a sanctuary,—and I will make my habitation in their midst:

content: 9 according to all that I am shewing thee, the pattern of the habitation､ and the pattern of all the furnishings thereof even so shall ye make it.
content_old: 9 according to all that I am shewing thee, the pattern of the habitation､ and the pattern of all the furnishings thereof even so shall ye make it.

content: 10 And they shall make an ark of acacia wood,—two cubits and a half the length thereof､ and a cubit and a half the breadth thereof, and a cubit and a half the height thereof.
content_old: 10 And they shall make an ark of acacia wood,—two cubits and a half the length thereof､ and a cubit and a half the breadth thereof, and a cubit and a half the height thereof.

content: 11 And thou shalt overlay it with pure gold, within and without shalt thou overlay it,—and thou shalt make thereon a rim of gold､ round about.
content_old: 11 And thou shalt overlay it with pure gold, within and without shalt thou overlay it,—and thou shalt make thereon a rim of gold､ round about.

content: 12 And thou shalt cast for it four rings of gold, and shalt put them on the four feet thereof,—even two rings on the one side thereof, and two rings､ on the other side thereof.
content_old: 12 And thou shalt cast for it four rings of gold, and shalt put them on the four feet thereof,—even two rings on the one side thereof, and two rings､ on the other side thereof.

content: 13 And thou shalt make staves､ of acacia wood,—and shalt overlay them､ with gold.
content_old: 13 And thou shalt make staves､ of acacia wood,—and shalt overlay them､ with gold.

content: 14 And thou shalt bring in the staves､ into the rings, on the sides of the ark,—to bear the ark therewith.
content_old: 14 And thou shalt bring in the staves､ into the rings, on the sides of the ark,—to bear the ark therewith.

content: 15 In the rings of the ark shall remain the staves,—they shall not be removed therefrom.
content_old: 15 In the rings of the ark shall remain the staves,—they shall not be removed therefrom.

content: 16 And thou shalt put into the ark,—the testimony which I will give unto thee.
content_old: 16 And thou shalt put into the ark,—the testimony which I will give unto thee.

content: 17 And thou shalt make a propitiatory､ of pure gold,—two cubits and a half the length thereof, and a cubit and a half the breadth thereof.
content_old: 17 And thou shalt make a propitiatory､ of pure gold,—two cubits and a half the length thereof, and a cubit and a half the breadth thereof.

content: 18 And thou shalt make two cherubim､ of gold,—of beaten work shalt thou make them, out of the two ends of the propitiatory.
content_old: 18 And thou shalt make two cherubim､ of gold,—of beaten work shalt thou make them, out of the two ends of the propitiatory.

content: 19 And make thou one cherub out of this end, and the other cherub out of that end,—out of the propitiatory shall ye make the cherubim､ upon the two ends thereof.
content_old: 19 And make thou one cherub out of this end, and the other cherub out of that end,—out of the propitiatory shall ye make the cherubim､ upon the two ends thereof.

content: 20 And the cherubim shall be spreading out two wings on high—making a shelter with their wings over the propitiatory, with their faces､ one towards the other,—towards the propitiatory shall be the faces of the cherubim.
content_old: 20 And the cherubim shall be spreading out two wings on high—making a shelter with their wings over the propitiatory, with their faces､ one towards the other,—towards the propitiatory shall be the faces of the cherubim.

content: 21 And thou shalt put the propitiatory upon the ark､ above,—and in the ark shalt thou put the testimony, which I will give unto thee.
content_old: 21 And thou shalt put the propitiatory upon the ark､ above,—and in the ark shalt thou put the testimony, which I will give unto thee.

content: 22 And I will meet with thee there, and will speak with thee from off the propitiatory､ from between the two cherubim, which are upon the ark of the testimony,—whatsoever I may give thee in charge､ for the sons of Israel.
content_old: 22 And I will meet with thee there, and will speak with thee from off the propitiatory､ from between the two cherubim, which are upon the ark of the testimony,—whatsoever I may give thee in charge､ for the sons of Israel.

content: 23 And thou shalt make a table､ of acacia wood,—two cubits the length thereof, and a cubit the breadth thereof, and a cubit and a half the height thereof,
content_old: 23 And thou shalt make a table､ of acacia wood,—two cubits the length thereof, and a cubit the breadth thereof, and a cubit and a half the height thereof,

content: 24 and thou shalt overlay it with pure gold,—and shalt make thereto a rim of gold､ round about;
content_old: 24 and thou shalt overlay it with pure gold,—and shalt make thereto a rim of gold､ round about;

content: 25 and thou shalt make thereto a border of a handbreadth､ round about,—and shalt make a rim of gold to the border thereof､ round about;
content_old: 25 and thou shalt make thereto a border of a handbreadth､ round about,—and shalt make a rim of gold to the border thereof､ round about;

content: 26 and thou shalt make to it four rings of gold,—and shalt place the rings､ on the four corners which pertain to the four feet thereof:
content_old: 26 and thou shalt make to it four rings of gold,—and shalt place the rings､ on the four corners which pertain to the four feet thereof:

content: 27 adjoining the border shall be the rings,—as receptacles for the staves, for lifting the table;
content_old: 27 adjoining the border shall be the rings,—as receptacles for the staves, for lifting the table;

content: 28 and thou shalt make the staves､ of acacia wood, and shalt overlay them､ with gold,—and the table shall be lifted there with;
content_old: 28 and thou shalt make the staves､ of acacia wood, and shalt overlay them､ with gold,—and the table shall be lifted there with;

content: 29 and thou shalt make its dishes､ and its pans､ and its basins､ and its bowls, for pouring out therewith,—of pure gold shalt thou make them.
content_old: 29 and thou shalt make its dishes､ and its pans､ and its basins､ and its bowls, for pouring out therewith,—of pure gold shalt thou make them.

content: 30 And thou shalt place upon the table—Presence-bread､ before me continually.
content_old: 30 And thou shalt place upon the table—Presence-bread､ before me continually.

content: 31 And thou shalt make a lampstand of pure gold,—of beaten work shall the lampstand be made, even its base and its shaft, its cups､ its apples､ and its blossoms of the same shall be;
content_old: 31 And thou shalt make a lampstand of pure gold,—of beaten work shall the lampstand be made, even its base and its shaft, its cups､ its apples､ and its blossoms of the same shall be;

content: 32 with six branches coming out of its sides,—three branches of the lampstand out the one side thereof, and three branches of the Iampstand out of the other side thereof:
content_old: 32 with six branches coming out of its sides,—three branches of the lampstand out the one side thereof, and three branches of the Iampstand out of the other side thereof:

content: 33 three cups like almond-flowers in the one branch—apple and blossom, and three cups like almond flowers in the other branch—apple and blossom,—so for the six branches, coming out of the Iampstand.
content_old: 33 three cups like almond-flowers in the one branch—apple and blossom, and three cups like almond flowers in the other branch—apple and blossom,—so for the six branches, coming out of the Iampstand.

content: 34 And in the Iampstand itself four cups,—like almond-flowers—its apples､ and its blossoms;
content_old: 34 And in the Iampstand itself four cups,—like almond-flowers—its apples､ and its blossoms;

content: 35 and an apple under two branches､ of the same, and another apple under two other branches､ of the same, and another apple under two other branches､ of the same,—for the six branches, coming out of the lampstand:
content_old: 35 and an apple under two branches､ of the same, and another apple under two other branches､ of the same, and another apple under two other branches､ of the same,—for the six branches, coming out of the lampstand:

content: 36 their apples and their branches of the same shall be,—all of it of one beaten work､ of pure gold.
content_old: 36 their apples and their branches of the same shall be,—all of it of one beaten work､ of pure gold.

content: 37 And thou shalt make the lamps thereof､ seven,—and one shall light up its lamps, and it shall give light､ over against the face thereof.
content_old: 37 And thou shalt make the lamps thereof､ seven,—and one shall light up its lamps, and it shall give light､ over against the face thereof.

content: 38 And its snuffers､ and its snuff-trays of pure gold.
content_old: 38 And its snuffers､ and its snuff-trays of pure gold.

content: 39 With a talent of pure gold shall he make it,—with all these vessels.
content_old: 39 With a talent of pure gold shall he make it,—with all these vessels.

content: 1 Also the habitation shalt thou make､ with ten curtains,—of twined linen､ and blue､ and purple､ and crimson, with cherubim､ the work of a skilful weaver shalt thou make them.
content_old: 1 Also the habitation shalt thou make､ with ten curtains,—of twined linen､ and blue､ and purple､ and crimson, with cherubim､ the work of a skilful weaver shalt thou make them.

content: 2 The length of each curtain twenty-eight cubits, and the breadth four cubits, of each curtain,—one measure､ for all the curtains.
content_old: 2 The length of each curtain twenty-eight cubits, and the breadth four cubits, of each curtain,—one measure､ for all the curtains.

content: 3 The five curtains shall be joined､ one to another,—and the other five curtains joined､ one to another.
content_old: 3 The five curtains shall be joined､ one to another,—and the other five curtains joined､ one to another.

content: 4 And thou shalt make loops of blue､ on the border of each curtain, at the edge of the set,—and thus shalt thou do in the border of the curtain, that is outmost in the second set:
content_old: 4 And thou shalt make loops of blue､ on the border of each curtain, at the edge of the set,—and thus shalt thou do in the border of the curtain, that is outmost in the second set:

content: 5 fifty loops shalt thou make､ in the one curtain, and fifty loops shalt thou make､ in the edge of the curtain which is in the second set,—the loops being opposite one to another.
content_old: 5 fifty loops shalt thou make､ in the one curtain, and fifty loops shalt thou make､ in the edge of the curtain which is in the second set,—the loops being opposite one to another.

content: 6 And thou shalt make､ fifty clasps of gold,—so shalt thou join the curtains､ one to another､ with the clasps, and thus shall the habitation be one.
content_old: 6 And thou shalt make､ fifty clasps of gold,—so shalt thou join the curtains､ one to another､ with the clasps, and thus shall the habitation be one.

content: 7 And thou shalt make curtains of goat’s hair, for a tent､ over the habitation,—eleven curtains shalt thou make them.
content_old: 7 And thou shalt make curtains of goat’s hair, for a tent､ over the habitation,—eleven curtains shalt thou make them.

content: 8 The length of each curtain thirty cubits, and the breadth four cubits, of each curtain,—one measure to the eleven curtains.
content_old: 8 The length of each curtain thirty cubits, and the breadth four cubits, of each curtain,—one measure to the eleven curtains.

content: 9 And thou shalt join the five curtains by themselves, and the six curtains by themselves,—and thou shalt fold back the sixth curtain, in the forefront of the tent.
content_old: 9 And thou shalt join the five curtains by themselves, and the six curtains by themselves,—and thou shalt fold back the sixth curtain, in the forefront of the tent.

content: 10 And thou shalt make fifty loops on the border of the one curtain, that is outmost in the set,—and fifty loops on the border of the curtain, of the second set.
content_old: 10 And thou shalt make fifty loops on the border of the one curtain, that is outmost in the set,—and fifty loops on the border of the curtain, of the second set.

content: 11 And thou shalt make fifty clasps of bronze,—and bring the clasps into the loops, so shalt thou join the tent､ and it shall be one.
content_old: 11 And thou shalt make fifty clasps of bronze,—and bring the clasps into the loops, so shalt thou join the tent､ and it shall be one.

content: 12 And the overplus that remaineth in the curtains of the tent,—the half curtain that remaineth shall hang over at the back of the habitation.
content_old: 12 And the overplus that remaineth in the curtains of the tent,—the half curtain that remaineth shall hang over at the back of the habitation.

content: 13 And the cubit on the one side､ and the cubit on the other side､ of that which remaineth, in the length of the curtains of the tent shall be hung over the sides of the habitation､ on this side and on that side､ to make a covering.
content_old: 13 And the cubit on the one side､ and the cubit on the other side､ of that which remaineth, in the length of the curtains of the tent shall be hung over the sides of the habitation､ on this side and on that side､ to make a covering.

content: 14 And thou shalt make a covering､ for the tent, of rams’ skins dyed red,—and a covering of badgers’ skins above.
content_old: 14 And thou shalt make a covering､ for the tent, of rams’ skins dyed red,—and a covering of badgers’ skins above.

content: 15 And thou shalt make boards､ for the habitation,—of acacia wood､ to stand up:
content_old: 15 And thou shalt make boards､ for the habitation,—of acacia wood､ to stand up:

content: 16 ten cubits the length of the board,—and a cubit and a half cubit the breadth of each board;
content_old: 16 ten cubits the length of the board,—and a cubit and a half cubit the breadth of each board;

content: 17 two tenons to each board, united one to another,—thus shalt thou make, for all the boards of the habitation.
content_old: 17 two tenons to each board, united one to another,—thus shalt thou make, for all the boards of the habitation.

content: 18 So then thou shalt make the boards for the habitation,—twenty boards, on the south side､ southwards.
content_old: 18 So then thou shalt make the boards for the habitation,—twenty boards, on the south side､ southwards.

content: 19 And forty sockets of silver shalt thou make､ under the twenty boards,—two sockets､ under the one board､ for its two tenons, and two sockets､ under the next board､ for its two tenons.
content_old: 19 And forty sockets of silver shalt thou make､ under the twenty boards,—two sockets､ under the one board､ for its two tenons, and two sockets､ under the next board､ for its two tenons.

content: 20 And on the second side of the habitation､ towards the north twenty boards;
content_old: 20 And on the second side of the habitation､ towards the north twenty boards;

content: 21 and their forty sockets of silver,—two sockets under the one board, and two sockets under the next board.
content_old: 21 and their forty sockets of silver,—two sockets under the one board, and two sockets under the next board.

content: 22 And for the hinderpart of the habitation､ westward shalt thou make six boards.
content_old: 22 And for the hinderpart of the habitation､ westward shalt thou make six boards.

content: 23 And two boards shalt thou make, for the corners of the habitation,—in the hinderpart:
content_old: 23 And two boards shalt thou make, for the corners of the habitation,—in the hinderpart:

content: 24 that they may be double beneath, and at the same time they shall be entire on the top thereof, into each ring,—thus shall it be for them both, for the two corners shall they be.
content_old: 24 that they may be double beneath, and at the same time they shall be entire on the top thereof, into each ring,—thus shall it be for them both, for the two corners shall they be.

content: 25 So shall they be eight boards, and their sockets of silver sixteen sockets,—two sockets under the one board, and two sockets under the next board.
content_old: 25 So shall they be eight boards, and their sockets of silver sixteen sockets,—two sockets under the one board, and two sockets under the next board.

content: 26 And thou shalt make bars､ of acacia wood,—five for the boards of the one side of the habitation,
content_old: 26 And thou shalt make bars､ of acacia wood,—five for the boards of the one side of the habitation,

content: 27 and five bars for the boards of the other side of the habitation, and five bars for the boards of the side of the habitation, at the hinderpart､ westward;
content_old: 27 and five bars for the boards of the other side of the habitation, and five bars for the boards of the side of the habitation, at the hinderpart､ westward;

content: 28 with the middle bar､ in the midst of the boards,—running along from end to end.
content_old: 28 with the middle bar､ in the midst of the boards,—running along from end to end.

content: 29 And the boards shalt thou overlay with gold, and their rings shalt thou make of gold, as receptacles for the bars,—and thou shalt overlay the bars､ with gold.
content_old: 29 And the boards shalt thou overlay with gold, and their rings shalt thou make of gold, as receptacles for the bars,—and thou shalt overlay the bars､ with gold.

content: 30 So shalt thou rear up the habitation, according to the fashion thereof, which thou wast caused to see､ in the mount.
content_old: 30 So shalt thou rear up the habitation, according to the fashion thereof, which thou wast caused to see､ in the mount.

content: 31 And thou shalt make a veil, of blue､ and purple､ and crimson､ and fine-twined linen,—of the work of a skilful weaver shall it be made, with cherubim;
content_old: 31 And thou shalt make a veil, of blue､ and purple､ and crimson､ and fine-twined linen,—of the work of a skilful weaver shall it be made, with cherubim;

content: 32 and thou shalt hang it upon four pillars of acacia､ overlaid with gold, with their hooks of gold,—upon four sockets of silver.
content_old: 32 and thou shalt hang it upon four pillars of acacia､ overlaid with gold, with their hooks of gold,—upon four sockets of silver.

content: 33 And thou shalt hang up the veil under the clasps,—and shalt bring in thither､ within the veil､ the ark of the testimony; and the veil shall make a division for you､ between the holy place and the most holy.
content_old: 33 And thou shalt hang up the veil under the clasps,—and shalt bring in thither､ within the veil､ the ark of the testimony; and the veil shall make a division for you､ between the holy place and the most holy.

content: 34 And thou shalt place the propitiatory､ upon the ark of the testimony,—in the most holy place.
content_old: 34 And thou shalt place the propitiatory､ upon the ark of the testimony,—in the most holy place.

content: 35 And thou shalt set the table outside the veil, and the lampstand､ over against the table, on the side of the habitation､ southward,—and the table shalt thou place on the north side.
content_old: 35 And thou shalt set the table outside the veil, and the lampstand､ over against the table, on the side of the habitation､ southward,—and the table shalt thou place on the north side.

content: 36 And thou shalt make a screen､ for the opening of the tent, of blue､ and purple､ and crimson, and fine-twined linen,—the work of an embroiderer.
content_old: 36 And thou shalt make a screen､ for the opening of the tent, of blue､ and purple､ and crimson, and fine-twined linen,—the work of an embroiderer.

content: 1 And thou shalt make the altar of acacia wood,—of five cubits length､ and five cubits breadth､four square shall the altar be, and three cubits the height thereof.
content_old: 1 And thou shalt make the altar of acacia wood,—of five cubits length､ and five cubits breadth､four square shall the altar be, and three cubits the height thereof.

content: 2 And thou shalt make its horns upon its four corners, of the same shall be its horns,—and thou shalt overlay it with copper.
content_old: 2 And thou shalt make its horns upon its four corners, of the same shall be its horns,—and thou shalt overlay it with copper.

content: 3 And thou shalt make its pans for removing its ashes, and its shovels､ and its sprinkling bowls, and its flesh-hooks､ and its firepans,—all its vessels shalt thou make of bronze.
content_old: 3 And thou shalt make its pans for removing its ashes, and its shovels､ and its sprinkling bowls, and its flesh-hooks､ and its firepans,—all its vessels shalt thou make of bronze.

content: 4 And thou shalt make to it a grating, a network of bronze,—and thou shalt make､ upon the network､ four rings of bronze, upon the four corners thereof.
content_old: 4 And thou shalt make to it a grating, a network of bronze,—and thou shalt make､ upon the network､ four rings of bronze, upon the four corners thereof.

content: 5 And thou shalt place it under the margin of the altar､ beneath,—so shall the network reach unto the midst of the altar.
content_old: 5 And thou shalt place it under the margin of the altar､ beneath,—so shall the network reach unto the midst of the altar.

content: 6 And thou shalt make staves､ for the altar, staves of acacia wood,—and shalt overlay them with copper.
content_old: 6 And thou shalt make staves､ for the altar, staves of acacia wood,—and shalt overlay them with copper.

content: 7 And the staves shall be brought into the rings,—so shall the staves be on the two sides of the altar､ in lifting it:
content_old: 7 And the staves shall be brought into the rings,—so shall the staves be on the two sides of the altar､ in lifting it:

content: 8 Hollow､ with boards shalt thou make it,—as it was showed thee in the mount so shall they make it.
content_old: 8 Hollow､ with boards shalt thou make it,—as it was showed thee in the mount so shall they make it.

content: 9 And thou shalt make the court of the habitation,—on the south side southward hangings for the court､ of fine-twined linen, a hundred cubits in length､ to the one side;
content_old: 9 And thou shalt make the court of the habitation,—on the south side southward hangings for the court､ of fine-twined linen, a hundred cubits in length､ to the one side;

content: 10 and the pillars thereof､ twenty, with their sockets twenty､ of bronze,—and the hooks of the pillars and their cross-rods､ of silver.
content_old: 10 and the pillars thereof､ twenty, with their sockets twenty､ of bronze,—and the hooks of the pillars and their cross-rods､ of silver.

content: 11 And so for the north side､ in length, hangings､ a hundred cubits,—and the pillars thereof twenty､ and their sockets twenty､ of bronze, and the hooks of the pillars and their cross-rods of silver.
content_old: 11 And so for the north side､ in length, hangings､ a hundred cubits,—and the pillars thereof twenty､ and their sockets twenty､ of bronze, and the hooks of the pillars and their cross-rods of silver.

content: 12 And the breadth of the court､ on the west side hangings､ fifty cubits,—their pillars ten, and their sockets ten.
content_old: 12 And the breadth of the court､ on the west side hangings､ fifty cubits,—their pillars ten, and their sockets ten.

content: 13 And the breadth of the court､ on the east side eastward fifty cubits;
content_old: 13 And the breadth of the court､ on the east side eastward fifty cubits;

content: 14 and fifteen cubits､ the hangings for the side-piece,—their pillars three, and their sockets three;
content_old: 14 and fifteen cubits､ the hangings for the side-piece,—their pillars three, and their sockets three;

content: 15 and for the second side-piece fifteen hangings,—their pillars three, and their sockets three.
content_old: 15 and for the second side-piece fifteen hangings,—their pillars three, and their sockets three.

content: 16 And for the gate of the court a screen of twenty cubits, of blue､ and purple､ and crimson､ and fine-twined linen, the work of an embroiderer,—their pillars four, and their sockets four.
content_old: 16 And for the gate of the court a screen of twenty cubits, of blue､ and purple､ and crimson､ and fine-twined linen, the work of an embroiderer,—their pillars four, and their sockets four.

content: 17 All the pillars of the court round about to be joined with cross-rods of silver, and their hooks of silver,—and their sockets of bronze.
content_old: 17 All the pillars of the court round about to be joined with cross-rods of silver, and their hooks of silver,—and their sockets of bronze.

content: 18 The length of the court a hundred cubits､ and the breadth fifty throughout､ and the height five cubits､ of fine-twined linen,—and their sockets､ of bronze.
content_old: 18 The length of the court a hundred cubits､ and the breadth fifty throughout､ and the height five cubits､ of fine-twined linen,—and their sockets､ of bronze.

content: 19 All the utensils of the habitation, throughout all the service thereof,—and all the pins thereof､ and all the pins of the court of bronze.
content_old: 19 All the utensils of the habitation, throughout all the service thereof,—and all the pins thereof､ and all the pins of the court of bronze.

content: 20 Thou thyself therefore､ shalt command the sons of Israel､ that they bring unto thee—pure､ beaten olive-oil, for giving light,—that the lamp may lift up its flame continually.
content_old: 20 Thou thyself therefore､ shalt command the sons of Israel､ that they bring unto thee—pure､ beaten olive-oil, for giving light,—that the lamp may lift up its flame continually.

content: 1 Thou thyself therefore､ bring near unto thee—Aaron thy brother､ and his sons with him､ out of the midst of the sons of Israel, that they may minister as priests unto me,—Aaron, Nadab and Abihu､ Eleazar and Ithamar､ sons of Aaron.
content_old: 1 Thou thyself therefore､ bring near unto thee—Aaron thy brother､ and his sons with him､ out of the midst of the sons of Israel, that they may minister as priests unto me,—Aaron, Nadab and Abihu､ Eleazar and Ithamar､ sons of Aaron.

content: 2 And thou shalt make holy garments for Aaron thy brother,—for glory and for beauty.
content_old: 2 And thou shalt make holy garments for Aaron thy brother,—for glory and for beauty.

content: 3 Thou thyself therefore､ shalt speak unto all the wise-hearted, whom I have filled with the spirit of wisdom,—and they shall make Aaron’s garments､ to hallow him for ministering as priest unto me.
content_old: 3 Thou thyself therefore､ shalt speak unto all the wise-hearted, whom I have filled with the spirit of wisdom,—and they shall make Aaron’s garments､ to hallow him for ministering as priest unto me.

content: 4 These therefore､ are the garments which they shall make—a breastpiece､ and an ephod､ and a robe, and a tunic of checker work､ a turban and a girdle,—so shall they make holy garments､ for Aaron thy brother､ and for his sons, for ministering as priests unto me.
content_old: 4 These therefore､ are the garments which they shall make—a breastpiece､ and an ephod､ and a robe, and a tunic of checker work､ a turban and a girdle,—so shall they make holy garments､ for Aaron thy brother､ and for his sons, for ministering as priests unto me.

content: 5 They themselves therefore､ shall take the gold, and the blue､ and the purple,—and the crimson, and the fine linen.
content_old: 5 They themselves therefore､ shall take the gold, and the blue､ and the purple,—and the crimson, and the fine linen.

content: 6 And they shall make the ephod,—of gold, blue and purple､ crimson and fine-twined linen､ the work of a skilful weaver.
content_old: 6 And they shall make the ephod,—of gold, blue and purple､ crimson and fine-twined linen､ the work of a skilful weaver.

content: 7 Two joining shoulderpieces shall there be to it､ upon the two extremities thereof､ that it may be joined together.
content_old: 7 Two joining shoulderpieces shall there be to it､ upon the two extremities thereof､ that it may be joined together.

content: 8 And the curious band for fastening it､ that is upon it, like the work thereof､ of the same shall it be,—of gold､ blue and purple and crimson､ and fine-twined linen.
content_old: 8 And the curious band for fastening it､ that is upon it, like the work thereof､ of the same shall it be,—of gold､ blue and purple and crimson､ and fine-twined linen.

content: 9 And thou shalt take two onyx stones,—and engrave upon them､ the names of the sons of Israel:
content_old: 9 And thou shalt take two onyx stones,—and engrave upon them､ the names of the sons of Israel:

content: 10 six of their namesll on the one stone,—and the names of the six that remain on the second stone､ according to their births:
content_old: 10 six of their namesll on the one stone,—and the names of the six that remain on the second stone､ according to their births:

content: 11 with the work of a stone engraver, like seal-ring engravings shalt thou engrave the two stones, after the names of the sons of Israel,—to be encircled with settings of gold shalt thou make them.
content_old: 11 with the work of a stone engraver, like seal-ring engravings shalt thou engrave the two stones, after the names of the sons of Israel,—to be encircled with settings of gold shalt thou make them.

content: 12 And thou shalt put the two stones､ upon the shoulder-pieces of the ephod, as stones of memorial､ for the sons of Israel,—so shall Aaron bear their names before Yahweh､ upon his two shoulders, for a memorial.
content_old: 12 And thou shalt put the two stones､ upon the shoulder-pieces of the ephod, as stones of memorial､ for the sons of Israel,—so shall Aaron bear their names before Yahweh､ upon his two shoulders, for a memorial.

content: 13 And thou shalt make ouches of gold;
content_old: 13 And thou shalt make ouches of gold;

content: 14 and two chains of pure gold, like cord shalt thou make them､of wreathen work,—and thou shalt put the wreathen chains on the ouches.
content_old: 14 and two chains of pure gold, like cord shalt thou make them､of wreathen work,—and thou shalt put the wreathen chains on the ouches.

content: 15 And thou shalt make a breastpiece for giving sentence､ the work of a skilful weaver, like the work of the ephod shalt thou make it,—of gold､ blue､ and purple､ and crimson､ and fine-twined linen shalt thou make it.
content_old: 15 And thou shalt make a breastpiece for giving sentence､ the work of a skilful weaver, like the work of the ephod shalt thou make it,—of gold､ blue､ and purple､ and crimson､ and fine-twined linen shalt thou make it.

content: 16 Four-square shall it be､ double,—a span the length thereof､ and a span the breadth thereof.
content_old: 16 Four-square shall it be､ double,—a span the length thereof､ and a span the breadth thereof.

content: 17 And thou shalt set therein､ a setting of stones, four rows of stones,—one row—a sardius､ a topaz､ and an emerald, the first row;
content_old: 17 And thou shalt set therein､ a setting of stones, four rows of stones,—one row—a sardius､ a topaz､ and an emerald, the first row;

content: 18 and the second row a carbuncle､ a sapphire､ and a diamond;
