content_old: 18 and the second row a carbuncle､ a sapphire､ and a diamond;

content: 19 and the third row an opal､ an agate､ and an amethyst;
content_old: 19 and the third row an opal､ an agate､ and an amethyst;

content: 20 and the fourth row a Tarshish stone､ a sardonyx､ and a jasper,—enclosed with gold shall they be when they are set.
content_old: 20 and the fourth row a Tarshish stone､ a sardonyx､ and a jasper,—enclosed with gold shall they be when they are set.

content: 21 And the stones shall be､ after the names of the sons of Israel—twelve､ after their names,—as the engravings of a seal-ring—every one､ after his name shall they be, for the twelve tribes.
content_old: 21 And the stones shall be､ after the names of the sons of Israel—twelve､ after their names,—as the engravings of a seal-ring—every one､ after his name shall they be, for the twelve tribes.

content: 22 And thou shalt make､ upon the breastpiece､ chains like cords､ of wreathen work,—of pure gold.
content_old: 22 And thou shalt make､ upon the breastpiece､ chains like cords､ of wreathen work,—of pure gold.

content: 23 And thou shalt make､ upon the breastpiece､ two rings of gold,—and thou shalt place the two rings､ upon the two ends of the breastpiece.
content_old: 23 And thou shalt make､ upon the breastpiece､ two rings of gold,—and thou shalt place the two rings､ upon the two ends of the breastpiece.

content: 24 And thou shalt hang the two wreathen chains of gold upon the two rings,—upon the ends of the breastpiece;
content_old: 24 And thou shalt hang the two wreathen chains of gold upon the two rings,—upon the ends of the breastpiece;

content: 25 and the other two ends of the two wreathen chains shalt thou fasten upon the two ouches,—so shalt thou hang them upon the shoulderpieces of the ephod､ in the forefront thereof.
content_old: 25 and the other two ends of the two wreathen chains shalt thou fasten upon the two ouches,—so shalt thou hang them upon the shoulderpieces of the ephod､ in the forefront thereof.

content: 26 And thou shalt make two rings of gold, and put them on the two ends of the breastpiece—upon the border thereof, which is on the side of the ephod､ inwards.
content_old: 26 And thou shalt make two rings of gold, and put them on the two ends of the breastpiece—upon the border thereof, which is on the side of the ephod､ inwards.

content: 27 And thou shalt make two rings of gold, and place them upon the two shoulderpieces of the ephod､ beneath､ on the front of the face thereof, over against its joining,—above the curious band of the ephod:
content_old: 27 And thou shalt make two rings of gold, and place them upon the two shoulderpieces of the ephod､ beneath､ on the front of the face thereof, over against its joining,—above the curious band of the ephod:

content: 28 that they may bind the breastpiece､ by the rings thereof､ unto the rings of the ephod､ with a cord of blue, so that it may remain upon the curious band of the ephod,—and the breastpiece not be removed from off the ephod.
content_old: 28 that they may bind the breastpiece､ by the rings thereof､ unto the rings of the ephod､ with a cord of blue, so that it may remain upon the curious band of the ephod,—and the breastpiece not be removed from off the ephod.

content: 29 So shall Aaron bear the names of the sons of Israel､ in the breastpiece for giving sentence､ upon his heart､ when he goeth into the holy place,—for a memorial before Yahweh､ continually.
content_old: 29 So shall Aaron bear the names of the sons of Israel､ in the breastpiece for giving sentence､ upon his heart､ when he goeth into the holy place,—for a memorial before Yahweh､ continually.

content: 30 Thus shalt thou place､ in the breastpiece for giving sentence､ the lights and the perfections, so shall they be upon the heart of Aaron､ when he goeth in before Yahweh,—so shall Aaron bear the sentence of the sons of Israel､ upon his heart､ before Yahweh､ continually.
content_old: 30 Thus shalt thou place､ in the breastpiece for giving sentence､ the lights and the perfections, so shall they be upon the heart of Aaron､ when he goeth in before Yahweh,—so shall Aaron bear the sentence of the sons of Israel､ upon his heart､ before Yahweh､ continually.

content: 31 And thou shalt make the robe of the ephod､ wholly of blue;
content_old: 31 And thou shalt make the robe of the ephod､ wholly of blue;

content: 32 and the opening for his head shall be in the midst thereof,—a border shall there be to the opening thereof round about､ the work of a weaver, like the opening of a coat of mail shall there be to it､ it must not be rent.
content_old: 32 and the opening for his head shall be in the midst thereof,—a border shall there be to the opening thereof round about､ the work of a weaver, like the opening of a coat of mail shall there be to it､ it must not be rent.

content: 33 And thou shalt make upon the skirts thereof､ pomegranates of blue and purple and crimson, upon the skirts thereof､ round about,—and bells of gold in the midst of them､ round about:
content_old: 33 And thou shalt make upon the skirts thereof､ pomegranates of blue and purple and crimson, upon the skirts thereof､ round about,—and bells of gold in the midst of them､ round about:

content: 34 a bell of gold､ and a pomegranate, a bell of gold､ and a pomegranate,—upon the skirts of the robe､ round about.
content_old: 34 a bell of gold､ and a pomegranate, a bell of gold､ and a pomegranate,—upon the skirts of the robe､ round about.

content: 35 And it shall be upon Aaron､ for ministering,—so shall be heard the sound of him—when he goeth into the holy place､ before Yahweh, and cometh out, and dieth not.
content_old: 35 And it shall be upon Aaron､ for ministering,—so shall be heard the sound of him—when he goeth into the holy place､ before Yahweh, and cometh out, and dieth not.

content: 36 And thou shalt make a burnished plate､ of pure gold,—and shalt engrave thereupon､ like the engravings of a seal-ring, Holiness to Yahweh.
content_old: 36 And thou shalt make a burnished plate､ of pure gold,—and shalt engrave thereupon､ like the engravings of a seal-ring, Holiness to Yahweh.

content: 37 And thou shalt put it upon a cord of blue, so shall it be upon the turban,—upon the forefront of the turban shall it be.
content_old: 37 And thou shalt put it upon a cord of blue, so shall it be upon the turban,—upon the forefront of the turban shall it be.

content: 38 So shall it be upon the forehead of Aaron, and Aaron shall bear the iniquity of the hallowed things､ which the sons of Israel shall hallow, for all their hallowed gifts,—and it shall be upon his forehead continually, that there may be acceptance for them､ before Yahweh.
content_old: 38 So shall it be upon the forehead of Aaron, and Aaron shall bear the iniquity of the hallowed things､ which the sons of Israel shall hallow, for all their hallowed gifts,—and it shall be upon his forehead continually, that there may be acceptance for them､ before Yahweh.

content: 39 And thou shalt weave､ in checker work､ the tunic of fine linen, and shalt make a turban of fine linen,—and a girdle shalt thou make､ the work of an embroiderer.
content_old: 39 And thou shalt weave､ in checker work､ the tunic of fine linen, and shalt make a turban of fine linen,—and a girdle shalt thou make､ the work of an embroiderer.

content: 40 And for the sons of Aaron shalt thou make tunics, and shalt make for them girdles,—and caps shalt thou make for them, for glory and for beauty.
content_old: 40 And for the sons of Aaron shalt thou make tunics, and shalt make for them girdles,—and caps shalt thou make for them, for glory and for beauty.

content: 41 And thou shalt clothe therewith､ Aaron thy brother, and his sons､ with him,—and shalt anoint them､ and install them､ and hallow them, so shall they minister as priests unto me.
content_old: 41 And thou shalt clothe therewith､ Aaron thy brother, and his sons､ with him,—and shalt anoint them､ and install them､ and hallow them, so shall they minister as priests unto me.

content: 42 And thou shalt make for them､ breeches of linen, to cover their unseemliness from the loins even unto the thighs shall they be;
content_old: 42 And thou shalt make for them､ breeches of linen, to cover their unseemliness from the loins even unto the thighs shall they be;

content: 1 And this is the thing which thou shalt do to them､ to hallow them､ that they may minister as priests unto me,—Take one young bullock､ and two rams､ without defect;
content_old: 1 And this is the thing which thou shalt do to them､ to hallow them､ that they may minister as priests unto me,—Take one young bullock､ and two rams､ without defect;

content: 2 and bread unleavened､ and cakes unleavened with oil poured over, and wafers unleavened､ anointed with oil,—of fine wheaten meal shalt thou make them;
content_old: 2 and bread unleavened､ and cakes unleavened with oil poured over, and wafers unleavened､ anointed with oil,—of fine wheaten meal shalt thou make them;

content: 3 and thou shalt place them in one basket, and bring them near in the basket,—and the bullock, and the two rams.
content_old: 3 and thou shalt place them in one basket, and bring them near in the basket,—and the bullock, and the two rams.

content: 4 And Aaron and his sons shalt thou bring near, unto the opening of the tent of meeting,—and shalt bathe them in water.
content_old: 4 And Aaron and his sons shalt thou bring near, unto the opening of the tent of meeting,—and shalt bathe them in water.

content: 5 And thou shalt take the garments､ and clothe Aaron—with the tunic, and with the robe of the ephod, and with the ephod､ and with the breastpiece,—and shalt gird him､ with the curious band of the ephod;
content_old: 5 And thou shalt take the garments､ and clothe Aaron—with the tunic, and with the robe of the ephod, and with the ephod､ and with the breastpiece,—and shalt gird him､ with the curious band of the ephod;

content: 6 and shalt put the turban upon his head,—and place the holy crown upon the turban.
content_old: 6 and shalt put the turban upon his head,—and place the holy crown upon the turban.

content: 7 Then shalt thou take the anointing oil, and pour upon his head,—so shalt thou anoint him.
content_old: 7 Then shalt thou take the anointing oil, and pour upon his head,—so shalt thou anoint him.

content: 8 His sons also shalt thou bring near,—and clothe them with tunics;
content_old: 8 His sons also shalt thou bring near,—and clothe them with tunics;

content: 9 and thou shalt gird them with girdles. Aaron and his sons, and twist round for them caps, so shall they have priesthood､ by a statute age-abiding,—so shalt thou install Aaron､ and his sons.
content_old: 9 and thou shalt gird them with girdles. Aaron and his sons, and twist round for them caps, so shall they have priesthood､ by a statute age-abiding,—so shalt thou install Aaron､ and his sons.

content: 10 And thou shalt bring near the bullock, before the tent of meeting,—and Aaron and his sons shall lean their hands upon the head of the bullock;
content_old: 10 And thou shalt bring near the bullock, before the tent of meeting,—and Aaron and his sons shall lean their hands upon the head of the bullock;

content: 11 then shalt thou slay the bullock before Yahweh,—at the opening of the tent of meeting:
content_old: 11 then shalt thou slay the bullock before Yahweh,—at the opening of the tent of meeting:

content: 12 and thou shalt take of the blood of the bullock, and place upon the horns of the altar､ with thy finger,—and all the remaining blood shalt thou pour out at the foundation of the altar;
content_old: 12 and thou shalt take of the blood of the bullock, and place upon the horns of the altar､ with thy finger,—and all the remaining blood shalt thou pour out at the foundation of the altar;

content: 13 and thou shalt take all the fat that covereth the inner part, and the caul upon the liver, and the two kidneys, with the fat which is upon them, and burn as incense on the altar:
content_old: 13 and thou shalt take all the fat that covereth the inner part, and the caul upon the liver, and the two kidneys, with the fat which is upon them, and burn as incense on the altar:

content: 14 but the flesh of the bullock､ and its skin, and its dung shalt thou burn up with fire, outside the camp,—a sin-bearer it is.
content_old: 14 but the flesh of the bullock､ and its skin, and its dung shalt thou burn up with fire, outside the camp,—a sin-bearer it is.

content: 15 One ram also shalt thou take,—and Aaron and his sons shall lean their hands､ upon the head of the ram;
content_old: 15 One ram also shalt thou take,—and Aaron and his sons shall lean their hands､ upon the head of the ram;

content: 16 then shalt thou slay the ram,—and take its blood, and dash upon the altar､ round about;
content_old: 16 then shalt thou slay the ram,—and take its blood, and dash upon the altar､ round about;

content: 17 but the ram itself shalt thou cut up into its pieces,—and shalt bathe its inner part､ and its legs, and lay upon its pieces､ and upon its head;
content_old: 17 but the ram itself shalt thou cut up into its pieces,—and shalt bathe its inner part､ and its legs, and lay upon its pieces､ and upon its head;

content: 18 and shalt burn the whole ram as incense on the altar, an ascending-sacrifice it is to Yahweh,—a satisfying odour, an altar-flame to Yahweh it is.
content_old: 18 and shalt burn the whole ram as incense on the altar, an ascending-sacrifice it is to Yahweh,—a satisfying odour, an altar-flame to Yahweh it is.

content: 19 Then shalt thou take the second ram,—and Aaron and his sons shall lean their hands､ upon the head of the ram;
content_old: 19 Then shalt thou take the second ram,—and Aaron and his sons shall lean their hands､ upon the head of the ram;

content: 20 then shalt thou slay the ram､ and take of its blood､ and place upon the tip of the ear of Aaron､ and upon the tip of the ear of his sons—the right ear, and upon the thumb of their right hand, and upon the great toe of their right foot,—and shalt dash the blood upon the altar､ round about.
content_old: 20 then shalt thou slay the ram､ and take of its blood､ and place upon the tip of the ear of Aaron､ and upon the tip of the ear of his sons—the right ear, and upon the thumb of their right hand, and upon the great toe of their right foot,—and shalt dash the blood upon the altar､ round about.

content: 21 Then shalt thou take of the blood that is upon the altar､ and of the anointing oil, and sprinkle upon Aaron､ and upon his garments, and upon his sons､ and upon the garments of his sons､ with him,—so shall he be hallowed—he､ and his garments, and his sons､ and the garments of his sons､ with him.
content_old: 21 Then shalt thou take of the blood that is upon the altar､ and of the anointing oil, and sprinkle upon Aaron､ and upon his garments, and upon his sons､ and upon the garments of his sons､ with him,—so shall he be hallowed—he､ and his garments, and his sons､ and the garments of his sons､ with him.

content: 22 Then shalt thou take from the ram—the fat and the fat-tail､ and the fat that covereth the inner part､ and the caul of the liver and the two kidneys､ with the fat that is upon them, and the right shoulder,—for a ram of installation it is,—
content_old: 22 Then shalt thou take from the ram—the fat and the fat-tail､ and the fat that covereth the inner part､ and the caul of the liver and the two kidneys､ with the fat that is upon them, and the right shoulder,—for a ram of installation it is,—

content: 23 and one round-cake of bread､ and one cake of oiled bread､ and one wafer,—out of the basket of unleavened cakes, which is before Yahweh;
content_old: 23 and one round-cake of bread､ and one cake of oiled bread､ and one wafer,—out of the basket of unleavened cakes, which is before Yahweh;

content: 24 and shalt lay the whole､ upon the hands of Aaron, and upon the hands of his sons,—then shalt thou wave them to and fro､ as a wave-offering､ before Yahweh;
content_old: 24 and shalt lay the whole､ upon the hands of Aaron, and upon the hands of his sons,—then shalt thou wave them to and fro､ as a wave-offering､ before Yahweh;

content: 25 and shalt take them from their hand, and burn them as incense on the altar､ upon the ascending-sacrifice,—as a satisfying odour､ before Yahweh, an altar-flame it is to Yahweh.
content_old: 25 and shalt take them from their hand, and burn them as incense on the altar､ upon the ascending-sacrifice,—as a satisfying odour､ before Yahweh, an altar-flame it is to Yahweh.

content: 26 Then shalt thou take the breast from the ram of installation､ which is for Aaron, and shalt wave it as a wave-offering､ before Yahweh,—so shall it be thy share.
content_old: 26 Then shalt thou take the breast from the ram of installation､ which is for Aaron, and shalt wave it as a wave-offering､ before Yahweh,—so shall it be thy share.

content: 27 And thou shalt hallow the breast of the wave-offering､ and the shoulder of the heave-offering, which is waved to and fro, and which is heaved up,—from the ram of installation, from that which is for Aaron､ and from that which is for his sons;
content_old: 27 And thou shalt hallow the breast of the wave-offering､ and the shoulder of the heave-offering, which is waved to and fro, and which is heaved up,—from the ram of installation, from that which is for Aaron､ and from that which is for his sons;

content: 28 so shall it belong to Aaron and to his sons､ for an age-abiding statute､ from the sons of Israel, for a heave-offering it is,—and a heave-offering shall it remain､ from the sons of Israel､ out of their peace-offerings, their heave-offering to Yahweh.
content_old: 28 so shall it belong to Aaron and to his sons､ for an age-abiding statute､ from the sons of Israel, for a heave-offering it is,—and a heave-offering shall it remain､ from the sons of Israel､ out of their peace-offerings, their heave-offering to Yahweh.

content: 29 And the holy garments which belong to Aaron shall belong to his sons､ after him,—to be anointed therein, and to be installed therein.
content_old: 29 And the holy garments which belong to Aaron shall belong to his sons､ after him,—to be anointed therein, and to be installed therein.

content: 30 Seven days shall they be put on by him from among his sons who is priest in his stead,—by him who goeth into the tent of meeting､ to minister in the holy place.
content_old: 30 Seven days shall they be put on by him from among his sons who is priest in his stead,—by him who goeth into the tent of meeting､ to minister in the holy place.

content: 31 And the ram of installation shalt thou take,—and shalt boil its flesh､ in a holy place;
content_old: 31 And the ram of installation shalt thou take,—and shalt boil its flesh､ in a holy place;

content: 32 and Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram, and the bread that is in the basket,—at the opening of the tent of meeting:
content_old: 32 and Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram, and the bread that is in the basket,—at the opening of the tent of meeting:

content: 33 thus shall they eat those things wherewith a propitiatory-covering hath been made, to install them､ to hallow them,—but a stranger shall not eat､ for holy they are.
content_old: 33 thus shall they eat those things wherewith a propitiatory-covering hath been made, to install them､ to hallow them,—but a stranger shall not eat､ for holy they are.

content: 34 And if there be left over of the flesh of installation､ or of the bread､ until the morning then shalt thou burn up what is left over, in the fire, it shall not be eaten､ for holy it is.
content_old: 34 And if there be left over of the flesh of installation､ or of the bread､ until the morning then shalt thou burn up what is left over, in the fire, it shall not be eaten､ for holy it is.

content: 35 So then thou shalt do for Aaron and for his sons in this manner, according to all which I have commanded thee,—seven days shalt thou install them.
content_old: 35 So then thou shalt do for Aaron and for his sons in this manner, according to all which I have commanded thee,—seven days shalt thou install them.

content: 36 And a sin-bearing bullock shalt thou offer daily, for them who are to be covered by propitiation, and shalt make a sin-cleansing for the altar､ when thou puttest a propitiatory-covering thereon,—and shalt anoint it､ to hallow it.
content_old: 36 And a sin-bearing bullock shalt thou offer daily, for them who are to be covered by propitiation, and shalt make a sin-cleansing for the altar､ when thou puttest a propitiatory-covering thereon,—and shalt anoint it､ to hallow it.

content: 37 Seven days shalt thou put a propitiatory-covering over the altar, and so shalt hallow it,—thus shall the altar become most holy; whosoever toucheth the altar must be holy.
content_old: 37 Seven days shalt thou put a propitiatory-covering over the altar, and so shalt hallow it,—thus shall the altar become most holy; whosoever toucheth the altar must be holy.

content: 38 This moreover､ is what thou shalt offer upon the altar,—two lambs of a year old､ day by day, continually:
content_old: 38 This moreover､ is what thou shalt offer upon the altar,—two lambs of a year old､ day by day, continually:

content: 39 The one lamb shalt thou offer in the morning,—and the second lamb shalt thou offer between the evenings;
content_old: 39 The one lamb shalt thou offer in the morning,—and the second lamb shalt thou offer between the evenings;

content: 40 and a tenth part of fine meal mingled with a fourth part of the hin of beaten oil, and as a drink-offering a fourth part of the hin of wine,—with the one lamb.
content_old: 40 and a tenth part of fine meal mingled with a fourth part of the hin of beaten oil, and as a drink-offering a fourth part of the hin of wine,—with the one lamb.

content: 41 And the second lamb shalt thou offer between the evenings,—according to the meal-offering of the morning､ and according to the drink-offering thereof shalt thou offer with it, for a satisfying odour, an altar-flame､ to Yahweh:
content_old: 41 And the second lamb shalt thou offer between the evenings,—according to the meal-offering of the morning､ and according to the drink-offering thereof shalt thou offer with it, for a satisfying odour, an altar-flame､ to Yahweh:

content: 42 a continual ascending-sacrifice､ to your generations, at the opening of the tent of meeting､ before Yahweh,—where I will meet with you, to speak unto thee､ there.
content_old: 42 a continual ascending-sacrifice､ to your generations, at the opening of the tent of meeting､ before Yahweh,—where I will meet with you, to speak unto thee､ there.

content: 43 So will I meet there､ with the sons of Israel,—and it shall be hallowed by my glory.
content_old: 43 So will I meet there､ with the sons of Israel,—and it shall be hallowed by my glory.

content: 44 Thus will I hallow the tent of meeting､ and the altar,—and Aaron and his sons will I hallow､ to minister as priests unto me.
content_old: 44 Thus will I hallow the tent of meeting､ and the altar,—and Aaron and his sons will I hallow､ to minister as priests unto me.

content: 45 Thus will I make my habitation in the midst of the sons of Israel,—and will be their God;
content_old: 45 Thus will I make my habitation in the midst of the sons of Israel,—and will be their God;

content: 1 And thou shalt make an altar､ for burning incense,—of acacia wood shalt thou make it:
content_old: 1 And thou shalt make an altar､ for burning incense,—of acacia wood shalt thou make it:

content: 2 a cubit､ the length thereof, and a cubit､ the breadth thereof four square shall it be,—and two cubits､ the height thereof, of the same shall be the horns thereof.
content_old: 2 a cubit､ the length thereof, and a cubit､ the breadth thereof four square shall it be,—and two cubits､ the height thereof, of the same shall be the horns thereof.

content: 3 And thou shalt overlay it with pure gold､ the top thereof､ and the sides thereof round about, and the horns thereof,—and thou shalt make to it a border of gold､ round about.
content_old: 3 And thou shalt overlay it with pure gold､ the top thereof､ and the sides thereof round about, and the horns thereof,—and thou shalt make to it a border of gold､ round about.

content: 4 And two rings of gold shalt thou make to it, under the border thereof､ upon the two corners thereof shalt thou make them on the two sides thereof,—so shall they become receptacles for the staves, to lift it therewith.
content_old: 4 And two rings of gold shalt thou make to it, under the border thereof､ upon the two corners thereof shalt thou make them on the two sides thereof,—so shall they become receptacles for the staves, to lift it therewith.

content: 5 And thou shalt make the staves､ of acacia wood,—and overlay them with gold.
content_old: 5 And thou shalt make the staves､ of acacia wood,—and overlay them with gold.

content: 6 And thou shalt place it before the veil, which is by the ark of the testimony,—before the propitiatory which is upon the testimony, where I will meet thee.
content_old: 6 And thou shalt place it before the veil, which is by the ark of the testimony,—before the propitiatory which is upon the testimony, where I will meet thee.

content: 7 And Aaron shall burn thereon fragrant incense,—morning by morning､ when he trimmeth the lamps shall he burn it;
content_old: 7 And Aaron shall burn thereon fragrant incense,—morning by morning､ when he trimmeth the lamps shall he burn it;

content: 8 and when Aaron lighteth the lamps､ between the evenings shall he burn it,—a continual incense before Yahweh, to your generations.
content_old: 8 and when Aaron lighteth the lamps､ between the evenings shall he burn it,—a continual incense before Yahweh, to your generations.

content: 9 Ye shall not cause to ascend thereupon strange incense, nor an ascending-sacrifice, nor a meal-offering,—and a drink offering shall ye not pour out thereupon.
content_old: 9 Ye shall not cause to ascend thereupon strange incense, nor an ascending-sacrifice, nor a meal-offering,—and a drink offering shall ye not pour out thereupon.

content: 10 But Aaron shall put a propitiatory-covering upon the horns thereof, once in the year: of the blood of the sin-bearer for propitiatory-coverings once in the year shall he put a propitiatory-covering thereupon､ to your generations, most holy it is to Yahweh.
content_old: 10 But Aaron shall put a propitiatory-covering upon the horns thereof, once in the year: of the blood of the sin-bearer for propitiatory-coverings once in the year shall he put a propitiatory-covering thereupon､ to your generations, most holy it is to Yahweh.

content: 11 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying—
content_old: 11 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying—

content: 12 When thou takest the sum of the sons of Israel, by their numberings then shall they give､ every man a propitiatory-covering for his soul to Yahweh､ when they are numbered,—that there may be among them no plague､ when they are numbered.
content_old: 12 When thou takest the sum of the sons of Israel, by their numberings then shall they give､ every man a propitiatory-covering for his soul to Yahweh､ when they are numbered,—that there may be among them no plague､ when they are numbered.

content: 13 This shall they give—every one that passeth over to them that have been numbered—a half-shekel､ by the shekel of the sanctuary,—the shekel is twenty gerahs､—the half-shekel shall be a heave-offering to Yahweh.
content_old: 13 This shall they give—every one that passeth over to them that have been numbered—a half-shekel､ by the shekel of the sanctuary,—the shekel is twenty gerahs､—the half-shekel shall be a heave-offering to Yahweh.

content: 14 All who pass over to the numbered, from twenty years old and upwards shall give the heave-offering of Yahweh.
content_old: 14 All who pass over to the numbered, from twenty years old and upwards shall give the heave-offering of Yahweh.

content: 15 The rich shall not give more､ and the poor shall not give less, than the half-shekel,—when they give the heave-offering of Yahweh, to put a propitiatory-covering over your souls.
content_old: 15 The rich shall not give more､ and the poor shall not give less, than the half-shekel,—when they give the heave-offering of Yahweh, to put a propitiatory-covering over your souls.

content: 16 So then thou shalt take the silver for the propitiatory-coverings､ from the sons of Israel, and shalt expend it upon the service of the tent of meeting,—thus shall it be for the sons of Israel､ as a memorial before Yahweh, to put a propitiatory-covering over your souls.
content_old: 16 So then thou shalt take the silver for the propitiatory-coverings､ from the sons of Israel, and shalt expend it upon the service of the tent of meeting,—thus shall it be for the sons of Israel､ as a memorial before Yahweh, to put a propitiatory-covering over your souls.

content: 17 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying—
content_old: 17 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying—

content: 18 And thou shalt make a laver of bronze､ and its stand of bronze､ for bathing,—and thou shalt place it between the tent of meeting and the altar, and shalt put therein､ water.
content_old: 18 And thou shalt make a laver of bronze､ and its stand of bronze､ for bathing,—and thou shalt place it between the tent of meeting and the altar, and shalt put therein､ water.

content: 19 So shall Aaron and his sons bathe thereat,—their hands､ and their feet.
content_old: 19 So shall Aaron and his sons bathe thereat,—their hands､ and their feet.

content: 20 When they enter the tent of meeting they shall bathe with water､ so shall they not die,—or when they approach unto the altar to minister, to burn as incense an altar-flame to Yahweh:
content_old: 20 When they enter the tent of meeting they shall bathe with water､ so shall they not die,—or when they approach unto the altar to minister, to burn as incense an altar-flame to Yahweh:

content: 21 so then they shall bathe their hands and their feet､ and shall not die,—and it shall be to them an age-abiding statute､ to him and to his seed､ to their generations.
content_old: 21 so then they shall bathe their hands and their feet､ and shall not die,—and it shall be to them an age-abiding statute､ to him and to his seed､ to their generations.

content: 22 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying—
content_old: 22 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying—

content: 23 Thou therefore､ take to thee—principal spices,—self-flowing myrrh five hundred､ and fragrant cinnamon half as much､ two hundred and fifty, and fragrant cane two hundred and fifty;
content_old: 23 Thou therefore､ take to thee—principal spices,—self-flowing myrrh five hundred､ and fragrant cinnamon half as much､ two hundred and fifty, and fragrant cane two hundred and fifty;

content: 24 and cassia five hundred､ by the shekel of the sanctuary,—and oil olive a hin.
content_old: 24 and cassia five hundred､ by the shekel of the sanctuary,—and oil olive a hin.

content: 25 And thou shalt make it an oil for holy anointing, a compounded perfume､ the work of a perfumer,—an oil for holy anointing shall it be.
content_old: 25 And thou shalt make it an oil for holy anointing, a compounded perfume､ the work of a perfumer,—an oil for holy anointing shall it be.

content: 26 And thou shalt anoint therewith､ the tent of meeting,—and the ark of the testimony;
content_old: 26 And thou shalt anoint therewith､ the tent of meeting,—and the ark of the testimony;

content: 27 and the table､ and all its utensils, and the lampstand､ and its utensils,—and the incense altar,
content_old: 27 and the table､ and all its utensils, and the lampstand､ and its utensils,—and the incense altar,

content: 28 and the altar for the ascending-sacrifice､ and all its utensils,—and the laver､ and its stand.
content_old: 28 and the altar for the ascending-sacrifice､ and all its utensils,—and the laver､ and its stand.

content: 29 So shalt thou hallow them, and they shall be most holy,—whosoever toucheth them shall be holy.
content_old: 29 So shalt thou hallow them, and they shall be most holy,—whosoever toucheth them shall be holy.

content: 30 Aaron also､ and his sons shalt thou anoint,—so shalt thou hallow them､ to minister as priests unto me.
content_old: 30 Aaron also､ and his sons shalt thou anoint,—so shalt thou hallow them､ to minister as priests unto me.

content: 31 And unto the sons of Israel shalt thou speak, saying, An oil for holy anointing shall this be to me､ to your generations.
content_old: 31 And unto the sons of Israel shalt thou speak, saying, An oil for holy anointing shall this be to me､ to your generations.

content: 32 Upon the flesh of a common man shall it not be poured, and according to the proportions thereof shall ye not make any like it,—holy it is, holy shall it be to you.
content_old: 32 Upon the flesh of a common man shall it not be poured, and according to the proportions thereof shall ye not make any like it,—holy it is, holy shall it be to you.

content: 33 Whosoever compoundeth any like it, and whosoever bestoweth thereof upon a stranger shall be cut off from among his people.
content_old: 33 Whosoever compoundeth any like it, and whosoever bestoweth thereof upon a stranger shall be cut off from among his people.

content: 34 Then said Yahweh unto Moses— Take to thee aromatic spices､ stacte､ and onycha､ and galbanum､—aromatic spices､ and pure frankincense,��weight for weight shall it be.
content_old: 34 Then said Yahweh unto Moses— Take to thee aromatic spices､ stacte､ and onycha､ and galbanum､—aromatic spices､ and pure frankincense,��weight for weight shall it be.

content: 35 And thou shalt make of it an incense, a perfume､ the work of a perfumer,—salted､ pure､ holy.
content_old: 35 And thou shalt make of it an incense, a perfume､ the work of a perfumer,—salted､ pure､ holy.

content: 36 And thou shalt beat some of it to powder, and place thereof before the testimony､ in the tent of meeting, where I am to meet with thee,—most holy shall it be to you.
content_old: 36 And thou shalt beat some of it to powder, and place thereof before the testimony､ in the tent of meeting, where I am to meet with thee,—most holy shall it be to you.

content: 37 And the incense which thou shalt make according to the proportions thereof ye shall not make for yourselves,—holy shall it be to thee､ to Yahweh.
content_old: 37 And the incense which thou shalt make according to the proportions thereof ye shall not make for yourselves,—holy shall it be to thee､ to Yahweh.

content: 1 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses saying:
content_old: 1 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses saying:

content: 2 See, I have called by name,—Bezaleel､ son of Uri､ son of Hur､ of the tribe of Judah;
content_old: 2 See, I have called by name,—Bezaleel､ son of Uri､ son of Hur､ of the tribe of Judah;

content: 3 and have filled him with the Spirit of God,—in wisdom､ and in understanding､ and in knowledge､ and in all manner of workmanship;
content_old: 3 and have filled him with the Spirit of God,—in wisdom､ and in understanding､ and in knowledge､ and in all manner of workmanship;

content: 4 to devise skilful designs,—to work in gold､ and in silver､ and in bronze;
content_old: 4 to devise skilful designs,—to work in gold､ and in silver､ and in bronze;

content: 5 and in the cutting of stones for setting､ and in the carving of wood,—to work in all manner of workmanship.
content_old: 5 and in the cutting of stones for setting､ and in the carving of wood,—to work in all manner of workmanship.

content: 6 I myself therefore､ lo! I have given with him—Oholiab､ son of Ahisamach､ of the tribe of Dan, and in the heart of every one that is wise-hearted have I put wisdom,—so shall they make all that I have commanded thee:—
content_old: 6 I myself therefore､ lo! I have given with him—Oholiab､ son of Ahisamach､ of the tribe of Dan, and in the heart of every one that is wise-hearted have I put wisdom,—so shall they make all that I have commanded thee:—

content: 7 the tent of meeting､ and the ark of the testimony; and the propitiatory which is thereupon,—and all the utensils of the tent;
content_old: 7 the tent of meeting､ and the ark of the testimony; and the propitiatory which is thereupon,—and all the utensils of the tent;

content: 8 and the table､ and its utensils, and the pure lampstand､ and all its utensils,—and the incense altar;
content_old: 8 and the table､ and its utensils, and the pure lampstand､ and all its utensils,—and the incense altar;

content: 9 and the altar for the ascending-sacrifice､ and all its utensils,—and the laver､ and its stand;
content_old: 9 and the altar for the ascending-sacrifice､ and all its utensils,—and the laver､ and its stand;

content: 10 and the cloths of variegated stuff, and the holy garments､ for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons､ for ministering as priests;
content_old: 10 and the cloths of variegated stuff, and the holy garments､ for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons､ for ministering as priests;

content: 11 and the anointing oil and the fragrant incense､ for the holy place,—according to all which I have commanded thee shall they do.
content_old: 11 and the anointing oil and the fragrant incense､ for the holy place,—according to all which I have commanded thee shall they do.

content: 12 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses saying—
content_old: 12 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses saying—

content: 13 Thou thyself therefore､ speak unto the sons of Israel､ saying— Surely my sabbaths shall ye keep,—for a sign it is betwixt me and you､ to your generations, that ye may know that I—Yahweh do hallow you.
content_old: 13 Thou thyself therefore､ speak unto the sons of Israel､ saying— Surely my sabbaths shall ye keep,—for a sign it is betwixt me and you､ to your generations, that ye may know that I—Yahweh do hallow you.

content: 14 Therefore shall ye keep the sabbath, for holy it is unto you,—he that profaneth it shall be surely put to death; verily whosoever doeth､ therein､ any work that soul shall be cut off from the midst of its people:
content_old: 14 Therefore shall ye keep the sabbath, for holy it is unto you,—he that profaneth it shall be surely put to death; verily whosoever doeth､ therein､ any work that soul shall be cut off from the midst of its people:

content: 15 Six days shall work be done, but on the seventh day is a holy sabbath-keeping of rest､ unto Yahweh,—whosoever doeth work on the sabbath day shall be surely put to death.
content_old: 15 Six days shall work be done, but on the seventh day is a holy sabbath-keeping of rest､ unto Yahweh,—whosoever doeth work on the sabbath day shall be surely put to death.

content: 16 Therefore shall the sons of Israel keep the sabbath,—by making it a Day of Rest to your generations､ as an age-abiding covenant:
content_old: 16 Therefore shall the sons of Israel keep the sabbath,—by making it a Day of Rest to your generations､ as an age-abiding covenant:

content: 17 between me and the sons of Israel a sign it is unto times age-abiding,—for in six days did Yahweh make the heavens and the earth, and on the seventh day he rested､ and was refreshed.
content_old: 17 between me and the sons of Israel a sign it is unto times age-abiding,—for in six days did Yahweh make the heavens and the earth, and on the seventh day he rested､ and was refreshed.

content: 1 And when the people saw that Moses delayed to come down out of the mount the people gathered themselves together unto Aaron､ and said unto him— Up, make for us gods､ who shall go before us, for as for this Moses—the man who brought us up out of the land of Egypt we know not what hath befallen him.
content_old: 1 And when the people saw that Moses delayed to come down out of the mount the people gathered themselves together unto Aaron､ and said unto him— Up, make for us gods､ who shall go before us, for as for this Moses—the man who brought us up out of the land of Egypt we know not what hath befallen him.

content: 2 And Aaron said unto them, Break off the rings of gold, which are in the ears of your wives､ of your sons､ and of your daughters,—and bring them unto me.
content_old: 2 And Aaron said unto them, Break off the rings of gold, which are in the ears of your wives､ of your sons､ and of your daughters,—and bring them unto me.

content: 3 And all the people of themselves brake off the rings of gold which were in their ears,—and brought them unto Aaron.
content_old: 3 And all the people of themselves brake off the rings of gold which were in their ears,—and brought them unto Aaron.

content: 4 And he received the gold at their hand､ and fashioned it with a graving tool, and made it a molten calf,—and they said— These are thy gods､ O Israel, who brought thee up､ out of the land of Egypt.
content_old: 4 And he received the gold at their hand､ and fashioned it with a graving tool, and made it a molten calf,—and they said— These are thy gods､ O Israel, who brought thee up､ out of the land of Egypt.

content: 5 And､ when Aaron saw it､ he built an altar before it. And Aaron made proclamation, and said, A festival to Yahweh to-morrow!
content_old: 5 And､ when Aaron saw it､ he built an altar before it. And Aaron made proclamation, and said, A festival to Yahweh to-morrow!

content: 6 So they rose up early､ on the morrow, and offered ascending-sacrifices, and brought near peace-offerings,—and the people sat down､ to eat and to drink, and then rose up—to make sport!
content_old: 6 So they rose up early､ on the morrow, and offered ascending-sacrifices, and brought near peace-offerings,—and the people sat down､ to eat and to drink, and then rose up—to make sport!

content: 7 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses— Go､ get thee down, for thy people whom thou hast brought up out of the land of Egypt have corrupted themselves.
content_old: 7 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses— Go､ get thee down, for thy people whom thou hast brought up out of the land of Egypt have corrupted themselves.

content: 8 They have turned aside quickly out of the way which I commanded them, they have made for themselves—a molten calf,—and have bowed themselves down thereto､ and have sacrificed thereto､ and have said､ These are thy gods､ O Israel､ who have brought thee up out of the land of Egypt.
content_old: 8 They have turned aside quickly out of the way which I commanded them, they have made for themselves—a molten calf,—and have bowed themselves down thereto､ and have sacrificed thereto､ and have said､ These are thy gods､ O Israel､ who have brought thee up out of the land of Egypt.

content: 9 So then Yahweh said unto Moses,— I have looked on this people, and lo! a stiff-necked people it is.
content_old: 9 So then Yahweh said unto Moses,— I have looked on this people, and lo! a stiff-necked people it is.

content: 10 Now therefore､ let me alone, that mine anger may kindle upon them､ and that I may consume them, and may make of thee a great nation.
content_old: 10 Now therefore､ let me alone, that mine anger may kindle upon them､ and that I may consume them, and may make of thee a great nation.

content: 11 And Moses besought the face of Yahweh his God,—and said— Wherefore､ O Yahweh､ should thine anger kindle upon thy people, whom thou hast brought forth out of the land of Egypt､ with great might､ and with a firm hand?
content_old: 11 And Moses besought the face of Yahweh his God,—and said— Wherefore､ O Yahweh､ should thine anger kindle upon thy people, whom thou hast brought forth out of the land of Egypt､ with great might､ and with a firm hand?

content: 12 Wherefore should the Egyptians speak､ saying— For mischief hath he taken them forth､ to slay them among the mountains, and to make an end of them from off the face of the ground? Turn thou from the kindling of thine anger, and be grieved over the calamity to thy people.
content_old: 12 Wherefore should the Egyptians speak､ saying— For mischief hath he taken them forth､ to slay them among the mountains, and to make an end of them from off the face of the ground? Turn thou from the kindling of thine anger, and be grieved over the calamity to thy people.

content: 13 Have remembrance of Abraham､ of Isaac､ and of Israel､ thy servants､ to whom thou didst swear by thyself, and didst speak unto them saying, I will multiply your seed, as the stars of the heavens,—and all this land of which I have spoken will I give to your seed, and they shall inherit it to times age-abiding.
content_old: 13 Have remembrance of Abraham､ of Isaac､ and of Israel､ thy servants､ to whom thou didst swear by thyself, and didst speak unto them saying, I will multiply your seed, as the stars of the heavens,—and all this land of which I have spoken will I give to your seed, and they shall inherit it to times age-abiding.

content: 14 So then Yahweh was grieved,—over the calamity､—which he had spoken of inflicting on his people.
content_old: 14 So then Yahweh was grieved,—over the calamity､—which he had spoken of inflicting on his people.

content: 15 And Moses turned､ and went down out of the mount, with the two tables of testimony in his hand,—tables written upon､ on both sides of them, on this and on that were they written.
content_old: 15 And Moses turned､ and went down out of the mount, with the two tables of testimony in his hand,—tables written upon､ on both sides of them, on this and on that were they written.

content: 16 Now as for the tables the work of God they were,—and as for the writing the writing of God it was, graven upon the tables.
content_old: 16 Now as for the tables the work of God they were,—and as for the writing the writing of God it was, graven upon the tables.

content: 17 And Joshua heard the noise of the people､ as they shouted,—so he said unto Moses— The noise of war､ in the camp!
content_old: 17 And Joshua heard the noise of the people､ as they shouted,—so he said unto Moses— The noise of war､ in the camp!

content: 18 But he said— Not the noise of the cry of heroism, nor yet the noise of the cry of defeat,—the noise of alternate song do I hear.
content_old: 18 But he said— Not the noise of the cry of heroism, nor yet the noise of the cry of defeat,—the noise of alternate song do I hear.

content: 19 And it came to pass when he drew near unto the camp, and saw the calf､ and the dancings, that the anger of Moses kindled､ and he cast out of his hands the tables, and brake them in pieces､ at the foot of the mountain.
content_old: 19 And it came to pass when he drew near unto the camp, and saw the calf､ and the dancings, that the anger of Moses kindled､ and he cast out of his hands the tables, and brake them in pieces､ at the foot of the mountain.

content: 20 Then took he the calf which they had made､ and burned it in the fire, and ground it till it became powder,—and strewed it on the face of the waters, and made the sons of Israel drink.
content_old: 20 Then took he the calf which they had made､ and burned it in the fire, and ground it till it became powder,—and strewed it on the face of the waters, and made the sons of Israel drink.

content: 21 And Moses said unto Aaron, What had this people done to thee,—that thou shouldst have brought upon them a great sin?
content_old: 21 And Moses said unto Aaron, What had this people done to thee,—that thou shouldst have brought upon them a great sin?

content: 22 And Aaron said, Let not the anger of my lord kindle,—thou thyself knowest the people, that ready for mischief they are.
content_old: 22 And Aaron said, Let not the anger of my lord kindle,—thou thyself knowest the people, that ready for mischief they are.

content: 23 So they said to me— Make for us gods､ who shall go before us,—for as for this Moses—the man who brought us up out of the land of Egypt we know not what hath befallen him.
content_old: 23 So they said to me— Make for us gods､ who shall go before us,—for as for this Moses—the man who brought us up out of the land of Egypt we know not what hath befallen him.

content: 24 And I said to them— Whosoever hath gold let them break it off､ So they gave it to me,—and I cast it into the fire, and there came out—this calf.
content_old: 24 And I said to them— Whosoever hath gold let them break it off､ So they gave it to me,—and I cast it into the fire, and there came out—this calf.

content: 25 And Moses saw the people, that unbridled they were,—for Aaron had given them the rein, for a whispering､ among their enemies.
content_old: 25 And Moses saw the people, that unbridled they were,—for Aaron had given them the rein, for a whispering､ among their enemies.

content: 26 So Moses took his stand in the gate of the camp, and said— Who is for Yahweh?… To me! Then gathered unto him all the sons of Levi.
content_old: 26 So Moses took his stand in the gate of the camp, and said— Who is for Yahweh?… To me! Then gathered unto him all the sons of Levi.

content: 27 And he said to them— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel, Put ye every man his sword upon his thigh,—pass through and return from gate to gate､ in the camp, and slay ye every man his brother､ and every man his friend､ and every man his neighbour.
content_old: 27 And he said to them— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel, Put ye every man his sword upon his thigh,—pass through and return from gate to gate､ in the camp, and slay ye every man his brother､ and every man his friend､ and every man his neighbour.

content: 28 So the sons of Levi did､ according to the word of Moses,—and there fell､ from among the people､ on that day, about three thousand men.
content_old: 28 So the sons of Levi did､ according to the word of Moses,—and there fell､ from among the people､ on that day, about three thousand men.

content: 29 And Moses said— Install yourselves､ to-day､ unto Yahweh, yea every man for his son､ and for his brother,—so will he bestow upon you､ to-day､ a blessing.
content_old: 29 And Moses said— Install yourselves､ to-day､ unto Yahweh, yea every man for his son､ and for his brother,—so will he bestow upon you､ to-day､ a blessing.

content: 30 And it came to pass､ on the morrow, that Moses said unto the people, Ye have sinned a great sin,— Now therefore､ I must go up unto Yahweh, Peradventure I may make a propitiatory-covering for your sin.
content_old: 30 And it came to pass､ on the morrow, that Moses said unto the people, Ye have sinned a great sin,— Now therefore､ I must go up unto Yahweh, Peradventure I may make a propitiatory-covering for your sin.

content: 31 So Moses returned unto Yahweh､ and said,— Oh now! this people hath sinned a great sin, and they have made for themselves—gods of gold.
content_old: 31 So Moses returned unto Yahweh､ and said,— Oh now! this people hath sinned a great sin, and they have made for themselves—gods of gold.

content: 32 Now therefore､if thou wilt forgive their sin … but if not blot me､ I pray thee､ out of thy book､ which thou hast written.
content_old: 32 Now therefore､if thou wilt forgive their sin … but if not blot me､ I pray thee､ out of thy book､ which thou hast written.

content: 33 And Yahweh said unto Moses,— Him who hath sinned against me must I blot out of my book.
content_old: 33 And Yahweh said unto Moses,— Him who hath sinned against me must I blot out of my book.

content: 34 Now therefore､ go lead the people to the place of which I spake to thee, lo! my messenger shall go before thee,— But in the day when I do visit then will I visit upon them､ their sin.
content_old: 34 Now therefore､ go lead the people to the place of which I spake to thee, lo! my messenger shall go before thee,— But in the day when I do visit then will I visit upon them､ their sin.

content: 1 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses— Get thee away､ go up from hence, thou､ and the people whom thou hast brought up out of the land of Egypt,—into the land of which I sware to Abraham､ to Isaac､ and to Jacob､ saying, To thy seed will I give it;
content_old: 1 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses— Get thee away､ go up from hence, thou､ and the people whom thou hast brought up out of the land of Egypt,—into the land of which I sware to Abraham､ to Isaac､ and to Jacob､ saying, To thy seed will I give it;

content: 2 And I will send before thee a messenger,—and will drive out the Canaanite､ the Amorite, and the Hittite､ and the Perizzite, the Hivite､ and the Jebusite;
content_old: 2 And I will send before thee a messenger,—and will drive out the Canaanite､ the Amorite, and the Hittite､ and the Perizzite, the Hivite､ and the Jebusite;

content: 3 into a land flowing with milk and honey,—for I will not go up in thy midst､ in that a stiff-necked people thou art, lest I consume thee､ in the way.
content_old: 3 into a land flowing with milk and honey,—for I will not go up in thy midst､ in that a stiff-necked people thou art, lest I consume thee､ in the way.

content: 4 And when the people heard these evil tidings they afflicted themselves,—and they put not､ any man､ his ornaments､ upon him.
content_old: 4 And when the people heard these evil tidings they afflicted themselves,—and they put not､ any man､ his ornaments､ upon him.

content: 5 Then said Yahweh unto Moses— Say unto the sons of Israel､ Ye are a stiff-necked people, in one moment—if I should go up in thy midst should I make an end of thee,— Now therefore､ lay down thine ornaments from off thee, that I may see what I must do with thee.
content_old: 5 Then said Yahweh unto Moses— Say unto the sons of Israel､ Ye are a stiff-necked people, in one moment—if I should go up in thy midst should I make an end of thee,— Now therefore､ lay down thine ornaments from off thee, that I may see what I must do with thee.

content: 6 So then the sons of Israel stripped themselves of their ornaments､ and moved on from Mount Horeb.
content_old: 6 So then the sons of Israel stripped themselves of their ornaments､ and moved on from Mount Horeb.

content: 7 And Moses proceeded to take a tent､ and pitch it by itself outside the camp､ afar off from the camp, and he called it､ The Tent of Meeting,—and so it came to pass that whosoever was seeking Yahweh went out unto the tent of meeting, which was on the outside of the camp.
content_old: 7 And Moses proceeded to take a tent､ and pitch it by itself outside the camp､ afar off from the camp, and he called it､ The Tent of Meeting,—and so it came to pass that whosoever was seeking Yahweh went out unto the tent of meeting, which was on the outside of the camp.

content: 8 And it came about､ that when Moses went out unto the tent all the people used to rise up, and station themselves､ every man at the opening of his tent,—and they watched Moses, until he entered the tent.
content_old: 8 And it came about､ that when Moses went out unto the tent all the people used to rise up, and station themselves､ every man at the opening of his tent,—and they watched Moses, until he entered the tent.

content: 9 And it came to pass that when Moses entered the tent the pillar of cloud came down, and stood at the opening of the tent,—and spake with Moses.
content_old: 9 And it came to pass that when Moses entered the tent the pillar of cloud came down, and stood at the opening of the tent,—and spake with Moses.

content: 10 And when all the people beheld the pillar of cloud, standing at the opening of the tent then all the people rose up､ and bowed themselves down, every man at the entrance of his tent.
content_old: 10 And when all the people beheld the pillar of cloud, standing at the opening of the tent then all the people rose up､ and bowed themselves down, every man at the entrance of his tent.

content: 11 Thus Yahweh used to speak unto Moses､ face to face, as a man speaketh unto his friend,—and when he returned unto the camp his attendant､ Joshua､ son of Nun､ a young man moved not from the midst of the tent.
content_old: 11 Thus Yahweh used to speak unto Moses､ face to face, as a man speaketh unto his friend,—and when he returned unto the camp his attendant､ Joshua､ son of Nun､ a young man moved not from the midst of the tent.

content: 12 Then said Moses､ unto Yahweh, See! thou art saying unto me— Take up this people, and yet thou hast not let me know､ whom thou wilt send with me,—though thou thyself didst say— I acknowledge thee by name, Yea､ moreover､ thou hast found favour､ in mine eyes.
content_old: 12 Then said Moses､ unto Yahweh, See! thou art saying unto me— Take up this people, and yet thou hast not let me know､ whom thou wilt send with me,—though thou thyself didst say— I acknowledge thee by name, Yea､ moreover､ thou hast found favour､ in mine eyes.

content: 13 Now therefore､if､ I pray thee､ I have found favour in thine eyes let me know､ I beseech thee､ thy way, that I may acknowledge thee､ to the intent I may find favour in thine eyes,—see thou､ therefore､ that this nation is thine own people.
content_old: 13 Now therefore､if､ I pray thee､ I have found favour in thine eyes let me know､ I beseech thee､ thy way, that I may acknowledge thee､ to the intent I may find favour in thine eyes,—see thou､ therefore､ that this nation is thine own people.

content: 14 So then he said,— Mine own presence shall go on､ thus will I give thee rest.
content_old: 14 So then he said,— Mine own presence shall go on､ thus will I give thee rest.

content: 15 And he said unto him,— If thy presence is not going on do not take us up from hence.
content_old: 15 And he said unto him,— If thy presence is not going on do not take us up from hence.

content: 16 Whereby､ indeed､ shall it be known､ then､ that I have found favour in thine eyes､ I､ and thy people ? Shall it not be､ by thy going on with us? So shall we be more distinguished, I､ and thy people, than any people that are on the face of the ground.
content_old: 16 Whereby､ indeed､ shall it be known､ then､ that I have found favour in thine eyes､ I､ and thy people ? Shall it not be､ by thy going on with us? So shall we be more distinguished, I､ and thy people, than any people that are on the face of the ground.

content: 17 Then said Yahweh､ unto Moses: Even this thing､ which thou hast spoken will I do,— For thou hast found favour in mine eyes, And I have acknowledged thee by name.
content_old: 17 Then said Yahweh､ unto Moses: Even this thing､ which thou hast spoken will I do,— For thou hast found favour in mine eyes, And I have acknowledged thee by name.

content: 18 And he said,— Show me､ I pray thee､ thy glory.
content_old: 18 And he said,— Show me､ I pray thee､ thy glory.

content: 19 And he said— I will cause all my goodness､ to pass before thee, And will proclaim myself by the name Yahweh､ before thee,— And will shew favour､ unto whom I may show favour, And will have compassion on whom I may have compassion.
content_old: 19 And he said— I will cause all my goodness､ to pass before thee, And will proclaim myself by the name Yahweh､ before thee,— And will shew favour､ unto whom I may show favour, And will have compassion on whom I may have compassion.

content: 20 But he said— Thou canst not see my face,— For no son of earth can see me､ and live.
content_old: 20 But he said— Thou canst not see my face,— For no son of earth can see me､ and live.

content: 21 And Yahweh said, Lo! a place near me,— So then thou shalt station thyself upon the rock;
content_old: 21 And Yahweh said, Lo! a place near me,— So then thou shalt station thyself upon the rock;

content: 22 And it shall be while my glory passeth by I will put thee in the cleft of the rock,—and will cover thee with my hand､ while I pass by:
content_old: 22 And it shall be while my glory passeth by I will put thee in the cleft of the rock,—and will cover thee with my hand､ while I pass by:

content: 1 And Yahweh said unto Moses— Hew thee two tables of stone､ like the first,—and I will write upon the tables､ the words which were upon the first tables､ which thou didst break in pieces;
content_old: 1 And Yahweh said unto Moses— Hew thee two tables of stone､ like the first,—and I will write upon the tables､ the words which were upon the first tables､ which thou didst break in pieces;

content: 2 and be thou ready by the morning,—and thou shalt come up､ in the morning､ into Mount Sinai; then shalt thou station thyself for me there､ upon the top of the mount;
content_old: 2 and be thou ready by the morning,—and thou shalt come up､ in the morning､ into Mount Sinai; then shalt thou station thyself for me there､ upon the top of the mount;

content: 3 and no man may come up with thee, and let no man so much as be seen､ in all the mount,—and let not even the flocks or the herds feed､ in front of that mountain.
content_old: 3 and no man may come up with thee, and let no man so much as be seen､ in all the mount,—and let not even the flocks or the herds feed､ in front of that mountain.

content: 4 So he hewed two tables of stone､ like the first, and Moses rose up early in the morning､ and went up into Mount Sinai, as Yahweh had commanded him,—and took in his hand two tables of stone.
content_old: 4 So he hewed two tables of stone､ like the first, and Moses rose up early in the morning､ and went up into Mount Sinai, as Yahweh had commanded him,—and took in his hand two tables of stone.

content: 5 And Yahweh descended in the cloud, and took his station with him､ there,—and proclaimed himself by the name Yahweh.
content_old: 5 And Yahweh descended in the cloud, and took his station with him､ there,—and proclaimed himself by the name Yahweh.

content: 6 So Yahweh passed before him､ and proclaimed,— Yahweh､ Yahweh, A GOD of compassion､ and favour,— Slow to anger､ and abundant in lovingkindness and faithfulness:
content_old: 6 So Yahweh passed before him､ and proclaimed,— Yahweh､ Yahweh, A GOD of compassion､ and favour,— Slow to anger､ and abundant in lovingkindness and faithfulness:

content: 7 Keeping lovingkindness to a thousand generations, Forgiving iniquity､ and transgression､ and sin, Though he leave not utterly unpunished, Visiting the iniquity of fathers Upon sons､ And upon sons’ sons, Unto a third and unto a fourth generation.
content_old: 7 Keeping lovingkindness to a thousand generations, Forgiving iniquity､ and transgression､ and sin, Though he leave not utterly unpunished, Visiting the iniquity of fathers Upon sons､ And upon sons’ sons, Unto a third and unto a fourth generation.

content: 8 Then Moses made haste,—and bent his head towards the earth､ and bowed himself down;
content_old: 8 Then Moses made haste,—and bent his head towards the earth､ and bowed himself down;

content: 9 and said— If､ I pray thee､ I have found favour in thine eyes､ O My Lord I pray thee let My Lord go on､ in our midst,—although a stiff-necked people it is, so wilt thou pardon our iniquity and our sin､ and take us as thine own.
content_old: 9 and said— If､ I pray thee､ I have found favour in thine eyes､ O My Lord I pray thee let My Lord go on､ in our midst,—although a stiff-necked people it is, so wilt thou pardon our iniquity and our sin､ and take us as thine own.

content: 10 And he said— Lo! I am about to solemnise a covenant,—in presence of all thy people will I do marvellous things, which have not been created in any part of the earth､ nor among any of the nations,—so shall all the people in whose midst thou art､ see the work of Yahweh､ for a fearful thing it is, which I am doing with thee.
content_old: 10 And he said— Lo! I am about to solemnise a covenant,—in presence of all thy people will I do marvellous things, which have not been created in any part of the earth､ nor among any of the nations,—so shall all the people in whose midst thou art､ see the work of Yahweh､ for a fearful thing it is, which I am doing with thee.

content: 11 Take thou heed what I am commanding thee this day,—behold me! driving out from before thee—the Amorite､ and the Canaanite, and the Hittite､ and the Perizzite, and the Hivite､ and the Jebusite.
content_old: 11 Take thou heed what I am commanding thee this day,—behold me! driving out from before thee—the Amorite､ and the Canaanite, and the Hittite､ and the Perizzite, and the Hivite､ and the Jebusite.

content: 12 Take heed to thyself､ Lest thou solemnise a covenant with the inhabitant of the land, whereupon thou art about to enter,— Lest he become a snare in thy midst;
content_old: 12 Take heed to thyself､ Lest thou solemnise a covenant with the inhabitant of the land, whereupon thou art about to enter,— Lest he become a snare in thy midst;

content: 13 For their altars shall ye smash, And their pillars shall ye shiver,— And their sacred-stems shall ye fell.
content_old: 13 For their altars shall ye smash, And their pillars shall ye shiver,— And their sacred-stems shall ye fell.

content: 14 For thou shalt not bow thyself down to another GOD,— For as for Yahweh Jealous is his name, A jealous GOD he is:
content_old: 14 For thou shalt not bow thyself down to another GOD,— For as for Yahweh Jealous is his name, A jealous GOD he is:

content: 15 Lest thou solemnise a covenant､ with the inhabitant of the land,— And then as surely as they go unchastely after their gods､ and sacrifice to their gods So surely will he invite thee, And thou wilt eat of his sacrifice;
content_old: 15 Lest thou solemnise a covenant､ with the inhabitant of the land,— And then as surely as they go unchastely after their gods､ and sacrifice to their gods So surely will he invite thee, And thou wilt eat of his sacrifice;

content: 16 And thou wilt take of his daughters､ for thy sons,— And his daughters will go unchastely after their gods, And will cause thy sons to go unchastely after their gods.
content_old: 16 And thou wilt take of his daughters､ for thy sons,— And his daughters will go unchastely after their gods, And will cause thy sons to go unchastely after their gods.

content: 17 Molten gods shalt thou not make to thee.
content_old: 17 Molten gods shalt thou not make to thee.

content: 18 The festival of unleavened cakes shalt thou keep, seven days shalt thou eat unleavened cakes､ which I commanded thee, at the set time､ in the month Abib,—for in the month Abib camest thou forth out of Egypt.
content_old: 18 The festival of unleavened cakes shalt thou keep, seven days shalt thou eat unleavened cakes､ which I commanded thee, at the set time､ in the month Abib,—for in the month Abib camest thou forth out of Egypt.

content: 19 Every one that is the first to be born is mine,—and every one of thy cattle that is born a male, firstling of oxen or sheep.
content_old: 19 Every one that is the first to be born is mine,—and every one of thy cattle that is born a male, firstling of oxen or sheep.

content: 20 But the firstling of an ass thou mayst redeem with a lamb, and if thou wilt not redeem it then shalt thou break its neck. Every firstborn of thy sons shalt thou redeem, and he must not see my face with empty hand.
content_old: 20 But the firstling of an ass thou mayst redeem with a lamb, and if thou wilt not redeem it then shalt thou break its neck. Every firstborn of thy sons shalt thou redeem, and he must not see my face with empty hand.

content: 21 Six days shalt thou labour, but on the seventh day shalt thou rest,—in plowing time and in harvest shalt thou rest.
content_old: 21 Six days shalt thou labour, but on the seventh day shalt thou rest,—in plowing time and in harvest shalt thou rest.

content: 22 And the festival of weeks shalt thou make to thee, the firstfruits of the wheat harvest,—and the festival of ingathering, at the closing in of the year:
content_old: 22 And the festival of weeks shalt thou make to thee, the firstfruits of the wheat harvest,—and the festival of ingathering, at the closing in of the year:

content: 23 three times in the year shall every one of thy males see the face of the Lord�� Yahweh､ the God of Israel.
content_old: 23 three times in the year shall every one of thy males see the face of the Lord�� Yahweh､ the God of Israel.

content: 24 For I will root out nations from before thee, and will enlarge thy borders,—and no man shall covet thy land, when thou goest up to see the face of Yahweh thy God, three times in the year.
content_old: 24 For I will root out nations from before thee, and will enlarge thy borders,—and no man shall covet thy land, when thou goest up to see the face of Yahweh thy God, three times in the year.

content: 25 Thou shalt not slay､ along with anything leavened､ the blood of my sacrifice,—neither shall remain to the morning, the sacrifice of the festival of the passover.
content_old: 25 Thou shalt not slay､ along with anything leavened､ the blood of my sacrifice,—neither shall remain to the morning, the sacrifice of the festival of the passover.

content: 26 The beginning of the firstfruits of thy ground shalt thou bring into the house of Yahweh, thy God. Thou shalt not boil a kid､ in the milk of its dam.
content_old: 26 The beginning of the firstfruits of thy ground shalt thou bring into the house of Yahweh, thy God. Thou shalt not boil a kid､ in the milk of its dam.

content: 27 And Yahweh said unto Moses, Write for thyself these words,—for according to the tenor of these words have I solemnized with thee､ a covenant, and with Israel.
content_old: 27 And Yahweh said unto Moses, Write for thyself these words,—for according to the tenor of these words have I solemnized with thee､ a covenant, and with Israel.

content: 28 So then he was there､ with Yahweh､ forty days and forty nights, bread did he not eat､ and water did he not drink,—and He wrote upon the tables､ the words of the covenant, the ten words.
content_old: 28 So then he was there､ with Yahweh､ forty days and forty nights, bread did he not eat､ and water did he not drink,—and He wrote upon the tables､ the words of the covenant, the ten words.

content: 29 And it came to pass when Moses came down out of Mount Sinai, with the two tables of testimony in the hand of Moses､ when he came down out of the mouut that Moses knew not that the skin of his face shone､ through his having spoken with him.
content_old: 29 And it came to pass when Moses came down out of Mount Sinai, with the two tables of testimony in the hand of Moses､ when he came down out of the mouut that Moses knew not that the skin of his face shone､ through his having spoken with him.

content: 30 And Aaron and all the sons of Israel saw Moses, and lo! the skin of his face shone,—and they stood in awe of drawing nigh unto him.
content_old: 30 And Aaron and all the sons of Israel saw Moses, and lo! the skin of his face shone,—and they stood in awe of drawing nigh unto him.

content: 31 So then Moses called unto them, and Aaron and all the princes in the assembly returned unto him,—and Moses spake unto them.
content_old: 31 So then Moses called unto them, and Aaron and all the princes in the assembly returned unto him,—and Moses spake unto them.

content: 32 And afterwards came nigh､ all the sons of Israel,—and he gave them in commandment all that Yahweh had spoken with him､ in Mount Sinai.
content_old: 32 And afterwards came nigh､ all the sons of Israel,—and he gave them in commandment all that Yahweh had spoken with him､ in Mount Sinai.

content: 33 And when Moses had made an end of speaking with them he put over his face､ a veil;
content_old: 33 And when Moses had made an end of speaking with them he put over his face､ a veil;

content: 34 but as often as Moses went in before Yahweh､ to speak with him he put aside the veil､ until he came out,—and as often as he came out and spake unto the sons of Israel､ that which he had been commanded
content_old: 34 but as often as Moses went in before Yahweh､ to speak with him he put aside the veil､ until he came out,—and as often as he came out and spake unto the sons of Israel､ that which he had been commanded

content: 1 And Moses called together all the assembly of the sons of Israel､ and said unto them,— These are the things which Yahweh hath commanded､ to do them.
content_old: 1 And Moses called together all the assembly of the sons of Israel､ and said unto them,— These are the things which Yahweh hath commanded､ to do them.

content: 2 Six days shall work be done, but on the seventh day shall there be to you a holy sabbath-keeping､ unto Yahweh,—whosoever doeth work therein shall be put to death.
content_old: 2 Six days shall work be done, but on the seventh day shall there be to you a holy sabbath-keeping､ unto Yahweh,—whosoever doeth work therein shall be put to death.

content: 3 Ye shall not kindle a fire､ in any of your dwellings,—on the sabbath day.
content_old: 3 Ye shall not kindle a fire､ in any of your dwellings,—on the sabbath day.

content: 4 And Moses spake unto all the assembly of the sons of Israel､ saying､— This is the thing which Yahweh hath commanded､ saying,—
content_old: 4 And Moses spake unto all the assembly of the sons of Israel､ saying､— This is the thing which Yahweh hath commanded､ saying,—

content: 5 Take ye from among you､ a heave-offering to Yahweh, every one whose heart is willing shall bring it in, even the heave-offering of Yahweh,—gold and silver､ and bronze;
content_old: 5 Take ye from among you､ a heave-offering to Yahweh, every one whose heart is willing shall bring it in, even the heave-offering of Yahweh,—gold and silver､ and bronze;

content: 6 and blue and purple､ and crimson､ and fine linen and goat’s-hair;
content_old: 6 and blue and purple､ and crimson､ and fine linen and goat’s-hair;

content: 7 and rams’ skins dyed red､ and badgers’ skins､ and acacia wood;
content_old: 7 and rams’ skins dyed red､ and badgers’ skins､ and acacia wood;

content: 8 and oil for giving light,—and aromatic spices for the anointing oil, and for fragrant incense;
content_old: 8 and oil for giving light,—and aromatic spices for the anointing oil, and for fragrant incense;

content: 9 and onyx stones､ and setting stones,—for the ephod､ and for the breastpiece.
content_old: 9 and onyx stones､ and setting stones,—for the ephod､ and for the breastpiece.

content: 10 And all the wise-hearted among you shall come in, that they may make､ all that which Yahweh hath commanded:—
content_old: 10 And all the wise-hearted among you shall come in, that they may make､ all that which Yahweh hath commanded:—

content: 11 the habitation, its tent､ and its covering,—its clasps､ its boards, and its bars､ its pillars､ and its sockets;
content_old: 11 the habitation, its tent､ and its covering,—its clasps､ its boards, and its bars､ its pillars､ and its sockets;

content: 12 the ark with its staves､ the propitiatory,—and the screening veil;
content_old: 12 the ark with its staves､ the propitiatory,—and the screening veil;

content: 13 the table with its staves､ and all its utensils, and the Presence-bread;
content_old: 13 the table with its staves､ and all its utensils, and the Presence-bread;

content: 14 the lampstand for giving light､ with its utensils､ and its lamps,—and the oil for giving light;
content_old: 14 the lampstand for giving light､ with its utensils､ and its lamps,—and the oil for giving light;

content: 15 and the incense altar､ with its staves, and the anointing oil, and the fragrant incense,—and the entrance screen､ for the entrance of the habitation;
content_old: 15 and the incense altar､ with its staves, and the anointing oil, and the fragrant incense,—and the entrance screen､ for the entrance of the habitation;

content: 16 the altar for the ascending-sacrifice, and the bronze grating which pertaineth thereto, its staves､ and all its utensils,—the laver､ and its stand;
content_old: 16 the altar for the ascending-sacrifice, and the bronze grating which pertaineth thereto, its staves､ and all its utensils,—the laver､ and its stand;

content: 17 the hangings for the court, its pillars､ and its sockets,—and the screen for the gate of the court;
content_old: 17 the hangings for the court, its pillars､ and its sockets,—and the screen for the gate of the court;

content: 18 the pins of the habitation､ and the pins of the court､ and their cords;
content_old: 18 the pins of the habitation､ and the pins of the court､ and their cords;

content: 19 the cloths of variegated stuff､ for ministering in the sanctuary,—the sacred garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons､ for ministering as priests.
content_old: 19 the cloths of variegated stuff､ for ministering in the sanctuary,—the sacred garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons､ for ministering as priests.

content: 20 So all the assembly of the sons of Israel went forth from the presence of Moses;
content_old: 20 So all the assembly of the sons of Israel went forth from the presence of Moses;

content: 21 and they brought in—every man whose heart lifted him up,—and every one whose spirit made him willing brought in the heave-offering of Yahweh､ for the construction of the tent of meeting､ and for all its service, and for the holy garments.
content_old: 21 and they brought in—every man whose heart lifted him up,—and every one whose spirit made him willing brought in the heave-offering of Yahweh､ for the construction of the tent of meeting､ and for all its service, and for the holy garments.

content: 22 Yea they brought in—the men with the women,—all who were willing-hearted brought in—bracelets and nose-ornaments､ and rings､ and buckles, all manner of jewels of gold, even every man who waved a wave-offering of gold unto Yahweh.
content_old: 22 Yea they brought in—the men with the women,—all who were willing-hearted brought in—bracelets and nose-ornaments､ and rings､ and buckles, all manner of jewels of gold, even every man who waved a wave-offering of gold unto Yahweh.

content: 23 And every man with whom was found—blue and purple and crimson､ and fine linen and goat’s-hair,—and rams’ skins dyed red､ and badgers’ skins brought them in.
content_old: 23 And every man with whom was found—blue and purple and crimson､ and fine linen and goat’s-hair,—and rams’ skins dyed red､ and badgers’ skins brought them in.

content: 24 Every one who would heave a heave-offering of silver､ or bronze brought in the heave-offering of Yahweh,—and every one with whom was found acacia wood､ for any construction for the service brought it in.
content_old: 24 Every one who would heave a heave-offering of silver､ or bronze brought in the heave-offering of Yahweh,—and every one with whom was found acacia wood､ for any construction for the service brought it in.

content: 25 And all the women who were wise-hearted with their hands did spin,—and brought in that which they had spun—the blue､ and the purple, the crimson､ and the fine linen.
content_old: 25 And all the women who were wise-hearted with their hands did spin,—and brought in that which they had spun—the blue､ and the purple, the crimson､ and the fine linen.

content: 26 And all the women whose hearts lifted them up with wisdom span the goat’s-hair.
content_old: 26 And all the women whose hearts lifted them up with wisdom span the goat’s-hair.

content: 27 And the princes brought in the onyx stones and the setting stones,—for the ephod､ and for the breastpiece;
content_old: 27 And the princes brought in the onyx stones and the setting stones,—for the ephod､ and for the breastpiece;

content: 28 and the aromatic spices､ and the oil,—for giving light, and for anointing oil, and for the fragrant incense.
content_old: 28 and the aromatic spices､ and the oil,—for giving light, and for anointing oil, and for the fragrant incense.

content: 29 In the case of every man and woman､ whose heart made them willing, to bring in for any construction which Yahweh had commanded them to make､ by the hand of Moses in their case did the sons of Israel bring in a free-will offering unto Yahweh.
content_old: 29 In the case of every man and woman､ whose heart made them willing, to bring in for any construction which Yahweh had commanded them to make､ by the hand of Moses in their case did the sons of Israel bring in a free-will offering unto Yahweh.
